loans.name: Faridah

texts.en:
Faridah N. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Faridah has a business of a retail shop, which she has had for 1 year.         

To help expand her business, Faridah has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase soap and sugar. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Faridah hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, Faridah hopes to study and become a pilot.

Faridah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by always having educational discussions among themselves.

loans.use: To buy soap and sugar.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “PACHA ILLAIRY ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Ocongate perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Jesusa;   la socia tiene 42 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, la socia se dedica  a la compra y venta de semillas fertilizantes, alquiler de terrenos, compra de ganados y agricultura, la socia apoya a su conyugue en tod lo referente a la agricultura y ganadería; pero la socia también está dedicada en estos últimos meses a la artesanía ella teje mantas y las lleva a vender al pueblo, la socia cuando no está apoyando a su conyugue teje como parte de distraerse y hace frazadas también.  La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas y alquiler de terreno para su nueva siembra.

La socia  agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member is part of the PACHA ILLAIRY village bank, located in the Ocongate district of Quispicanchis in the department of Cusco. 

Her name is Jesusa: she 42 years old and has three children. She buys and sells fertilized seeds, rents land, buys cattle and agriculture, and supports her spouse with his agriculture and livestock. In the past couple of months she has also worked as an artisan, sewing blankets that she sells in the village. When she is not supporting her husband she sews as a way to distract herself. She is requesting this loan to invest it in the purchase of seeds and to rent the land for her new crop. 

This member appreciates and values this loan and promises to fulfill the repayment of her loan in the established timeframe.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and rent land for her crop

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma D. is a widow who lives in Purok 2, Barangay 9, Victorias City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating four business ventures. She sells gasoline, firewood, dried fish, and she also operates a fishing business. She has no children. Emma joined the Kiva Field Partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 1998 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past 22 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Emma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 20,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of about $418, thus raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 23rd cycle loan, she is borrowing 22,000 PHP, which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for future improvements in her businesses. Emma D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, gallons of oil, onion, tomato etc

loans.name: Kodzo Adodo

texts.fr: Adodo est âgé de  65 ans et  a 4 enfants en charge. IL fait la vente des articles scolaires pour s’occuper de sa petite famille. IL a débuté ses activités en 1978 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. IL revend ensuite ses articles dans la Librairie la Lumière en face de l’hotel John Palace dans le quartier Akodessewa sur la route de Zorro bar.  Il demande un prêt pour acquerir de nouveaux articles scolaires et satisfaire plus de clients.
texts.en: Adodo is 65 years old and has 4 children to support. He sells school supplies to take care of his small family.  He started his business in 1978 and stocks up at the main market in Lomé.  He then resells the items at the Librairie la Lumiere (Light Bookstore) in front of the John Palace hotel in the Akodessewa neighborhood on the Zorro Bar road. He is asking for a loan to acquire new school supplies and satisfy more clients.

loans.use: Purchase of School Supplies

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” CHIKON”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Flora; ella tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de plantas para luego distribuirlo de forma ambulatoria a sus clientes que le solicitan a la vez la socia se dedica al préstamo de dinero ganando ella un porcentaje del monto que presta, la socia es una persona bien alegre y optimista y de esta forma ella sale adelante. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar mas mercadería ( plantas) para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Flora is a member of the "CHIKON" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Flora is 30 years old and single.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling plants.  She delivers her plants to her customers who request them.  Flora also lends money.  She makes a percentage on the sums that she lends.  She is a very happy and optimistic person and, in this way, she gets ahead in life.

Flora is requesting this loan so that she can buy more merchandise (plants) for her business.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise (plants) for her business

loans.name: Salah

texts.en: This borrower is from Iraq. He is 22 years old and lives with one brother. In 2008, Salah decided to open his own barber shop after having gained good experience in this field. He is well known in his area and has a good reputation. He is requesting an $1800 loan to renovate his shop and buy a small generator. He aims to improve his business and to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To renovate his shop and buy a small generator

loans.name: Manuela Adelaida

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Estrella De Belén que se reúne cada 15 días en el Barrio Santa Marianita de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Manuela, ella tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 20, 17 y 8 años todos estudian en Universidad, colegio y escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
 
Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo, tarjetas telefónicas de Porta y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los  días ya que vende en su casa donde tiene un pequeño local, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Sus productos lo que es Yanbal lo recibe en su casa y lo que es ropa y tarjetas telefónicas en el centro en una distribuidora. Lleva cuatro años que se dedica a esta actividad.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, tarjetas y ropa de catalogo. Este es el cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son seguir en sus negocios y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The village bank Estrella de Belén meets every 15 days in the neighborhood of Santa Marianita in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches which are very popular with local and foreign tourists year-round.  Most of the people there make their living from fishing or other work related to the ocean.

There we met Manuela, who is 43 years old, married and has three children - 29, 17 and 8 years old.  They are studying in the university, high school and elementary school.  Her husband is a fisherman.

She is a housewife who, in order to have her own money, sells catalog clothing, Porta phone cards and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories).  She works every day since she sells from home, where she has a small store.  She sells her products on credit and charges every week or every 15 days, depending on what her customers want. She receives the Yanbal products at home and the clothing and phone cards downtown from a distributor.  She has been doing this for 4 years. 

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, phone cards and catalog clothing.  This is her fourth cycle with the village bank and she likes it because the payments are easy to make.  Her dreams are to continue with her business and that her children will be professionals.

loans.use: To buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, telephone cards and clothes.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is a 40-year-old, married woman. She and her husband have three children, aged 20, 15 and 10 years old. Two additional dependents live with their family because they are relatives of her husband. In 2002, Fatmata established a food sales business because she sought independence in her work life. By working 7 days per week and 10 hours per day, she earns approximately 950,000 SLL every month from her business.

She is now seeking a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL ($925), which would be used to buy additional food items for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 203,200 SLL. With the additional income she expects to generate as a result of this loan, Fatmata intends to educate her children up to the university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional inventory

loans.name: El Triunfo Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Triunfo lo conforman tres féminas trabajadoras una de ellas es Josefa Dolores Lopez Muños  de 33 años quien se dedica a la realización y venta de nacatamales y pan. Ella al inicio no sabía cómo realizar los nacatamales pero poco a poco fue aprendiendo.
L. con el crédito comprara materiales ya que con lo que realiza no ha justa para la demanda que tiene.
Los otros integrantes de grupo son Olga María G. quien desde hace 20 años se dedica a la venta de leña y carne rubro en el que está iniciando y Isabel G. se dedica al comercio de leña y Tortilla.
texts.en:
The group "El Triunfo" [The Triumph] is made up of three hardworking women.  One of them is Josefa Dolores Lopez Muños, 33 years old, who sells nacatamales and bread.   When she began, she didn't know how to make nacatamales, but she learned as she went.  

Ms. Lopez will use the loan to buy ingredients, since what she has doesn't meet the demand.  

The other members of the group are Olga Maria G., who for 20 years has sold firewood and meat.  In the same line of work, Isabel G. is beginning to sell firewood and tortillas.

loans.use: Pork, corn

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is married and has five children, all of whom attend school. They live in a rental house that has piped water but no electricity. Her biggest monthly expense is school tuition fees.

She operates a food market selling coconuts and vegetables by retailing to her neighbours and passersby. Eunice has been operating this business for the past two years, which has helped her meet her family needs with her income. She dreams of expanding and becoming self reliant in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts and vegetables for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of coconuts and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Tagavuma

texts.en:
Tagavuma is married with three children, two boys and one girl, two of whom attend school while one is too young for school. They live at a house that they own, that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is the cost of purchasing thread and needles for her business.

For over fifteen years, she has operated a tailoring business; she operates from home whereby her potential customers are her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also operates a palm leaves selling business, also selling coconuts and paraffin, which contributes to her living. Tagavuma faces a major challenge of seasonality in her area of operation. She purchase her products from the town center and transports them to the village for resale.

With the Kshs 80,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase cloth, material, paraffin and coconuts for resale. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, material, paraffin and coconuts for resale

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
La señora Candelaria V. Hernández, vive en Coapilla Estado de Chiapas México, ella es casada y  ya no tiene hijos a su responsabilidad.
Solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de maíz para luego venderlo en la misma localidad y en algunas comunidades cercanas de donde ella vive, en esta actividad lleva un año y según nos comenta que le va bien.
Comenzó con ésta actividad para  poder  incrementar  sus ingresos ya que también quiere apoyar a  su esposo trabajando y  así  juntos poder solventar sus gastos que se generan en su hogar.
Su más grande deseo es seguir trabajando hasta que dios le siga prestando vida para así  continuar con el préstamo que fundación le está otorgando.
    Las personas que integran en el grupo son: Brígida Pérez E., compra y vende pollos  de rancho, Candelaria V. Hernández, en la  compra y venta de maíz, Inés Romana López García, se dedica a la elaboración de tamales para luego venderlo y Soraida Pérez Pérez, invierte en la compra de productos naturales para venderlo en la misma localidad.
texts.en:
Candelaria V. Hernández lives in Coapilla in the State of Chiapas, Mexico.  She is married and no longer needs to care for her children.

She is asking for this loan to buy dried corn to resell in the same location and in a few other nearby communities.  She’s been doing this for a year and tells us that it has gone well for her.

She started doing this so that she could increase her income because she wants to help her husband pay the household expenses.  Her greatest desire is to continue working as long as she can, in order to continue repaying this loan.

The people who make up the group are Brígida Pérez E., who buys and sells chickens; Candelaria V. Hernández, who buys and sells dried corn; Inés Romana López García, who makes tamales; and Soraida Pérez Pérez, who buys and sells organic products.

loans.use: to buy died corn for resale

loans.name: C4823 Abizeranye Group

texts.en:
Olive is 27 years old and is married with one child who is 3 years old. She is the presidente of a group called “Abizeranye” and she sells clothes. This is her one successful year in this business, which she runs from 8 am until 5 pm every day.

Olive and her team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of increasing the quantity of clothes. With this expansion, she really hopes that the earned profits will increase. With these profits, she will be able to satisfy the basic needs of her family and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a single man who lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food, rent, and clothing.                    

For the past 3 years, he has been operating a vending business, selling sweets, biscuits and groundnuts from door to door. His potential customers are passersby and neighboring community members.   Edward faces a major challenge of competition from other vendors in the village.  He dreams of expanding his business and purchasing a tuk tuk for the business. 

With the loan for Kshs 20,000, Edward wants to purchase packets of sweets and biscuits to resell. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To buy sweets and biscuits to resell

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok, a single mother of one child who works as a taxi driver, lives in the Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap. She was married years ago, but divorced her husband. To earn a living, she sells fresh fish to people in the market. Mrs. Sok will be using her loan to buy more fish for resale, and will use the profits to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Hijas De Dios Group

texts.es:
El grupo las hijas de Dios lo conforman las señora María Elena, Guisssel y Veronica tres féminas trabajadoras y emprendedoras originarias de Masaya, ciudad de las flores. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora María Elena quien desde hace cinco años se dedica a la venta de gaseosa. Ella tiene la meta junto a su esposo de tener una pulpería.
Ella con el crédito comprar más gaseosa para su negocio. 
La señora Guissel vende chiverías, gaseosa y chicha, y Verónica tiene una pulpería la cual inicio con la venta de golosinas y poco a poco fue creciendo.
texts.en:
The group, Las Hijas de Dios (The Daughters of God), is comprised of María Elena, Guisssel, and Veronica, three hard-working and entrepreneurial women originally from Massaya, the city of flowers. The group's coordinator is María Elena, who has been selling soft drinks for five years. She and her husband have a goal to own a general store.

With the loan, she will buy more soft drinks for her business.

Guissel sells dairy products, soft drinks, and corn malt. Veronica has a general store that she started by selling snacks, and little by little it grew.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is married and is 54 years old. She has a retail shop where she sells a variety of groceries. She has had this business for 5 years.

Rufina is requesting a loan of PHP 6000 to buy additional biscuits, canned goods, soft drinks and coffee to sell to her customers. Each month, Rufina earns about PHP3000 doing this type of work.

In the future, Rufina hopes that she can maintain her retail shop business so that she can provide for her family and improve her store. Rufina would be thankful if her requested loan is approved.

loans.use: to buy additional biscuits, canned goods, softdrinks and coffee to sell

loans.name: Manon

texts.en:
Manon is a 45-year-old farmer who lives with his family, consisting of four children and his wife. He has two milk cows and sells dairy products to the local and capital traders. Manon has 20 years of experience raising cattle and selling dairy products. The milk products are in very high demand in his village. Manon’s orders for these products are very high but the milk his cows give is not enough for traders and he decided to apply for $2,000 USD to purchase an additional cow and fodder. Manon is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to improve his living with this loan. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase an additional cow and fodder

loans.name: Hermenegilda

texts.es:
Hermenegilda, se dedica a la crianza D. cerdos, vive con su familia conformada por su esposo y una hija, el negocio D. Hermenegilda es la crianza D. cerdos tiene muchos años D. tenerlo y surgió por la necesidad D. ocuparse en una actividad que le produjera ganancias.
Ella quiere invertir actualmente en cerdos y alimentación D. los mismos, para ello solicita un préstamo que le cubra los gastos y le permita aumentar la granja D. cerdos.
Seguir trabajando fuerte es el objetivo D. ella, contar con financiamientos y pagarlos oportunamente, también dar una mejor estabilidad a su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Hermenegilda raises pigs for a living.  She lives with her husband and daughter.  Hermenegilda has operated her business for many years, a business that she started because she needed a way to earn a good income.
She wants to buy more pigs, along with the supplies she needs to feed and care for them.  She is applying for a loan that she expects will cover her expenses and allow her to expand the business.
Her goal is to continue working.  Her business relies on financing and repaying her loans on time.  She also wants to proviD. some stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and supplies for her pig farm.

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.es:
Timoteo, vive con su esposa y tres hijos de 12, 14 y 16 años de edad, él es agricultor se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol, tiene casi 25 años de estar en esta actividad, este trabajo lo aprendió por su padre.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono y pesticidas, con estos materiales podrá dar un cuido adecuado para producir abundantemente, sirviéndole estos materiales para garantizar dicha cosecha.
Su objetivo es proveer para sus hijos todo lo necesario, dándoles la alimentación y educación necesaria para poder mejorar su futuro.
texts.en:
Timoteo lives with his wife and three children who are 12, 14 and 16 years old.  He’s a farmer growing corn and beans.  He’s been in this line of work for almost 25 years.  He learned this occupation from his father.

He is asking for the loan to buy manure and pesticides.  He will be able to provide adequate care to produce abundantly with these supplies; they will guarantee such a harvest.

His goal is to provide everything necessary for his children, providing them with food and the necessary education to be able to improve their future.

loans.use: to buy manure and pesticides.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 61 years-old and widowed with four children.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to purchase more items to sell, such as shampoo, groceries, etc., in her sari-sari store.

Erlinda has borrowed and repaid ten loans from Kiva partner NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 15 years and also earns an income from electronic reloading.

Erlinda aspires to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Pablito

texts.en:
Pablito is a farmer working in Surallah, South Cotabato. He wakes up early in the morning to attend to his farming duties. Pablito plants rice and corn crops on his land. He said he earns just enough to buy his family’s basic needs.

Pablito works hard to support his family of a wife and 2 children. His children are 5 and 10 years old.

This loan will be used to purchase farm inputs, such as seeds and fertilizers. Pablito hopes to achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 42 years old and lives in Quirino Cordon. She is married and has three children. 

Maribel has been operating her general store for almost 15 years. From the business she manages, she is able to earn about P18,000 a month because her store is near a highway where sometimes passenger buses and vans stop. She sells products such as bottled mineral water, soft drinks, snack foods, and biscuits. With the profits from selling her products, she is able to cover all her household expenses.

In order to continue improving her business, she is applying for a loan of P35,000 to buy more merchandise such as soft drinks, bottled mineral water, assorted biscuits, and snack foods for her general store. Her only wish is for her business to grow and to have an inventory of products to offer to her customers. She is hoping that she could save some funds to support her children in their studies until they finish their college-level education. According to her, she could make all these things a reality through her patience and hard work in maintaining her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as soft drinks, bottled mineral water, assorted biscuits, and snack foods for her general store

loans.name: Neva

texts.en:
Neva is a 23-year-old woman. She is married and has no kids at the moment. She lives in Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Neva develops her business interest at a young age. She has installed a food stall in the local community selling different viands and other snack items at very affordable prices. Her husband is helping her do the job, which enables and strengthens their relationship as husband and wife. The business has existed for three years, allowing them to earn a monthly income of PHP 8,500. She has requested a loan of PHP 35,000 to purchase additional food items to sell.

Neva has been a member of GDMPC since 2010. This is her third loan from the cooperative. In the future, Neva plans to improve and expand the business to gain more income. She plans as well to widen the area and add more tables and seats to accommodate more customers.

loans.use: To purchase additional food items to sell.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca, vive con su esposo, tiene tres hijos de 18,24 y 25 años de edad, ella se dedica a vender tablilla (chocolate para bebida caliente) todos los días en su colonia, de lunes a sábado.
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar canastas para llevar la venta al mercado, y materia prima como (cacao y azúcar) de esa forma tendrá lo necesario para mantener siempre estable su negocio.
El sueño de blanca que sus hijos sigan estudiando en la universidad, y darles lo necesario para que vivan en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Blanca lives with her husband and has three children who are 18, 24 and 25 years old.  Her business is selling bars of chocolate which are used for making hot chocolate.  She sells her products every day in her neighborhood, from Monday to Saturday.

Blanca needs this loan to buy baskets with which to carry her products to the market and raw materials such as cacao and sugar.  This will enable her to have available everything she needs to keep her business stable.

Blanca's dream is for her children to continue studying up to university level and to be able to give them everything they need so that they can live in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy baskets, cacao and sugar

loans.name: Rassem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 36 years old, married, and the father of one child.

Rassem has been an owner of a food market since 2005. He sells soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese, dairy products, and household items. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs; he has sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for $1,500 in order to tile the walls of his market with cermaic and to add more foodstuffs. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to tile the walls of his market and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Selman

texts.en: Selman is a 31-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and one school aged child. He works really hard in cooperation with his wife to be able to satisfy the family needs. His wife has been working as a teacher for the past four years; while he has been working in the construction field since 2003. He is specialized at completing woodwork projects. Today, he’s asking for a loan of $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to expand his business and increase his productivity by purchasing added construction materials and tools. In the future, he plans to have his own concrete industry.

loans.use: to expand his business and increase his productivity by purchasing added construction materials and tools

loans.name: Jose Pantaleon

texts.es:
el sr. José Pantaleón vive en unión libre y es padre de 2 hijos que dependen de él, Jose se dedica a la caficultura y agricultura desde hace varios años, estas actividaes han sido la fuente de ingresos para cubrir y satisfacer las  necesidades familiares.
Don José utilizara el credito para obtener su propio sistema de energia solar y asi poder iluminarse por las noches, no cuentan con energía eléctrica y desean poder gozar de este servicio y así darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. José Pantaleón is in a common-law relationship and the father of two dependent children. He has been a coffee grower and farmer for several years. These business activities are the source of income by which he is able to provide for his family’s needs.

Don José will use this loan to obtain his own solar energy system so that he can have light in the evenings. He does not have electricity and wants to take advantage of this service so that he can provide his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system.

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es: Zoraida de 36 años de edad se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada, ella vive en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, una población a orillas del mar Caribe, con su cónyuge, quien es ayudante en un bus intermunicipal,  y sus tres hijos en las edades de 2 a 13 años. Sus principales mercancías son los jeans, camisas y calzado informal, también vende electrodomésticos menores, como licuadoras ollas, hornos entre otras. Sus   clientes se encuentran en el mismo municipio de Puerto Colombia y los pagos de sus productos  los hacen en dos o en tres partidas. Con la cercanía del fin de año, se han incrementado los pedidos de sus clientes y esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con la cual comprará ropa calzado y juguetes para que sus clientes logren felizmente celebrar las  navidades y año nuevo.
texts.en: Zoraida, 36, makes her living selling a variety of merchandise. She lives in the town of Puerto Colombia, a city on the shores of the Caribbean Sea. Zoraida lives with her spouse, who is an assistant on an intercity bus, and their three children whose ages range from 2 to 13 years old. The main things she sells are jeans, shirts and casual footwear. She also sells small home appliances, like blenders, pots, stoves and other things. Her customers are also in the city of Puerto Colombia, and they purchase products by making two or three payments. As the end of the year approaches, her clients’ requests have increased, and this is the reason she has requested her Kiva loan. This is the first financing she has received from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to purchase clothing, shoes and toys so that her clients will be able to happily celebrate Christmas and New Year’s.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes and toys.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 30 years old and married with four children. She lives in Hioma, Uganda. She sells rice and maize and has been in this business for two-and-half years. She is faced with a challenge of limited storage facilities. Her business goal is to expand into new markets, and her personal goal is to educate her children.

Lydia needs a loan to buy rice and maize for sale.

loans.use: to buy rice and maize for sale

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is taking out another Kiva loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to renovate her rental houses. With this loan, she wants to purchase cement and sand to renovate her real estate houses. The previous loan boosted her monthly income by 50 percent and her family's  standard of living has also improved.

loans.use: to purchase cement and sand to renovate her real estate houses.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TINKA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gregoria; ella tiene 58 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de jugos, ella trabaja en el mercado, ella prepara diferentes jugos como jugo de papaya, jugo de naranja, jugo de plátano entre otros jugos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener otro local donde pueda vender los jugos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar frutas como platanos, papayas, naranjas y azúcar para que prepare los jugos.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Gregoria is a partner in the communal bank "TINKA".  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is located in the province and departments of Cusco.  

Gregoria, the partner, is 58 years old and is married with two children.  She alternates her daily activities with a business that sells juice.  She works in the market where she prepares different juices, such as papaya juice, orange juice, and plaintain juice, among others.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  Through this job, she provides for her children.  Her dream is to have another location where she can sell her juices.  Gregoria requests the loan to buy fruits (such as plantains, papayas, and oranges) and sugar to prepare the juices.

Gregoria is happy to have received this loan, and she promises to make the payments on her loan.

loans.use: To buy fruits (such as plantains, papayas, and oranges) and sugar to prepare fruit juices.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a hardworking married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He owns a drug shop in town and faces a challenge of price fluctuations and inflation plus high taxes and other fees. His dream is to educate his children and diversify his business into a private hospital.

John needs the loan to buy drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy drugs to sell.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama  is single.  She sells  doughnuts, saucepans, and local  soap at Asebu Ekroful, which she has done for eight years. Ama uses her income to run her business and support herself. Ama will use the loan to purchase more of her goods for sale. With the new profits from her business, Ama plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more of her goods for sale.

loans.name: Benkadi Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du BENKADI III sont des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans les familles traditionnelles à Kantola, un des villages de la région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le mil et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, MAINI, deuxième personne à partir de la gauche, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 hectare de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana,  après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 150.000F CFA environs par campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes
texts.en:
The five members of the Benkadi III group are married women, on average 31 years old with three children. Most of them live in traditional households in Kantola, one of the towns in the Koulikoro region, the 2nd administrative region of Mali.
They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their businesses at the beginning of the rainy season. They cultivate millet and peanuts. They are on their third collaboration with the institution.
With this new loan, Maini, second from the left, intends to buy agricultural inputs and small equipment and to pay for labour to maintain about 1 hectare of millet and peanuts.
The produce is sold in the city of Fana after the harvest to a clientele composed of men and women. Maini intends to realize an average profit of about 150,000 FCFA per cycle. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: To pay for labour, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, hoeing, and small equipment.

loans.name: Mt Udzungwa Group

texts.en:
KAIM, who is in his early 40's is married with three schooling children.  He has been selling charcoal for four years now. He works from 06 am to 07 am daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be KAIM's 13th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to increase on the charcoal stock  and has managed to pay back all his loans successfully.  He is doing great with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group.  He used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loan, reinvest in business and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal to meet his customer's demand. He Dreams of opening a retail shop.

Kaim will share this loan with his loan group  Mt Udzungwa which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to meet his customer's demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Veronica wants to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Phyllis Mugure intends to buy a grinding machine and water storage tanks

loans.name: Jeremías

texts.en:
I have been a welder for over five years; this is my family's sole source of income. Through the grace of God I have enough work these days, but because of a shortage of raw materials, I can't always complete customer orders. I'm asking for a loan of $1,200 to buy the raw materials I need to satisfy customer requests so that they will recommend my work to others and my family will have what it needs to live well.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

Tengo ya mas de 5 años en el trabajo de soldador este es el ingreso de mi familia. Gracias a dios estos días e tenido suficiente trabajo pero la falta de material no he podido entregar los pedidos. Estoy solicitando un préstamo de $1,200.00 dlls. Para la compra de material, cumplir con mis clientes y que ellos me recomiendan con sus amistades, y mi familia tendrá lo necesario para vivir bien.

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Raymonde

texts.en:
N. Raymonde is 37 years old, a mother of 5 and married to a polygamist. Her toughest challenge has been her past sickness during which she spent all her capital on medication. This forced her to remove her children from school since she could no longer pay their school fees, and her husband was not able to shoulder this responsibility.

Her low self esteem, caused by all these set backs, hindered her from looking for help. She states that “thanks to GHAPE women who talked to me and took me to centre meetings, I heard other women's experiences and realized that I am not alone. This is how I became a member”.

She took her first loan in 2006 and is proud of having successfully invested and repaid this loan with income from her investment. With this loan, she was able to sell foodstuff, fish to her community and provide for some basic needs of her children.

N. is now requesting a loan of $300 with which she plans to sell smoked fish, which is a welcome soup ingredient in her community. She intends to continue using the proceeds from her business to provide for her children. She plans to repay the loan in 15 months.

loans.use: purchase smoked fish, baskets

loans.name: Thary

texts.en:
Mrs. M. Thary learned to weave from her mother in 1985, and has been weaving silk since then. Her husband is a farmer, who grows vegetables and rice. However, he also assisting her in weaving silk when he is free from his farming activities. He learned to weave from his wife. They were married in 1988 and have 6 children, 4 sons and 2 daughters.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA three times. Now she is asking for a loan of $400. She will use $200 to purchase silk materials and sewing thread, and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom. She will use the other $200 to supplement the money she has saved, so she can buy a small generator.

loans.use: Purchase silk materials and sewing thread, and pay fees for preparing the loom; and purchase a generator.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia is a very brave woman who after years of hard work selling countless articles of hardware, has come away reaping many benefits. This is despite the fact that in the beginning she sold many heavy items, which was difficult for her to handle. But with the passage of time and her immense effort (she has always been dedicated to her work), she has increased her products and her business now has a place in the formal sector due to their inventory of construction products. Delia's dream has always been to maintain a steady and secure income in order to meet the financial demands of her family, and now this reality has brought many joys to her children and to herself. She is now requesting a loan to be able to increase the quantity and variety of her products and in turn enable her family to prosper in the dreams they have or hope to acquire.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Delia, es una mujer valiente, tras los años de labor intensa de venta de innumerables artículos de ferretería, viene cosechando muchas satisfacciones a pesar de que en sus inicios ofrecía estos artículos tan pesados de manera ambulante, sin embargo con el paso de los años y el inmenso esfuerzo que siempre le ha dedicado a su trabajo ha incrementado sus productos de su negocio y ahora cuenta con un lugar formal en el que ofrece sus variados productos de construcción.Su sueño siempre ha sido mantener un espacio seguro de ingresos para satisfacer las necesidades que demanda su hogar y ahora esta realidad le está otorgando muchas alegrías a sus hijos y también a ella.Solicita un préstamo para posibilitar la prosperidad su hogar a través del incremento de la cantidad y variedad de los artículos que ofrece a fin de que su querida familia sobresalga en cada actividad que deseen o planeen realizar.

loans.use: To purchase more variety of products for sale in her construction supplies store.  (Incremento de capital para adquirir mayor variedad y cantidad de artículos para el pequeño centro de ventas de artículos de construcción.)

loans.name: Vaitupua

texts.en: Vaitupua is a mother from Mulifanua village. This is her second loan from SPBD. She used her first loan to expand her vegetable garden. She earns $500 WST ($200 USD) per week in harvest season. She wants to spend this loan to upgrade her business, to renovate her home, and support her grandchildren at school.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her vegetable garden and for home improvement

loans.name: Asha's Changanoto Group

texts.en:
Asha, age 32, is married with 3 children (ages 10, 8, and 6). She has a drinks business where she sells soft drinks and beer. She opened this business in 2006 and now makes a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales. She works from 7am to 5pm daily at her business.

In the past, Asha successfully took out a loan from BRAC Tanzania to increase her sales. She now hopes for a new loan, which she will share with her subgroup members who have businesses dealing in clothing, tailoring, and market items.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Mukumjon

texts.ru:
Mukumjon S.lives in the Rudaki region. He is 53 years old, is married and has 4 children. He has a technical education and is a driver by profession. He works as a taxi driver. Mukumjon has 28 years of experience and will use his loan for car repairs. Mukumjon’s job is the main source of income for his family. In addition, the area where he works has limited transportation and his job allows residents to move around the region at affordable prices and in comfort. He will pay back the loan over a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Шамсов Мукумджон Раджабалиевич житель района Рудаки. Возраст 53 года. Женат имеет 4 детей. Образование средне-специальное. По специальности водитель –шофер. Работает водителем такси. Опыт работы 28 лет. Хочет получить кредит на ремонт автомашины. Его деятельность является основным источником дохода его семьи. Кроме того местность в которой он работает не снабжена транспортом и его деятельность позволяет населению передвигаться по району по доступным ценам и с комфортом.Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Car repairs

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
In 1996 when TYM fund opened a branch in Quang Tiến, Mrs Nguyễn Thị K. was on of the first woman to joined TYM. Mrs K. is 39 years old, she used her first loan (50 USD) to invest in pig raising. After a few rounds, she became familiar with the procedure so she applied for max loan in later rounds. She invested all her loans in farming pigs, ducks and chickens. Her husband is a construction worker, he is very supportive of her. He helps her make the weekly payment whenever she is short. In 2001, Mrs K. converted her rice field into a fish farm. Today, her family's farm has an area of 8/10 acre. There are 200 egg laying ducks, 11 pigs, 2 cows and a fish pond of 5/10 acre. Her family income is 250-300 USD a month. Mrs K. is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to buy feed for her animals and fishes.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Năm 1996, khi Quỹ Tình thương về với xã Quang Tiến, chị Nguyễn Thị K., 39 tuổi, là một trong những thành viên đầu tiên tham gia. Số tiền 50USD của vòng vốn đầu tiên được chị đầu tư cho chăn nuôi. Sau khi làm quen với cách cho vay của Quỹ, các vòng vốn tiếp theo chị vay mức tối đa tiếp tục chăn nuôi lợn gà vịt. Chồng chị, một thợ xây, luôn giúp đỡ vợ trong công việc và hỗ trợ tiền trả tuần khi chị có khó khăn. Năm 2001 chị K. đổi ruộng làm kinh tế trang trại vườn cây ao cá. Hiện nay trang trại của gia đình có diện tích 8 sào với trên 200 con vịt đẻ trứng, 11 con lợn thịt, 2 con bò và trên 5 sào ao cá. Bình quân thu nhập của gia đình 250-300USD/tháng. Chị K. dự định vay thêm 1200USD đầu tư thêm vào trang trại.(mua cá giống, thức ăn gia súc)

loans.use: Buy fishes, food for pigs, ducks

loans.name: Nuru's Heri Group

texts.en:
Nuru is is 28 years old and is married with 2 children, ages 12 and 9. Nuru sells food items in the market. She started her business in 2004. Everyday, she works from 6am to 7pm at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in food vending, charcoal sales and market sales.

loans.use: To buy more items (potatoes, rice, tomatoes) for her business.

loans.name: Yormuhamed

texts.en: B. Yormuhamed lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. Mr. B. Yormuhamed, like many of his fellow villagers, is engaged in livestock raising and selling. It is a family business where his wife helps him. Mr. B. Yormuhamed is 47 years old, is married and has 5 children. He dreams of having a large flock. He has the appropriate skills and he has been working with livestock for 35 years. He also works in a collective farm. Mr. B. Yormuhamed applies to KIVA for a business development loan of $625  for 8 months build a new cowshed.

loans.use: To build a new cowshed.

loans.name: Carmela's Group

texts.en:
Josefina, Rocio and Carmela are members of the Village Bank Stars.

Josefina is separated, 73 years old and has four children. Josefina sells food at the Nery García market and also sells cheese to institutions on credit.

Rocío is a single mother, 35 years old and has four children. Rocío sells porridge in the center of the city of Ayacucho. She also has a small locksmith workshop in her house, where she works with the help of another person. Roció is also a singer of Peruvian music.

Carmela is married, 42 years old and has four children. Carmela sells spices and chopped vegetables in the Magdalena market.

Josefina, Rocío and Carmela need loans of 800 soles, 800 soles, and 1000 soles respectively, money which will be invested in the purchase of cheese, sugar, corn, ají peppers, and a cutting machine.

The dreams of Josefina, Rocio and Carmela are to buy a refrigerator to begin a new business, have a place in the center of the city, make a CD, better their homes and that their children become professionals.

loans.use: Josefina, Rocío and Carmela need loans to purchase cheese, sugar, corn, ají peppers, and a cutting machine.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier is a young man who has wanted to devote himself to the breeding and care of animals since he was only a teenager. Through this work he could gain personal satisfaction and could help his parents with living expenses at a time when they were experiencing severe financial problems. Now this activity not only serves to help his parents, but also allows Javier to save money for when he starts his own family. He is saving for a place to live, a place to start a household, by the grace of GOD. For this, Javier needs $175 to buy animals to increase his heard and improve his livestock, in order to make the sale of his animals more profitable. Thus Javier presents his request to you in order find the support he needs to keep his business growing and so that he can soon start a family.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva volunteer.

Javier es un joven que desde que era sólo un adolescente se entregó de lleno en la siembra y cuidado de animales, con lo que pudo obtener grandes satisfacciones y ayudar a sus padres en los gastos del hogar, en una época donde estaban pasando severos problemas económicos. Ahora, esta actividad no sólo le sirve para ayudar a sus padres, sino también a ahorrar para cuando él tenga su propia familia, un lugar donde pueda vivir y donde pueda formar un hogar con el favor de DIOS.Por ello, requiere de 500 soles para adquirir animales para aumentar su ganado y mejorar la raza, para hacer más rentable la venta de sus animales. Javier presenta su pedido ante usted, con la finalidad de encontrar un apoyo para seguir creciendo y formar prontamente un hogar.

loans.use: To buy breeding animals to improve the quality of his livestock

loans.name: Sita

texts.en:
Sita R., a resident of Tangal, lives in a single family household with her husband and two sons.  Her older son works in a finance office and her younger son is studying in grade 11.

Together, Mrs. R. and her husband, Mr. Sankhaman R., opened their small restaurant 6 years ago to strengthen the economic condition of their family.  They sell different varieties of food items in her shop.  Specifically, she prepares Newari foods.  The majority of the people living in the Lalitpur district are Newars, so Newari food is very famous and tastier.  The demand for Newari food is increasing day to day.  They also serve tea and coffee.  Her restaurant is small but very popular in her locality.
 
Now, Mrs. R. is requesting her second loan of Rs 15000.00 to buy necessary food materials for her shop.

loans.use: To buy necessary food materials for her shop.

loans.name: Najat

texts.en:
Najat is married with 5 children between 25 and 5 years old. She has been a tailor since 1998. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

Najat now requests a loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To improve her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth Karina

texts.es:
Eli, tiene 29 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Empeñosas de Patay”, tiene como objetivo abrir un bazar y vender ropas para bebés ya que ahora se dedica a criar a su único hijo debido a su separación con su conviviente, desde hace cuatro años ella vende abarrotes en prolongación libertadores de Patay en el distrito de Independencia en la provincia de Huaraz donde también es la casa de sus padres, una de sus mayores dificultades fue que al enfermarse de “sobreparto”(enfermedad que en la zona, se especifica como un shock después del parto)  ella estuvo en cama y no podía mover sus brazos y sus piernas y que gracias a su madre ha podido salir adelante .

Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 soles, que pagará en 4 cuotas, ella comprará un saco de arroz, de azúcar y todos los víveres que alcance para su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Eli is 29 years old and is a member of the “Mujeres Empeñosas de Patay” (Hard-working Women of Patay) microfinance institute. Her goal is to open a shop and sell baby clothing. She is currently taking care of her only son after her separation. For four years, she has been selling groceries in Prolongación Libertadores of Patay, in the Independencia district of the Huaraz province, where her parents’ house is also located. One of her greatest hardships was coming down with a post-partum illness, characterized in the area as a type of shock experienced after giving birth. She was bed-ridden, unable to move her arms and legs, but thanks to her mother, she was able to overcome it.

With this 500.00 PEN loan, which she will repay in 4 monthly installments, she will purchase one sack of rice, one sack of sugar, and any other provisions she can afford for her general store.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase assorted goods

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Komi A. est âgé de 23 ans, célibataire sans enfants. Il est propriétaire depuis 2 ans d’une boutique à Wome, un village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Pour augmenter la capacité de sa boutique, Komi veut approvisionner sa boutique en achetant des sacs de riz, des cartons de boîtes de conserves et ainsi que des cartons de savons. Il espère amèliorer les conditions de sa vie avec cette opportunité
texts.en:
Komi A. is 23 years old, single, and has no children. For the past two years, he has been the owner of a shop in Wome, a village situated about 80 miles from Lomé, the capital of Togo. To increase his shop's capacity, Komi wants to stock up on sacks of rice, boxes of canned goods, and boxes of soap. He hopes to improve his living conditions with this opportunity.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for resale

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanna M. lives in Boeung Kor Ek Villge in Kandal Province.  She is employed in a garment factory.  She is a 37 year old widow with one child who is attending the local school.  She is able to make a small salary, which makes it very difficult to provide a better life for her family.  

To improve her living conditions, Mrs. Vanna M. decided to ask for a loan, which she will add to her savings so that she can buy timbers to build a house for her family to live in better conditions.

loans.use: To add to her savings so that she can buy timbers to build a house for her family to live in better conditions.

loans.name: Sakina M. Hanif Khan Group

texts.en:
Sakina baji is a 43-year-old married lady and resides in a place called Kot Radha Kishan which is 24 km from the city of Kasur, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the past 23 years. Her husband's name is M. H. K. and he is a farmer and sells milk as well. She is the mother of seven children: five sons and two daughters. Her first two sons are factory workers. The others don't have work right now.

Sakina baji is involved in a business sewing clothes. Her daughter helps her cut the dresses. She does this work to help her husband to meet their financial expenses. She is applying for a loan to start a grocery shop for her eldest son so that he will be able to manage his own business and earn a good profit.

Sakina baji is the group leader for some more women. Asghari and Jamila baji each want a loan to buy buffaloes for their milk-selling businesses. Saira baji wants a loan to buy wood-cutting tools to cut wood to sell. Sugran baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries to start a grocery shop

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Mr. Sopheap C. is a villager in Chey Neang village, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Because he does not have enough money to pay for growing rice, he has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow his field. His wife, Mrs. Keang Khim, is a pig breeder. Mr. Sopheap C. is a 37-year-old father of two children who are enrolled in the local school. His wife is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire a farm laborer.

loans.name: Afiavi

texts.fr: Mme Afiavi S. est née 15/05/1981 à Agoégan. Elle  est mariée et a un enfant à charge. Elle réside actuellement à Aného avec son mari. Elle fait le commerce des produits alimentaires depuis plus de cinq (05)ans. Voulant transformer son commerce de produits alimentaires en un minimarket, elle sollicite un financement pour s’approvisionner en quantité enfin de pouvoir remplir la boutique. Cela lui permettra d'augmenter ses bénéfices et de mieux faire face aux dépenses de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mme Afiavi S. was born on May 15, 1981 in Agoégan. She is married and raising one child. She is living in Aného with her husband. She has been selling foodstuffs for more than 5 years. Wishing to change her foodstuffs business into a mini-market, she is requesting a loan so as to buy greater quantities to fill up her store. This will permit her to increase her earnings and better support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of foodstuffs

loans.name: Asana

texts.en:
Asana N. is 50 years old. She is married with three children, all of whom are attending school. The first child is studying at a nursing school, the second is studying at a teacher training college, and the third is in the senior school. Asana lives with her husband at Bekwai in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Her husband works with Ghana Telecommunication (GT), now acquired by Vodafone UK. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, washing powder, toilet soaps, candies, biscuits, etc. in the local community. She wants to use the loan to buy bulk supply of the above items to expand her business. 

She maintains that no member of her family is capable to support her financially because they are also facing hardships like her. Asana hopes that the income she would make from the expanded business will enable her to provide quality education to her children. Asana belongs to a village bank called “Yikoshai Allah”, which means ‘Power belongs to God’. She hopes to receive GH¢1000 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, assorted food spices, washing soaps and powders, etc.

loans.name: Zalia

texts.fr: Mariée à un monsieur qui est un chauffeur, elle a 03  enfants et elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d’agoè atchanvé au nord de la ville de Lomé, elle exerce comme activité le commerce de céréales comme le maïs, l’haricot et l’arachide, elle a débuté ce commerce en 2002 mais récemment elle a associé à ce commerce la vente de jus. Mais actuellement, le stock de céréales dont elle dispose est épuisé, ayant déjà obtenu de WAGES un crédit qu’elle a remboursé sans aucun problème, elle s’adresse à WAGES une deuxième fois pour obtenir un crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter 4 sacs de maïs, 03 sacs d’arrachide et 02 sacs d’haricot.
texts.en:
Married to a gentleman who is a chauffeur, this is a woman who has three children and who lives with her family in the Agoè Atchanvé district in the north of the city of Lomé. Her work involves commerce in grains, such as corn, beans, and peanuts. She started in this business in 2002, but recently she added to her business the sale of juices. Right now, the stock of grain she has is exhausted. Having already been the recipient of a WAGES loan, which she repaid without any problems at all, she is inquiring with WAGES a second time to obtain a loan that will enable her to buy four sacks of corn, three sacks of peanuts, and two sacks of beans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, beans, and peanuts

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen O. is the 23-year-old single mother of one 5-year-old boy, Trevor Mack. She lives in Kondele, one of Kisumu’s more dangerous slums where she sells chips (french fries) for 10 shillings a bag. She is asking for 10,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase more potatoes from the Kibuye market in Kisumu.

She hopes she can one day be a nursery school teacher, as that is what she is trained to do.

Helen recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illness. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: To buy potatoes

loans.name: Dadau Orodriyo Beatice Group

texts.en: O. Beatrice is aged 37 years, widowed with 3 kids, all schooling, and 7 dependents. She has been selling used clothes for over 4 years. She is using the loan to purchase more used clothes for re-sale. She is managing to pay school fees for the kids and her dream is to buy a plot of land and construct a rental house and her residential house.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes for sale

loans.name: Juana María

texts.es:
La señora Juana R. se dedica a atender en su negocio de venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado Mayoreo donde a diario desde muy temprano abre su tramo para ofrecer los perecederos a sus clientes.

El motivo por el cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de dichas frutas y verduras por lo que espera en que Ceprodel le proporcionará el crédito lo más pronto posible para invertir en el negocio.
texts.en:
Juana R. tends to her business of selling fruits and vegetables in the wholesale market. She opens her area very early every day to offer the perishables to her customers. She is asking Ceprodel for a loan to buy fruits and vegetables. She hopes that Ceprodel will give her the loan as soon as possible so that she can invest in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Ahrordjon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Акилов Ахрорджон мужчина, который кредитуется в Микроинвест уже несколько лет. И использует займы на пополнение своего товарооборота дисками. Следующий займ хочет потратить на завоз дисков Российских фильмов и клип концертов. Также хочет увеличить свой прилавок видеокассетами. Следующий займ он получит с «Арванда»
texts.en:
Ahrordjon A. is a man and has been taking out loans at MicroInvest for several years. He uses the loans to fill up his inventory of DVDs. He wants to use his next loan to bring in DVDs with Russian films and concerts. He also wants to increase the inventory of VHS tapes. He will receive his next loan from Arvand.

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand.” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sales of DVDs and tapes

loans.name: Good Hope Katusabe Beatrice Group

texts.en: K. Beatrice is twenty-five years old and married. She has a retail shop which she has been operating for three years. She is using the loan to purchase retail items such as sugar, salt, soap, boxes of matches, etc. She is adding stock to her business and she believes in serving her community fairly. She is a hard-working business lady whose dream is to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase retail items such as sugar, salt, soap, boxes of matches, etc.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị (1319020500) is a 32-year-old woman living in the town of Hưng Nguyên. She is married and has three infant children.

H. owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

In 2001, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase piglets to raise and sell.

H. is now requesting a new loan of 15,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be her 7th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Juliao

texts.pt:
Julião tem 23 anos de idade, nasceu em Ngonhama (uma localidade que dista 45 km do Município da Vila de Namaacha) na Fronteira da Swazilandia, vive maritalmente e é pai de uma rapariga de apenas 1 ano de idade.

Julião estudou ate a 10ª classe e teve que interromper os seus estudos quando esteve gravemente doente, após sua recuperação ele engrena no mundo dos negócios transfronterico (vendendo arros de janelas e portas que eram adquiridos na vizinha swazilandia e revendidos na capital maputo) onde consegue construir a sua própria casa e um estabelecimento comercial. Anos depois, ele muda de actividade quando o Governo Moçambicano  implementou a lei que regula a actividade( para recolher mercadoria contrabandeada no trajecto namaacha­maputo). Mudou de actividade e começou a fazer o negocio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade.

Nunca teve empréstimo com outras instituições e esta é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 10.000,00MT para aumentar o volume dos seus produtos nomeadamente arroz, feijão, amendoim e açúcar têm ganhado de lucro um valor de 3.000.00MT e consegue poupar 1.000.00MT, pois para alem da sua filha não responsabiliza se por ninguém.

Propõe se a reembolsar antes do tempo determinado e pedir um novo empréstimo para compra de uma moto bomba para dar inicio na agricultura, pois na região onde vive tem uma grande fonte de água e terreno fértil.
texts.en:
Julião is 23 years old and was born in Ngonhama (about 45 km from the Vila municipality in Namaacha), on the Swaziland border. He is married and has a one year old baby. Julião studied until the 10th grade but had to stop when he became gravely ill. After he recovered he entered into the business world by buying window frames and doors in neighboring Swaziland and re-selling them in the capital of Maputo. He was able to build his own home and a commercial building. He later changed jobs when the Mozambique government implemented a law that regulated border activity—in order to monitor contraband on its way to Namaacham or Maputo. His new job was selling basic products in a small convenience store. He has never worked with other lending companies and this is his first loan, for 10.000,00MT, which he will use to increase the volume of his products. He will buy rice, beans, peanuts and sugar. He makes about 3.000.00MT and is able to save 1.000.00MT, since he is only responsible for his daughter. He pledges to repay his loan before the determined time and hopes to receive another loan in the future. He would like to purchase irrigation equipment and get started in the agricultural field, since there is a large water source and fertile land in his region.

Translated from Portuguese by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: rice, beans, peanuts and sugar

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en: Taiwo sells drinks, she has been in this business for a year now and desires to expand the business. Taiwo is requesting for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase drinks to sell so as to be able to meet the demand of customers. Her customers appreciate knowing she will always have what they need. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase drinks to sell

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita L. is engaged in maintaining a general store located in Barangay Kinacao Baretbet in Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is now a widow and she has two children: Vener and Vanessa. Through her patience and sacrifices, her two children have finished their studies in college. The eldest is presently working as a caregiver in Canada while the youngest is employed as a government secretary in Solano.

Since Juanita is already blessed with her two children, she aims to become successful in life to also help her cousins, who can’t afford to send their children to school, and also to save for the future.

In this regard, Juanita continues to manage her store patiently and lovingly to become productive. She wants to borrow additional business capital of PHP 8,000 from Kiva lenders for her to acquire her products like grocery items, soft drinks and frozen foods. Because of her interest in improving her store, Juanita is hoping that Kiva will somehow lend her the amount. That will be of big help towards the success of her business.

Juanita also believes that, through her strong faith and determination, her business will grow and expand through the continued financial support of Kiva.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
This is Elsa B., a young businesswoman who lives among the poor communities in Tala, Caloocan City. She is 27 years old. Her husband, Rengel, also 27, works at a construction firm. One of their two children attends preschool.

Elsa started cooking and selling food items and breakfast goodies to her neighbors two years ago, the same year she joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative. Every morning, after cooking her food items, she sets up a small table for her wares in front of a friend’s store along an alley where a lot of people pass by.  She is earning 4,000 Philippine pesos (about $85) a month. She is happy that she can help her husband augment their basic daily needs.

She is now in need of a loan in the amount of P8,000 to buy food ingredients. Some of the loan will go to her child’s education. Elsa dreams of having her own permanent place of business, more like a restaurant.  

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients for her business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan Y. is from the village of Barra Puntod. She is 42 years old. Susan is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Susan owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling clothing and shoe products in the local community. Susan has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Susan joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Susan is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 13th loan taken out by Susan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine is 38 years old and is married with three children aged 3, 5 and 7. She also cares for four dependents from another family.  Her husband works as well, making approximately 60,000 RWF (approx. 105 USD) a month.

Francine’s business is a very simple small boutique selling various goods and products. It is really a hole in the wall type of place which makes very good business sense in terms of reducing rent expense! She has been in business for thirteen years and so is very experienced. Francine employs one other person, a helper, in her shop. The hours of operation are 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. daily.

With this loan, Francine plans to try offering a few new products to her existing clientele as well as having a working capital cushion for any unexpected downturn in sales. This is her first Vision Finance Company loan. Any potential profits from this business will go to providing more and better food for her family as well as saving money for a 'rainy day' (there are plenty of those in Rwanda, by the way).

loans.use: To use as business capital and to buy inventory

loans.name: Jessica Alexandra

texts.en:
Jessica Alexandra C. R. is 22 years old and lives in the Paraiso district of Guayaquil. Paraiso is a peri-urban, marginalized zone without paved roads, water pipes, or a sewer system.

Ms C. is married with two sons, one is 6 years old and the other is 8 months. She has a mobile nail salon; her services include manicures and pedicures at $3 each.

Over the last 3 years, she has built a a base of approximately 30 clients throughout Guayaquil. Clients visit Ms. C. at her cane home or she visits client's homes by appointment.

Ms. C. is requesting a loan to buy more supplies for her nail services such as nail polish (~$7 each), brushes, and cotton pads.

In the future, Ms. C. dreams of opening her own nail shop. She is grateful for any support we can provide her business so that her family may prosper!

loans.use: To buy beauty supplies.

loans.name: Shamaddin

texts.en:
Shamaddin A. is 49 years old. He is married with six children. Shamaddin has opted to make his life in his land and work hard and grow with it. That is how he decided to rear cows and dedicate himself to agriculture. He has been doing this kind of work for a very long time since he comes from a family with an entirely agricultural background.  He is now in charge of handing down all that experience to his children.
