She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase yams to sell.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is married to Marnelie, who chose to become a housewife to take good care of their only child, Princess Joan Mae. Still young at the age of 27, he is very aggressive in continuously improving his cell phone shop. By doing so, he knows that more customers will come in, thus providing more income and savings for his family. His cell phone shop has been their sole source of income since they got married. His family is now living in Barangay Arcon, Tumauini, Isabela, Philippines.

Because of his goal to make his business successful, Joel has decided to borrow money to use as his additional capital. He knows that success is only possible if he expands his business. Also, he plans to start a new venture: a hog-raising business that he has engaged in before. He wants to borrow at least Php7, 000 to assist him in fulfilling his dreams.

“The bottom line in a business' success is patience, hard work, and, most of all, trust in God,” Joel says.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Chang Lim

texts.en: Mrs. Chang Lim T. is a villager in Trapaing Ampil village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for the household. Her husband, Mr. Nem Mao, owns a small shop from which he sells construction supplies. In this business, he now faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to buy steel to re-sell. Thus his wife, Mrs. Chang Lim T., decided to ask for a loan to buy it for her husband. Mrs. Chang Lim T. is 34 years old and the mother of two children who are both attending the local school. Her husband is presented next to her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy steel for her husband's metal shop.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru: Алиева Зухро живет городе Яван. Возраст 44 года , замужем и имеет шестерых детей.Уже около четырех лет , как она занимается бизнесом в сфере торговли. Торгует тканями и детской одеждой. Ее бизнес является основным источником дохода ее семьи. Планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев. Это поможет ей развивать свою деятельность и привлечь новых клиентов.
texts.en:
Zuhro A. lives in Yavan town. She is 44 years old and is married with 6 children. For the past four years she has been selling fabric and children's clothing. This business is her primary source of income. She would like to get a loan in order to increase cash flow, attract new customers, and expand her business. She would be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Nidia Violeta

texts.es:
La señora Nidia es socia del Banco Comunal “03 de Mayo”, de Santa Bárbara, distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno; tiene 22 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 01 hijos a su cargo y posee estudios de secundaria completa. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 03 años, su negocio es la venta de calzados (zapatillas). Su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir mercadería para su negocio (zapatillas). 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1000.00 nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 5 cuotas mensuales; podrá adquirir mas mercadería, es decir más zapatillas, que piensa venderlos en los mercados de Puno y Arequipa, uno de sus mayor sueños es abrir su propia tienda de artículos deportivos con lo cual podrá garantizar la educación de sus hijos y una buena calidad de vida para toda su familia. 
 
Ella piensa que es importante el apoyo a las mujeres con créditos, para mejorar sus negocios y esta agradecida a Manuela Ramos por ese apoyo
texts.en:
Nidia is a member of Banco Comunal "3 de Mayo." She lives in Santa Barbara, within the Ilave district and El Collao province, inside the department of Puno. She's 22 years old (with a secondary school education), has one child, and lives with her partner. She's worked with the Manuela Ramos institution for 3 years, during which time she has dedicated herself to selling shoes. She used her first loan of 300 soles to purchase merchandise (shoes) for her business. With this loan of 1000 soles ($325 dollars), that she will repay in 5 monthly installments, she will be able to purchase additional merchandise that she will sell in the markets of Puno and Arequipa. Her dreams include owning a sporting goods store, which will help ensure a proper education for her child, and a good quality of life for her whole family. She believes that providing credit to women (so they can improve their businesses) is very important, and she is grateful to Manuela Ramos for its support.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise (shoes) for her business.

loans.name: Idris

texts.ru: Джалолову Идрису исполнилось 40 лет, женат и имеет 3 детей. Занимается предпринимательством на центральном рынке города Исфары. В отличии от многих предпринимателей Идрис знает как привлечь покупателей в свой маленький магазинчик. То как разложен его товар, как он общается с покупателями показывает, что он имеет постоянных покупателей. В его бизнесе ему помогает его племянник,  который заменяет Идриса во время его отсутствия. Чтобы расширить свой бизнес Идрис решил получить займ и для этого обратился в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Idris J. is 40 years old, married, and has three children. He is an entrepreneur in the Isfara central market. Unlike many entrepreneurs, Idris knows how to attract customers to his small store. The way he lays out his goods, and how he interacts with customers show that he has regular buyers. His nephew helps with the business and takes over when Idris is gone. In order to expand his business Idris decided to request a loan, and came to Microinvest to do so.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank A. is twenty-two years old. He is a single young man who lives with his brother. He says that, as a young man, he needs to work very hard to make some income and investments before he marries. He lives with his elder brother in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Frank deals in mobile phones and phones accessories, such batteries, housing, key pads, etc. He buys from dealers in Kumasi and sells in a showcase at the local market. He also treks to markets in nearby communities to sell. Frank has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy more goods to stock his business. He hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy phones and accessories

loans.name: Rosemary Juma

texts.en: Rosemary Juma O. is a 32-year-old mother of two children. She is married to a "casual worker", which in Kenya is relatively equivalent to a "day laborer”. Rosemary runs a small restaurant in Nymasaria township where she sells chips, beans, onion rice and cabbage. She is working on purchasing and fixing up some houses that she hopes to rent out. She is asking for 20,000 KES (US$275) to purchase more food stock. Rosemary recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: To purchase food stock for a restaurant.

loans.name: Nowel

texts.en:
K. Nowel is a businesswoman of 41 years. She is married with four kids, three of whom are going to school. She started her shop business three years ago with the help of her husband, but now she is self-reliant.

She is using the loan to purchase items in the shop. Her future plan is to build more houses for rent.

loans.use: To purchase items for sale in her shop.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es: Trinidad nació en la ciudad de Lima hace 40 años, contrajo matrimonio, y fruto de esa unión tuvo 4 hijos. Segura de que la venta de cervezas y gaseosas le generaría buenos ingresos, inició su negocio hace 2 años, en lo cuales, su buen trato, cortesía y la alegría que trasmite le sirvieron para cautivar a sus clientes, y la demanda fue aumentando, superando sus metas e incrementando su carga de trabajo. Trinidad tiene nuevas proyecciones, siendo una de ellas la instalación de un bar en el centro de su distrito, por lo que está buscando un local en una zona atractiva donde abunden centros comerciales y de recreación para aprovechar la concurrencia de personas. Esta idea la concretará con el apoyo de su pareja, quien incondicionalmente se ha involucrado en las labores que embarga esta actividad. Este es el 8vo préstamo de Trinidad con MFP, y junto a sus compañeras del banco comunal tienen a la perseverancia y a la paciencia como las claves de desarrollo con las que trabajan. Los 3500 soles que solicita serán utilizados para aumentar la cantidad de cajas de bebidas que ofrece.
texts.en:
Trinidad was born in the city of Lima 40 years ago. She married, and the fruit of this union is the four children she had. Confident that the sale of beers and sodas would generate a good income, she began a business two years ago. Her good relations, courtesy and the joy that she transmits brought in customers, and demand grew, exceeding her goals and increasing her workload. Trinidad has new goals, including the installation of a bar in the center of her district. She is looking for a location in an attractive neighborhood with a lot of recreation and shopping centers so that she will benefit from the numbers of people. She will achieve this with the support of her partner, who has involved himself unconditionally in the labor that this will entail. This is Trinidad’s eighth loan with the MFP. Together with her colleagues in the communal bank, they have perseverance and patience as keys to the development of their work. The 3500 soles that she requests will be used to increase the number of boxes of drinks that she offers.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand merchandise

loans.name: Baltazara

texts.es:
La señora Baltazara R. R. D. Z. tiene 39 años, vive en el Asentamiento Humano Víctor Raúl II etapa, distrito del Porvenir, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Primaria Completa,  tiene  3 hijos que depenD. económicamente D. ella.
Baltazara se dedica a la Venta D. Ropa, este negocio se inicio hace 3años, su negocio se desarrolla en su casa.
Su primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su Banco comunal Lideresas en Acción II, lo invirtió en la compra D. ropa como buzos, ropa interior, polos, camisas.
El crédito D. 300 soles, lo invertirá en la compra D. ropa como buzos, ropa interior, polos, camisas.
Baltazara tiene como sueño tener su Tienda D. Ropa para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Mrs. Baltazara R. R. D. Z. is 39 years old, and lives in a neighborhood called Asentamiento Humano Victor Raul II, in the Porvenir district of the Trujillo province, in the state of La Libertad, Peru.

She finished primary school and has three children who depend on her economically. Baltazara has been selling clothing from her home for the past three years.

Her first loan of 300 soles (Peruvian currency) that she received from the communal bank Lideresas en Accion II, was used to purchase clothing such as sportswear, undergarments, polo shirts, and t-shirts. She will use this current loan to purchase the same types of merchandise.

Baltazara’s dream is to own her own clothing store in order to grow as a small business entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing articles like sportswear, undergarments, polo shirts, and t-shirts.

loans.name: Lala Dom

texts.fr: Monsieur A. est marié, pour subvenir à ses propres charges et à celles de sa femme, il a ouvert en 2007 une boutique qu’il a appelé « AFRIK SEL TOGO », l’activité qu’il exerce dans sa boutique est la vente de sel. Il s’approvisionne à Lomé et à Dakar. Il vend à des tenanciers de restaurant et à des bonnes dames. Voulant agrandir son commerce, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter  10 sacs de sel au Togo et 15 sacs de sel du sénégal.
texts.en:
Mr. A. is married and, to provide for his own needs and those of his wife, he opened a shop called AFRIK SEL TOGO in 2007. His shop sells salt and he gets his supplies in Lomé and Dakar. He sells to restaurant owners and to good women. Wishing to expand his business, he is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase 10 bags of salt from Togo and 15 bags of salt from Senegal.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase salt

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Rice farming is the main source of income for Clarita T.’s family. Through their farm, she is hoping that her youngest child, unlike her other children, will finish college. Though sometimes the family struggles to manage the farm because of the calamities and pests that hit their palay, those problems do not keep them from continuing their farming.

In order to improve her family's chances of a good harvest, Clarita is applying for a loan from Kiva in the amount of PHP12,000 for them to maintain their farm. With the loan they can buy fertilizers and pesticides that they can use in maintaining their palay.

“I know that, with the assistance from Kiva lenders and with our perseverance, we are able to achieve our dreams,” Clarita shares.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her rice farm

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline is a mother of nine living in Mile 90, a community just outside of Bamenda, Cameroon. Living there, she has been able to take out five separate loans from GHAPE to be able to expand her farming practices, and also open up her own grocery store. 

With this next loan that she is applying for, Magdaline hopes to be able to grow her store, and also support her pig farming practices, a very profitable venture in this area. 

She is sure that these activities will be a success because of her prior experience in this business, and also because of the variety of products that she is able to carry in her store. This variety gives people more choices of what to buy, and it attracts them to her business as opposed to others, because of the sheer volume of what she is able to put out for sale in the store.

With the profits of this business, she will be able to continue to support the education and apprenticeship of her children in learning different skills and making their own lives more fruitful because of the empowerment that they have received. Magdaline also plans to put the money that she makes back into the business. 

Through the credit and the trainings that she has received, Magdaline has been able to make a notable difference in the life of her family members, and also in the conditions that they are subject to on a daily basis. She originally came to GHAPE because of the low interest rate, but now continues to stay with the organization because of the non-monetary gains that she has received. 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of pigs and seedlings to support her farming practice, and purchase of items to grow her grocery store

loans.name: Yejide

texts.en:
Yejide sells drinks. She has been in this business for the past nine years and desires to expand her business. She opens her business from Monday to Saturday from 8am to 6pm. She said her business affords her the opportunity to assist her husband in feeding and clothing the children and paying their school fees.

Yejide hopes for the loan amount N140,000 to purchase more drinks to sell so as to be able to meet the demand of customers. Her customers appreciate knowing she will always have what they need. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Juana Aide

texts.es:
Juana tiene una oficina en el centro de la ciudad de La Paz que funciona como notaria de fe pública,.
Vive en la zona de Miraflores de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa propia.. 
El crédito será destinado para capital de inversión ( compra de equipos y muebles para su oficina).
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro
texts.en:
Juana has an office in downtown La Paz where she operates as a notary public. She lives in the Miraflores neighborhood of La Paz in her own home. The loan will be used for capital investment (the purchase of equipment and furniture for her office). This is the second loan that she has applied for with Impro.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital Investment (purchase of equipment and furniture)

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 57 years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Agnes is a trader. She trades in pastries. She supplies retailers and snack bar operators in her community. She sells food (rice and stew) as well. Agnes buys her goods from nearby towns. She has been in business for over six years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo es soltero, tiene 32 años y actualmente vive con su madre. Él se dedica al cultivo y venta productos agrícolas, desde pequeño aprendió las labores de la agricultura y ahora lo hace independientemente. Pero, él no sólo vende sus productos luego de cosecharlos, sino que también les da a sus clientes un valor agregado, pues dependiendo del producto, los limpia y pela o pica. Por ello, obtiene mayores ganancias en el momento de su comercialización, además la mayoría de sus clientes son de otras ciudades y de empresas de alimentos. Ricardo reparte su producto en su movilidad propia que es su motocarro, siendo su deseo a futuro, tener más terrenos de cultivo y una piscigranja de truchas. 
Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, el es parte de un banco comunal y además de ser muy entusiasta, es puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para sembrar arveja.
texts.en:
Ricardo is single, 32 years old, and currently lives with his mother. He works harvesting and selling agricultural products. Since he was a small child he learned how to carry out agricultural work and now works independently. However, he does not just sell his products after harvesting, but rather he also adds value to them by, depending on the product, cleaning, pealing, and cutting them. For this work, he earns better profits; the majority of his clients are from other cities and from the food industry. Ricardo sells his products from his own mobile motorcar, hoping that in the future he will have more land to cultivate and a trout farm (aquaculture).

This is his third time acquiring a loan through MFP; he is a member of a Communal Bank and in addition to being very enthusiastic, he is punctual in his payments. The money that he is currently requesting will be invested in the purchase of fertilizer and planting peas.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: La Poma Group

texts.es:
Integrantes  3000   6000 María de la Concepción B. R. 5000

Isidra de Fátima L. B. de 38 años desde 1991 tiene una dulcería donde realiza postres y dulces tradicionales como pioquinto, piñonate, hojuelas, cajetas de leche y coco, papaya con piña,  etc.
Ella aprendió este oficio de su madre y comenzó a realizarlos para venta. Este negocio es unos de los que inicio  junto con Adim y han ido creciendo juntos. L. aseguro que lo que más le gusta es el sistema de trabajo ya que le es favorable.
Las otras integrantes son María de la Concepción Valtodano R. de 65 años realiza cajetas de leche y coco, piñonate, sapoyo (sapote en dulce), ayote en miel….etc. y  Rosa L. de 39 años desde 1990 se dedica a la agricultura de flores, plátanos y cítricos y a la crianza de aves de corral. A sus inicios solo criaba aves pero luego fue creciendo y empezó a cultivar.
texts.en:
Isidra de Fátima L. B., 38, has had a sweet shop since 1991. She makes desserts and traditional sweets like “pioquinto” (rum cake), “piñonate” (candied pine nuts), “hojuelas” (a type of fritter), “cajetas de leche y coco” (coconut caramels), and “papaya con piña” (papaya with pineapple), etc. She learned how to do this from her mother, and she started to make the sweets to sell. This is one of the businesses that she started with Adim, and they have been growing together. L. affirms that what she likes most about this system of work is that it is profitable. Another member is María de la Concepción Valtodano R., 65, who makes cajetas de leche y coco, piñonate, “sapoyo” (a candied regional fruit), and “ayote en miel” (squash and honey, similar to a sweet potato pie) etc. The third member, Rosa L., 39, has been growing flowers, bananas, and citrus since 1990. She also raises poultry. When she started she just raised birds, but then that was growing and she started to farm.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials like milk, sweetener, cinnamon, cloves, wood, cocoa, and papaya...etc. to make sweets

loans.name: Praxedes Litardo

texts.en:
Praxedes Litardo R. A. is 42 years old and lives in the Paraiso district of Guayaquil. He is happily married with 3 grown children. Paraiso is a peri-urban, marginalized zone (between the suburbs and the countryside) without paved roads, water pipes, or a sewer system.

Mr. R. runs a tailor shop located off a quieter dirt path; his services include shoe repair, upholstery and zipper and handbag repair. He started his career by making tailor-made shirts and pants; over the years his business has expanded.

Mr. R. is requesting a loan to buy zippers (in every color), cloth and shoe soles, which would supply him with the materials necessary to take care of customer demands at a moment's notice.

With this loan he will be able to buy a larger quantity of materials from Santa Elena (a local wholesale vendor) at a discounted rate.

In the future, he would like to buy sheet metal to secure the roof of his shop. He dreams of one day being a material's distributor to other tailors in the city.

He is grateful for any support we can provide his business so that his family may prosper!

loans.use: To buy cloth, zippers and shoe soles.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi T. is a 56-year-old woman living in the town of Auala 2. She is widowed and has 8 adult children. To make a living, Naomi owns and operates a bakery. The main source of income for the business comes from baking and selling cookies in the local community. Naomi has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 300 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Naomi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Naomi is now requesting a loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase baking equipment. This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Naomi plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baking equipment

loans.name: Victorio

texts.en:
Victorio R. is from the village of Ramos East. He is 36 years old. Victorio is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Victorio owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Victorio has been engaged in his business for years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Victorio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Victorio is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Victorio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Ambrosia

texts.es:
Ambrosia tiene 51 años, vive con su esposo (Rómulo), de también 51 años. Ellos viven en la tranquilidad de su hogar con 3 de sus 8 hijos; Edwin de 20, Nilda de 18 y Freddy de 15 años, el resto de sus hijos son mayores y ya tienen familias propias.

Cada día en la vida de esta trabajadora mujer es una lucha constante por salir adelante, se levanta muy temprano con muchas ganas de empezar a trabajar en su negocio de venta de carne, en un puesto de uno de los mercados mayoristas de la ciudad. A Ambrosia le gusta atender muy amablemente a sus clientes, lo hace con mucha paciencia y dedicación, y laborando todo el día logra obtener buenas ganancias, las cuales le permiten ayudar a su familia.
En ocasiones, su esposo la ayuda con su negocio, sobre todo cuando ella tiene que salir. Para el futuro desea ampliar su negocio e implementarlo con una vitrina donde pueda exhibir las carnes frescas que vende. Ambrosia tiene muchos proyectos en mente y sabe que todos los puede hacerlos realidad con esfuerzo.

Este es el sexto préstamo que tiene con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que es muy responsable y honesta, además no le gustaría quedar mal. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mercadería para abastecer su negocio, además quiere modernizarlo con nuevos utensilios para llamar más la atención de los clientes y vender en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Ambrosia is 51. She lives with her husband, Rómulo, who is also 51. They live in the tranquility of their home with three of their eight children. Edwin is 20, Nilda is 18, and Freddy is 15. The rest of the children are grown and have their own families. Every day of her life is a constant fight to get ahead for this hard-working woman. She gets up very early with a great desire to start working in her business of selling meat. She works at a stall in one of the wholesale markets in the city. She likes to wait on her customers very kindly. She does it with much patience and dedication. By working all day she gets good earnings, which allow her to help her family. Sometimes her husband helps with her business, mostly when she has to leave. In the future she wants to expand her business and equip it with a showcase where she would be able to display the fresh meat that she sells. Ambrosia has many projects in mind, and she knows that with effort she can make all of them a reality. This is her sixth loan with MFP. She is prepared to make all of her payments on time because she is very responsible and honest. Also, she would not like to have problems. She will use the money she is asking for to buy merchandise to stock her business. She also wants to modernize the business with new utensils. This will get more customer attention, and she will sell more.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady B. est âgée de 33 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Petit Kandé depuis 05 ans et a eu à bénéficié de 10 prêts qu'elle toujours régulièrement remboursés. Elle fait un commerce de tissus teintés, elle achète sa marchandise en gros et revend dans son quartier. Elle participe à la prise en charge quotidienne de la famille.
texts.en:
Fatou B. is 33 years old, married and has four children. She has been a member of the village bank in Petit Kandé for five years and has had ten loans which she has always paid back on a regular basis. She buys and sells dyed fabric, buying her merchandise wholesale and selling it on in her neighborhood. She contributes to her family's daily expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop her business

loans.name: Marisol Concepcion

texts.es:
Marisol B. de 38 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, su esposo es taxista con el tiene 2 hijos que estudian es escuelas fiscales.

Marisol empezó vendiendo artículos de cocina a vecinos de su sector, poco a poco tuvo ingresos necesarios para comprar una vitrina y comenzar a vender suministros de papelería.

Ahora Marisol trabaja todos los días en su casa desde las 07h30 hasta las 08h30, vendiendo papelería y en ocasiones también hace trabajos de computadora, uno de los inconvenientes que tiene es la iluminación en las noches que es escasa en donde vive.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, hojas, tinta para la impresora y otros suministros para su papelería. En el futuro quiere tener un Cyber con todos los utensilios de papelería.
texts.en:
Marisol B., 38, lives in a periurban area of Paraíso de Guayaquil in a cement house that has all basic utilities. Her husband is a taxi driver and they have two children enrolled in public school. Marisol started off selling kitchen articles to her neighbors in thearea. Little by little she earned enough to buy a display case and to stock stationery items. Now, Marisol works every day from 7:30am until 8:30pm selling stationery items; sometimes she does jobs on the computer. One of the obstacles she faces is the lack of street lighting at night in her neighborhood. She will use the funds to buy notebooks, paper, printer ink and other supplies for her stationery store. In the future, she would like to set up an Internet access business stocked with stationery supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Notebooks, sheets of paper, ink.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda O. is currently in the business of selling tea and bread in a restaurant. She is requesting a loan to buy powdered milk, sugar and tea leaves to make tea to sell.  Rhoda is 49 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant. Rhoda has 6 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy powdered milk, sugar and tea leaves to make tea to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda P. is from the village of Malagana, Claveria Misamis Oriental. She is 48 years old. Erlinda is married and has 9 adult-aged children. To make a living, Erlinda owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Erlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Erlinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business and to buy basic needs of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina es socia del Banco Comunal Solución.
Delfina es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 1 hijo, Delfina su esposo se dedican a la elaboración de ladrillos artesanales en la comunidad de Compañía, Además Delfina siembra verduras que vende en el mercado de abastos.
Delfina necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en el pago de peones.
Delfina sueña con salir adelante y brindar una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Delfina is a member of the Solución Communal Bank. She is 32 years old, lives with a partner, and has one son. Delfina and her husband have a business making bricks in the Compañía community. Delfina also grows vegetables that she sells in the market. Delfina needs a loan of 900 soles to pay workers. She dreams of getting ahead and providing a good education for her son.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay workers.

loans.name: Milenia Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Milena del Carmen Gutiérrez M.  ella se desempeña como comerciante de la carne de cerdo y vende pan  tiene de dedicarse a esta actividad  veinte y dos años,  ella es casada actualmente. Ha tenido  doce créditos con CEPRODEL y este crédito ella lo está solicitando para la compra de dos cerdos para destazarlo y compra de materia prima para hacer pan, ella con el préstamo se ayuda en su negocio y en su vida   familiar.
texts.en:
Milena del Carmen Gutiérrez M. works as a merchant selling pork and bread. She has been carrying out this activity for 22 years. She is currently married. She has taken 12 loans with CEPRODEL, and this loan will be used to buy 2 pigs to slaughter, and to buy raw materials to make bread. This loan will help Milena with her business and with her family life.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy 2 pigs to slaughter, and flour and corn to make bread to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Selling basic necessities

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is the mother of two children. She started running a business in rice and pig farming in 1987. At present she manages a piggery and plans to buy more pigs. That’s why she sought help from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to obtain a loan and provide farm supplies for her businesses.

Arlene requested a loan of 7,000 Php. She hopes that with farming, the needs of her family will be met.

loans.use: To buy piglets and farm supplies

loans.name: Isolda Adilia

texts.es:
Isolda es una mujer joven, muy emprendedora, trabajadora, se caso joven, procreo dos hijos, su esposo trabaja como electricista. Isolda ha tenido el apoyo de su mama económicamente para que sea una mujer de negocio. Desde hace años su mama emigro a España y manda remesas a su hija. Cuando inicio con un pequeño negocio de frutas, y golosinas, luego con financiamiento de Afodenic logro aumentar su inventario, su mama ayudo ahora para hacer las mejoras de la infraestructura en donde ha logrado acomodar mas su pulpería.
 Con este préstamo invertirá en comprar  granos básicos, golosinas, gaseosas, carnes con el objetivo de vender mas, aumentar de clientela. Contenta por que ha logrado mantener su negocio a pesar de que las ventas están bajas, pero no se deja de vender, es  por eso la necesidad de incrementar su negocio para equilibrar su economía.
texts.en:
Isolda is a very enterprising, young woman. She married when she was young and had two children. Her husband is an electrician. Isolda has had the financial support of her mother to be able to set up in business. Several years ago, her mother emigrated to Spain and sends Isolda funds. Initially, Isolda began with a small shop selling fruit and sweets. With a subsequent loan from Afodenic, Isolda was able to expand her inventory. Nowadays, her mother helps Isolda to increase her wares and expand her shop. With this loan, Isolda plans to invest in more staple grains, sweets, fizzy drinks, meat, etc. The goal is to sell more goods and increase her clientele. Isolda is happy because she has managed to keep her business going despite sales being low. However, she has not stopped selling goods. It is therefore necessary to expand her business to safeguard her earning potential.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy staple grains, sweets, fizzy drinks, meat, etc., to increase sales.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel Q. A., tiene la edad de 35 años, está en unión libre, y vive con señora y dos hijos, ellos son su mayor prioridad. Sus hijos tienen 4 y 10 años de edad.  El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante, para darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café, y así lograr una mejor calidad y obtener un mayor ingreso cuando sea tiempo de la cosecha, además para pagar la mano de obra. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Miguel tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Miguel Q. A., age 35, is in a common law marriage. He lives with his life partner and their two children. They are his greatest priority. Their children are four and ten years old. He wants the loan to help with his farm. Specifically, it is to help with the coffee crop. That way he will get a better quality and obtain greater income when it is time to sell the harvest. He will also use the loan to pay for labor. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He is very happy with the terms of the loan he got. Miguel has been working with livestock for several years. In the future he hopes to give his family a better quality of life and greater economic stability. He also hopes to be able to continue growing as a person and, above all, as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Help with the coffee crop

loans.name: Eugenio Ramón

texts.es:
El señor Eugenio Ramón O. S., es propietario de una joyería de nombre RUBI, que se encuentra ubicada en el sector del mercado el Bisne, es  casado con 3 hijos de los cuales solo una depende de él, ya que tiene problemas mentales.
El señor O. S. lleva ya 41 créditos con CEPRODEL, los cuales los ha pagado bien pues a pesar de trabajar solo ha demostrado ser una persona bien responsable.
texts.en:
Sr. Eugenio Ramón O. S. is the owner of a jewelry store called “Rubi”, which is located in a section of the Bisne Market. He is married and has three children, one of whom is a dependent and suffers from mental health problems.

Sr. Oliveres S. already has 41 loans with CEPRODEL, all of which have been repaid on time. Even though he works alone, he has demonstrated that he is a responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase gold

loans.name: Elizabet

texts.en: Elizabet D. C. is from the village of Linabo. She is 43 years old. Elizabet is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Elizabet operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Elizabet is just starting this business. In 2008, Elizabet joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabet has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) from PMPC. Elizabet is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Elizabet from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta S. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Malipayon, Brgy. Banago, Bacolod City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  a general store and a pig fattening business. Her husband, Roel S., who is 47 years old, works as a driver to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are 9 to 14 years old. 

Antonieta joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2010 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Antonieta has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. The additional working capital from her previous loan of PHP 5,000 helped her increase her monthly profit to PHP 10,000, improving the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her second loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use as additional capital to buy more stock for her general store so that she can continue to save for the future and send her children to school. Antonieta S. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Jean Katherine

texts.en:
Jean Katherine C. is from the village of Eastern, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 24 years old. Jean Katherine is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Jean Katherine owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Jean Katherine has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jean Katherine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jean Katherine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jean Katherine is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Jean Katherine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Karen Lorelein

texts.es:
Karen de 23 años, vende ropa desde que salio del colegio para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su casa. Vive en una zona periurbana de Guayaquil llamada “Fortín”. 

Realiza su trabajo sola desde muy temprano,  vende pantalones, blusas por catalogo. . No tiene horario fijo porque sus ventas las hacen por pedido. Aunque le cuesta deja a su hijo mientas que sale a vender la ropa ella sigue trabajando para darle una mejor vida. 

Ella quiere el préstamo para comprar ropa y con las ganancias asegurar un fondo de ahorros para su hijo. En el futuro quiere tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
23-year old Karen has sold clothing ever since she left high school to help her husband with household expenses. She lives in a suburb outside Guayaquil called Fortín. Karen works alone and sets out early each day to sell pants and blouses from a catalog. She doesn’t have a fixed schedule as her sales depend on the orders she gets. Although it bothers her to leave her son while she goes out selling clothing, she continues in order to provide him with a better life. She is seeking a loan to buy more clothing and with the money she earns, she plans to start a savings fund for her son. In the future she would like to have a house of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Michaela

texts.en:
Michaela T. is from the village of Villa Verde, Iligan City. She is 35 years old. Michaela is married and has 3 school-age children. To make a living, Michaela owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Michaela has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Michaela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Michaela is requesting a  loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Michaela from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Villaverde, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Jans Steven

texts.es:
JANS STEVEN, (A QUIEN APRECIAMOS EN LA FOTOGRAFÍA) TIENE 20 AÑOS DE EDAD, CONVIVE SOLO CON SU MADRE EN LA ZONA DE LA MERCED – COMAS, ES SOLTERO Y ACTUALMENTE ESTUDIA LA CARRERA DE GASTRONOMIA CURSANDO EL CUARTO CICLO, ADEMAS PARA SOLVENTAR SUS GASTOS, EN CIERTAS OCASIONES AYUDA A SU TIO EN LIMPIAR MAQUINAS DE TRAGAMONEDAS DESDE HACE 2 MESES, LA CUAL QUEDA UBICADO AL COSTADO DE SU DOMICILIO, ENTRE LOS GRANDES SUEÑOS QUE TIENE JANS ES EL DE ACABAR SU CARRERA Y TENER SU PROPIO NEGOCIO DE UN RESTAURANTE TURISTICO.
EL RECIENTEMENTE PRESTAMO SERA DESTINADO PARA LA COMPRA DE INSUMOS Y MENSUALIDAD DE SU CARRERA, SU MADRE LE APOYA CON LO QUE PUEDE EN SUS ESTUDIOS AUNQUE A VECES NO ES SUFICIENTE YA QUE ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE PRODUCTOS NATURALES. JANS ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO PORQUE GRACIAS AL PRESTAMO PODRA CONTINUAR CON SUS ESTUDIOS.
texts.en:
Jans Steven (seen here in the photograph) is 20 years old and he lives with his mother in the city of Merced-Comas. He is single and he is on his fourth term in a cooking college. In order to cover his personal expenses sometimes he helps his uncle attend to the slot machine located near his house. One of Jans' greatest dreams it to finish his schooling and to have his own restaurant that caters to tourists. This loan will be used to purchase ingredients and to cover his monthly tuition bills. His mother supports him as much as she can with the school expenses but it is not enough. She sells natural health products. Jans is very appreciative of the loan because it gives him the opportunity to stay in school.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Laidou Group

texts.fr:
Les Cinq  membres du groupe LAIDOU sont 1 femme mariée, 2 veuves et 2 célibataires, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et ont en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames à SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali) 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, la lingerie, les condiments alimentaires et la vente d’articles divers de boutique (omo, bonbon, savon,  sachet de lait en poudre, cigarettes, biscuits, conserves alimentaires etc...)  avec  FATOUMATA B..
Fatoumata B. compte acheter avec son  prêt  25 cartons d'omo, 15 paquets de bonbons,  5 cartons de savon et divers autres petits articles. 
Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché et  effectue sa vente sur place dans sa boutique à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, en détail au  comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses  et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The five members of the LAIDOU group include one married woman, two widows, and two single women, with an average age of 40 and an average of 4 children.  Most of them live in monogamous families in Sanoubougoui, a neighborhood in the city of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali).

This is their first collaboration with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, with the goal of better satisfying their customers.  With Fatoumata B., this group of women sells various goods such as underwear, condiments, detergent, candy, soap, powdered milk packets, cigarettes, biscuits, canned goods, etc.

Fatoumata B. plans to use her loan to buy 25 cartons of detergent, 15 packets of candy, 5 cartons of soap, and various other small items.  She buys her supplies in the large market and sells them on a cash or credit basis in her retail store to a customer base made up of men and women.  She expects to make an average monthly profit of 50,000FCFA, part of which will be used to support her husband in their expenses and part of which will be re-invested in the business.

loans.use: Pour acheter divers articles de boutique

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty O. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Resty has a business selling food, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Resty has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food. With the help of the loan, she hopes to generate greater profits. In the future, Resty hopes to own a salon. She is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her more job skills like poultry care.

loans.use: food to sell

loans.name: Hermez Antonio

texts.es: Hermes Antonio Méndez Rodríguez, el está en unión libre y vive con su mujer. El quiere comprar la semilla del tomate para su siembra posteriormente al igual que su producción. Además, su finca es apta para la explotación de este cultivo y su buena producción. Tiene varios años que se dedica a su finca y quiere crecer como un  productor de tomate de la zona. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no ha tenido problemas en su propiedad, pero si tiene el deseo de que sea una finca productiva y ejemplo para los demás productores. El no ha realizados otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. El tiene como meta llegar a generar ganancias para su bienestar propio y de su mujer  en el futuro y seguir creciendo en el negocio de la producción de tomate y también crecer como persona.
texts.en:
Hermes Antonio Méndez Rodríguez lives with his common-law wife. He wishes to buy tomato seeds so he can plant a crop and harvest the tomatoes. His land is very suitable for growing and harvesting tomatoes. He has been a farmer for several years and wishes to expand into tomato production.

This is his first loan from Kiva partner FUDECOSUR. He has no problems with his property but does want it to become a productive farm. He has not had loans with other banks. FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan with easier terms and a much lower interest rate.

Domingo’s goal is to generate more income to support himself and his partner in the future, to continue expanding the tomato business, and to grow as a person.

loans.use: to plant a tomato crop

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Maria Ermelinda

texts.es:
María, resiD. en San Francisco Gotera, tiene 42 años D. edad, su negocio es la venta D. sopa D. mondongo (pansa D. vaca), chilate y tamales, ella vive con su esposo don Cristino R. y sus dos hijos José Cristino D. 17 años D. edad, Johana Melissa D. 13 años D. edad, ella realiza sus ventas tres veces por semana alternando sus ventas D. sopa, otros días tamales y otros chilate con miel, como estrategia para que sus clientes le compren seguido.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo  para la compra D. los ingredientes como verduras para la sopa, maíz y plátano para el chilate y los tamales, su intención es tener a disponibilidad lo necesario para la preparación D. su venta y D. esta manera estar preparada para la demanda.
Ella sueña con tener la capacidad económica para apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios y que estos se preparen para optar por mejor estilo D. vida.
texts.en:
María lives in San Francisco Gotera.  She is 42 years old and has a business selling the following food items: "sopa D. mondongo" (cow tripe soup), chilate (a traditional corn-based warm drink) and tamales.  She lives with her husband, don Cristino R., and their two children, 17 year-old José Cristino and 13 year-old Johana Melissa.  Maria makes her sales three times a week.  As a business strategy to encourage her customers  to make frequent purchases, she alternates between offering soups some days, chilate with honey other days and tamales on still other days.
Currently, Maria is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients, like vegetables for the soup and corn and bananas for the chilate and the tamales.  Her plan is to have enough ingredients available that she can prepare enough food for sale to meet the demand.
She hopes to have the financial capacity to support her children in their education so that they can be able to choose a better way of life.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables, corn and bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy iron to continue with her welding work

loans.name: Mango Tree Development Group-Mukono

texts.en:
Six years is the time 46-year old Joseph K. has been teaching in schools in and around Mukono, principally in Nkonkonjeru. He is also a deputy headteacher at one of the schools. Teaching, like other professions, requires diligence, integrity and steadfastness. In that regard, Joseph has not fallen short. 

Joseph is happily married with four children, three of whom attend school. Before he seriously took up teaching, he used to sell agricultural produce. He still sells agricultural produce, though teaching is now his main pursuit. 

Joseph is affiliated  with Mango tree development group-Mukono. He says he makes monthly profits in the sum of 80,000 Ugandan shillings. With this loan, Joseph says he is going to purchase more books for the school library in one of the schools he teaches in.

loans.use: To purchase more books for the school library.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “URPI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria del Carmen; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos lacteos y también trabaja en un laboratorio,los productos lacteos que vende son quesos,mantequilla y leche de vaca,la socia quiere tener una tienda para vender los productos lacteos. La socia solicita el préstamo para productos para hacer la leche y mantequilla.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria del Carmen belongs to the URPI community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Maria del Carmen is 40 years old and single.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling dairy products.  She also works in a laboratory.  The dairy products she sells are cheeses, butter and cow's milk.  She would like to have a store where she could sell her dairy products.

Maria del Carmen is requesting this loan to make her cheeses and butter.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To make cheese and butter

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana  tiene su propio negocio desde hace nueve años, una tapicería que logro empezar junto a su esposo.
Anteriormente trabajo en zona franca, para cubrir los gastos básicos de agua, luz entre otros. Hoy en día esta trabando en su tapicería. En donde con los financiamiento ha crecido en producción como en sus niveles de venta, siendo Afodenic el medio de su crecimiento, con quince ciclos en donde ha mejorado su vivienda, aumentado sus ventas.
Con este nuevo crédito pondrá cerámica a su sala ya que aun es de tierra y desea hacer la mejora para estar en mejores condiciones de higiene. Comprara  cuarenta metros de cerámica, bondex, porcelana, separadores entre otros y comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Ana has had her own business for nine years-- a tapestry store which she started with her husband.
She previously worked in a free port to cover her basic costs such as water and electricity, among others. She is now working in her tapestry store, which has grown with the help of loans, both in its level of production and its level of sales. Afodenic has provided the loans for the business' growth. In fifteen cycles she has improved her home and increased her sales.
With this new loan she will install ceramic in a room of her home, since it currently has a dirt floor and she wants to make this improvement to improve her hygiene.
She will purchase fourty metres of ceramic, bondex, porcelain and separators, among other items, to start the job.

loans.use: she will purchase ceramic to put on the floor, in order to achieve better hygiene and comfort for her family.

loans.name: Patrocinio

texts.es:
Patrocinio tiene 47  años de edad que reside en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola bastante comercial que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Patrociniose dedica a la crianza y comercialización de ganado menor como ovinos y caprinos. Él cría los animales en un corral situado cerca a su domicilio. Él los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes y vecinos de  la zona en donde reside. 

El desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Patrocinio es una persona bastante empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Patrocinio is 47 years old. He lives in the district of Olmos, a very commercial agricultural area belonging to the province of Lambayeque. It is located more than 1.5 hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Patrocinio raises and sells young livestock such as sheep and goats. He raises the animals in a corral located near his house. He feeds them grain and grass. When they have reached a good size, he sells them to business people and neighbors in the area where he lives. 

He would like to buy more animals and commercial feed so he can expand his business and earn a greater income. He has requested a loan of PEN 2,000.00 in order to achieve his goal. 

Patrocinio is an enterprising and hardworking person. His greatest wish is to continue growing as a business owner so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: Buy livestock and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a room for her children and offer them more privacy

loans.name: Rosario Angela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Rosario; La socia tiene 60 años de edad, la socia es casada, la socia tiene 1 hijo; la socia tiene una agencia de viajes y ella se dedica a administrar su negocio, la agencia de la socia se llama Inversiones Viset Perú; la socia también alterna su trabajo y se dedica a la venta de ropa, la socia saca el préstamo para invertir en la compra de ropa para la venta.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Rosario is a member of the community bank "Patron San Sebastian", located in the Huanchac district in the province and department of Cusco.  

Rosario is 60 years old, married, and has one child.  She owns a travel agency and she works to run her business.  Her travel agency is called Viset Perú.  In addition to the travel agency, she also sells clothing.  

She is asking for this loan in order to purchase clothing to sell.

She is happy with the loan provided and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Ferlie

texts.en: Ferlie is a married woman who lives in Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by selling vegetables and farming. Her husband Oscar, who is 49 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have five children who are between 3 and 22 years old. Ferlie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ferlie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 24,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 14,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing PHP 27,000 to buy more vegetables to sell and to buy fertilizers, etc. for her farm, so that she can continue to save up for her children's education. Ferlie is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie, 50 years old, is a married woman from San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She has 2 children, aged 21 and 10 years old.

Vergie is a farmer who has been growing rice for 6 years. She earns an income by selling her harvest to the market. Vergie also raises chickens. She works hard to support her family. Vergie's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. In the future, Vergie hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Aidee

texts.es:
Con su credikiva Aidee compró ropa, jeans, calzado y otras mercancías para la venta así como también compró insumos para la preparación de los sancochos;  en la actualidad está solicitando su segundo financiamiento por esta misma línea de crédito y comprará más mercancías porque se acerca el día de la madre y con ello se incrementan las compras de productos y mercancías dirigidas a la mujer como perfumes, electrodomésticos menores, calzado y ropa femenina ; Su meta es continuar  recibiendo la ayuda de las instituciones financieras,  y lograr que sus hijos terminan sus estudios , estas son las palabras que envía Aidee a su financiadores de Kiva:  “Que Dios los siga bendiciendo yu que sigan con esta actividad muy linda de apoyar a muchos microempresarios”
Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Aidee ingrese al siguiente enlace:
texts.en:
Aidee used her past CrediKiva loan to buy clothing, jeans, shoes and other merchandise to sell.  She also bought ingredients to make sancochos.

Now she is requesting a second loan to buy goods for Mother's Day which approaching.  She wants to buy women's products such as perfumes, small electric appliances, shoes and clothing.  Her goal is to continue receiving support from financial institutions and help her children finish their education.

Aidee sends these words to Kiva lenders:  "God bless you and please keep up with this beautiful way of helping so many micro-businesspeople."

loans.use: To buy women's products such as perfumes, small electric appliances, shoes and clothing

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is 41 years old and married with 3 children, ages between 3 and 7. He runs a store at Lumley in Sierra Leone.

Mohamed has been in this business for 10 years and sells milk, drinks, ovaltine, and biscuits at his store. His business is the only source of income he has. He says that the main challenge to his business is inflation.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more provision items. Mohamed says that the extra income from this loan will help him expand his business. In the future, he would like to run a super market.

loans.use: To purchase milk, drinks, Ovaltine and biscuits.

loans.name: Belen

texts.es:
Belén ella es una persona soltera con  una Mayoría de edad, vive en coapilla estado de Chiapas México. Estudio hasta el segundo grado de primaria  ya que sus  padres no tenían recursos para darle una educación.
    Ella se dedica a la elaboración de panes desde hace  diese siete años y seis  meses, en donde comenta que le va bien ya que con ellos a salido adelante junto con su familia  que son su sobrinos.
     Nos comenta que desde muy joven su madre la enseño a  lo que es la panadería y con el tiempo comenzó a practicarlo y es así como hasta la fecha de hoy sigue trabajando y le deja buenas ganancias que es con lo que se  sostiene en sus gastos que se generan en su vida diaria.
     Lo que más desea es  que con esta actividad y el préstamo  logres se seguir trabajando hasta que dios  le siga prestando vida.
texts.en:
Belén is a single older woman who lives in Coapilla, located in the State of Chiapas, Mexico.  She completed up to second grade of elementary school, as her parents did not have the resources to provide her with an education.

She has worked making bread for the past 17 ½ years and says that it is going well, as she has been able to get her family ahead in life, including her nephews.

She tells us that her mother taught her to make bread when she was very young and over time, she began to practice and that is how she continues working today.  It provides her with good profits, which is what she uses to cover the expenses generated in their daily life.

What she wants most from her work and this loan is to continue working as long as God continues giving her life.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of ingredients such as oil, flour, eggs, cheese, baking powder and other items to make bread.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with four children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that  has neither electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For over 25 years, she has operated a coconuts selling business. In addition she does dairy farming which contributes to her other source of income. Fatuma faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of coconuts for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of coconuts for sale.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge Alberto se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos, hace más de 8 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de salir adelante. Por lo que no es la primera vez que solicita financiamientos, pues ha sido muy gratificante para él. A pesar de su edad, siempre se ha caracterizado por ser un hombre trabajador y luchador.  El sale todos los días a vender sus productos. Así con el financiamiento podrá comprar leche, crema, cuajada, queso y otros productos.
texts.en:
Jorge Alberto sells dairy products.  He has been in this business for more than eight years.  He is always looking for ways to get ahead in life.

This is not the first loan that Jorge Alberto has requested a loan and it has been very rewarding for him.  In spite of his age, he has always been noted as being a hard-working and tenacious man.  He goes out every day to sell his products.  He will use this loan to buy milk, cream, curd, cheese and other products.

loans.use: to buy milk, cream, curd, cheese and other products

loans.name: Dao-On

texts.en:
Dao-on is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Dao-on has a retail shop that sells medicinal food supplements from USANA Foods. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy additional medicinal food supplements.

Dao-on is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Dao-on hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional medicinal food supplements.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a 31-year-old married man with three children. He lives in a permanent house in Kamwenge, Uganda.
Fredrick has been in the food sales business for the past three years. He faces the challenge of limited funds to meet increasing demand. His business dream is to own a food store. Fredrick intends to use this loan facility to buy maize for resale. His family dream is to set up an income-generating activity for the family and to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy maize for resale.

loans.name: Hector Noel

texts.es:
Héctor, de 42 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de León, tiene tres hijos de 19,14y 9 años  de edad respectivamente el mayor de sus hijos juega en un equipo de beisbol, los otros dos estudian. Héctor es carpintero, aprendió este oficio por medio de su padre pues antes era el quien dirigía el negocio familiar con el paso del tiempo su padre se lo dejo de herencia y así ha venido surgiendo poco a poco de este negocio alimenta y viste a su familia.
El solicito el préstamo para comprar materia prima como clavos, pega, tornillos y madera para elaborar puertas, ventanas, roperos, sillas. El desea no solo mejorar la calidad de su trabajo si no darlo a conocer en toda la ciudad, pues desea incrementar el numero de clientes, hacerle mejoras su local, comprar maquinaria nueva y moderno que la ayuden a cumplir su trabajo de forma rápida y eficiente  y apoyar a sus tres campeones sus hijos.
texts.en:
Héctor is 42 years old and lives in the city of León.  He has three children aged 19, 14 and 9.  The eldest of his children plays on a baseball team and the other two are in school.  Héctor is a carpenter.  He learned the trade from his father who used to run the family business.  Over time, his father left the business to Héctor who has been making gradual progress in it.  The business feeds and clothes his family.

Héctor requested this loan to buy raw materials such as nails, adhesive, screws and wood for making doors, windows, wardrobes and chairs.  He would like not only to improve the quality of his work but also to become known throughout the city as he would like to increase his number of customers, make some improvements to his premises, buy new and modern machinery which will help him to do his work quickly and efficiently, and support his three champions - his children.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as nails, adhesive, screws and wood to make doors, windows, wardrobes and chairs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to smoke to supply her customers.

loans.name: Alida

texts.es: Alida, de 34 años, es una mujer emprendedora y sobre todo muy trabajadora, convive con su pareja con quien tiene tres hijos de 15, 7 y 1 años de edad. Juntos habitan en su casa propia. El trabajo de Alida consiste en realizar todo sobre carpintería metálica, (sillas, mecedoras, puertas, etc). Este trabajo lo hace desde hace casi siete años, su taller se encuentra instalada en su casa y cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su pareja con quien forman un buen grupo de trabajo. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede trabajar junto a su pareja y sus hijos, además tiene buenos clientes y cuando no hay trabajo, se encarga de salir a la calle a ofrecer lo que fabrica. Espera en adelante terminar de construir su casa y acondicionar un espacio para su negocio. Este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, por tanto espera poder pagar todas sus cutas de manera puntual para no perjudicar a sus demás compañeras de grupo comunal. Con el monto solicitado, comprará fierros para seguir fabricando sillas y mecedoras.
texts.en: Alida, 34, is a very enterprising woman and above all, a very hardworking one. She lives with her partner with whom she has three children, 15, 7 and 1 years of age. Together they live in their own home. Alida’s work consists of metallic carpentry (chairs, rocking chairs, doors, etc). She has been doing this work for seven years. Her workshop is in her house and she has the wholehearted support of her partner with whom she forms a good working partnership. What she likes about her work is that she can do it together with her partner and their children. In addition she has a good clientele and when there is no work, she is in charge of going on the street to sell what she makes. She hopes in the near future to finish construction on her house and remodeling a space for her business. This is her first loan with MFP and she expects to be able to make all of her payments on time in order not to penalize other members of her communal bank. With the sum requested, she will buy iron so she can continue making chairs and rockers.

loans.use: to buy iron.

loans.name: San Jose  San Juditas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se  llama  San José  San Judiítas  sus integrantes decidieron ponerle así  ya que son muy devotos al santo san Judiítas , le hacen fiesta  cada año, este grupo esta  conformado  por once integrantes  indígenas  con sueños  e ilusiones por que quieren  conseguir sus  sueños con esfuerzo y honradez, son personas llenas de esperanzas y metas que alcanzar ,son  humildes y buenos amigos entre ellos mismos  este es un grupo  que desea cumplir sus sueños  para ayudarles a sus hijos para que puedan estudiar y ganarse el pan de cada día sin olvidar sus raíces  y sus  orígenes.
El señor  Carlos  es la persona que los invito a formar parte de este grupo  ya que todos son vecinos y  amigos.
El señor Carlos tiene   treinta y nueve años de edad, se dedica al trabajo de mecánico cuenta con un local que esta a una cuadra de su casa , su hijo  Ernesto le ayuda  cuando regresa de la esuela  ya que le  gusta mucho este trabajo  por que don   Carlos desde  muy pequeño le enseño a componer los carros y a conocer sus  partes  y  para que sirven.
El pidió el préstamo   para comprar más piezas  mecánicas  ya que su inventario esta escaso  y en ocasiones van mas a compara piezas  y no tiene y no desea peder clientes por falta de  mercancía.
Uno de sus sueños es tener el taller mecánico más lleno de mercancía  ya que sus clientes confían en lo que le vende y en el trabajo que les ofrece, por ellos desea  comprar  más mercancía y no retardar sus pedidos.
