Esta muy contento por que cada  día gana mas cliente dándole en servicio que se  merecen  y así poder  darle lo mejor a su esposa Clara y  a su  hijo  Ernesto  por que lo apoyan en las decisiones que tome.
Le da  las gracias a fundación realidad por el apoyo que le ha dado a el y a sus compañeros de grupo para salir adelante y cumplir sus  sueños.
texts.en:
This group is called 'San José San Judiítas'.  The members decided to give the group this name because they are ardent devotees of the saint San Judiítas who they celebrate through a yearly fiesta.  This group has eleven indigenous members who have dreams and ambitions.  They want to achieve their dreams through hard work and honesty.  They are people who are full of hopes and have goals to reach.  They are unassuming people and good friends to each other.  This is a group that would like to fulfil their dreams so that they can help their children to study and earn a living without forgetting their roots and origins.

Carlos is the person who invited the other members to join this group as they are all neighbors and friends.  Carlos is 39 years old.  He works as a mechanic and has business premises which are one block from his home.  His son Ernesto helps him when he gets home from school as he really enjoys this work.  Carlos taught him to repair cars and recognize their parts and their purpose from a very young age.

Carlos requested this loan to buy more spare parts as his stock is low and occasionally people come to buy parts from him and he doesn't have them.  He doesn't want to lose customers owing to a lack of parts.

One of Carlos' dreams is to have more merchandise in his repair shop as his customers trust what he sells them and the work that he does.  For their sake he would like to buy more merchandise and not have to delay the work that they provide him with.

Carlos is very happy because every day he gains more customers who he provides with the service that they deserve.  This means that he can provide his wife Clara and his son Ernesto the best.  They both support him in the decisions that he makes.

Carlos thanks Fundación Realidad for the support that they have given both to himself and his fellow group members so that they can get ahead and fulfil their dreams.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en: Youssef is a 45-year-old Lebanese married man and the father of three children. Two of his children are still attending school. He has 18 years of experience working as a farmer. In 2000, he started running his own farm where he cultivates fruits, especially peaches. With his requested loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l., he will be able to purchase agriculturA. fertilizers to make goods grow more successfully. In the future, he plans to also cultivate vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural fertilizers to make fruits and vegetables grow more successfully

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice is a forty two year old widow with three children. She rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the pharmacy business for eleven years. She received her initial capital from her former employment at a clinic as a nurse. Her hardships are increased taxes and high rent. Her vision is owning a pharmancy and educating her children. Joice needs the loan facility to buy drugs for sale.

loans.use: to buy drugs for sale

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en: Uranchimeg is 38 years old and lives with her son in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in her sister's yard in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her son is a student in public school. She started her business in 2002 by selling women's clothes and leggings in the streets. Now she rents a counter in a market. She is very well experienced and has many regular customers. She has a vision to expand her business by renting multiple counters in a multiple markets. She is a hard working and diligent woman who says, "I have vision to expand my business and to finish my boy's college." She is requesting 500,000 MNT to purchase underwear for her business.

loans.use: To purchase underwear to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Anita has a shop that sells firewood & charcoal per sack. She has had this business for 36 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy raw materials needed for making charcoal.

Anita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Anita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed for making charcoal.

loans.name: Cremildo

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Provincia de Gaza, sul  de Moçambique, solteiro e não tem filhos. Frequenta o ensino medio, vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu de Gaza para Boane na companhia dos pais ainda pequeno, é tecnico de informatica ha mais de 3 anos, e tem um salario de 8.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (cimento, pedra, areia, barrotes, e outros).
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende construir um escritorio de consultoria de contabilidade e serviços, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Cremildo was born in the province of Gaza in southern Mozambique. He is unmarried and has no children. He is going to middle scool. He lives with his family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else. 

He and his parents left Gaza for Boane when he was still young. He has been a computer technician for more than three years and earns a salary of 8,000 meticals a month. He uses his earnings to pay for household expenses and saves some in his bank account.
He's never had a loan from other banks. He heard about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is his first loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which he will use to purchase construction materials (cement, stone, sand, beams, etc.) to build a house.
He is committed to paying off this loan without any problems and in the future intends to start a business offering accounting and other services, for which he will request further loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cement, stone, sand, beams, etc.) to build a house.

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en: Melodina, a 28-year-old married mother of one child, lives in the Philippines where for the past five years she has operated a shop that makes wood and coconut charcoal to sell by the sack. A member of HSPFI since 2010, she is requesting a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy wood and coconut shells to make more charcoal. In the future, Melodina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy wood & coconut shells for making charcoal.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
Rolando de 40 años de edad, convive con su pareja hace 13 años. Tiene un hijo de 13 años, al que cuida y educa como buen padre. Rolando y su familia viven en una casa propia en el distrito de Palcamayo. Rolando realiza servicios de transporte. Con un auto de su propiedad del modelo “Station Wagon”, moviliza personas en la ruta de Tarma – Palcamayo y viceversa. Así también, los días de ferias en la ciudad de Tarma comercializa carne de carnero, res y chancho en un puesto que Guadalupe, su pareja, atiende. “El negocio de las carnes es rentable y más aun cuando se surte. Ya tenemos clientes que nos buscan y hacen pedidos”, comenta.
En todo este tiempo el factor capital, ha sido uno de sus inconvenientes, por ello agradecen a la entidad financiera por el apoyo constante. 
Sus metas son claras: ampliar el negocio, comprando máquinas cortadoras de carne, sierras y una balanza electrónica. Así también piensa adquirir otro automóvil para trabajar con otro personal en el servicio de transporte y destinar al antiguo para el traslado de sus productos en el negocio. Sería el préstamo número 15 que obtendría de MFP, comenta ser firme y constante en el pago de las cuotas. Por otra parte, se siente a gusto trabajando con su banco comunal por la solidaridad y apoyo que encuentra. Invertirá el dinero en la compra de 10 terneras de 100 soles, las que ensebará para el negocio.
texts.en:
Rolando is 40 years old and has lived with this partner for 13 years. He has a 13 year old son that he takes care of and educates as a good father should. Rolando and his family live in their own home in the district of Palcamayo. Rolando is in transportation and has his own car, a “Station Wagon,” and transports people through the Tarma – Palcamayo route and back. During the fair days in the city of Tarma he sells mutton, beef and pig meat in a stall that Guadalupe, his partner, runs. “The meat business is profitable, especially when it’s well stocked. We have customers that look for us and make orders,” Rolando remarks.

In all this time capital has been one of the biggest problems which is why Rolando and his family are grateful to the organization for their constant support.

Rolando’s goals are clear: expand the business, buy meat cutting machines, saws and an electronic scale. He also hopes to have another vehicle to work with, hire a driver and use the old car to transport his products to the business. This will be his fifteenth loan with MFP and says that he will be trustworthy and pay all of his quotas. Rolando feels comfortable working with his communal bank by the unity and support that he encounters. He will use the loan to buy 10 calves at 100 soles that he will fatten up for the business.

loans.use: buy 10 calves.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Maize and groundnuts are what 34-year-old Richard has been selling for the past two-and-a-half years in Kyenjojo food market in the west of Uganda.
Richard has carved out a niche selling the aforementioned foods. What has been playing in his favor is the fact that not so many people are selling what he sells. 

Not so long ago, the demand for maize and groundnuts had slumped and business people involved in that trade shifted focus. There was a turn in the tide however some few months back when demand shot up. Not only was there high demand from western Uganda but from as far off as Kenya, where maize is particularly fancied.

In general terms, the last two years have seen a flood-tide of growth in Richard's business and the congenial father of three says expansion is in the offing.
He intends to use his Kiva loan to purchase more maize and groundnuts from farmers to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more maize and groundnuts from farmers to resell.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a retail business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other retail shop operators in her business. Mwanaidi dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the KES 10,000 loan, she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat oil.  Mwanaidi decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.es:
Luciana es una mujer joven, separada, tiene dos hijos adolescentes. Ella tiene una peluquería con buena clientela, además de eso se dedica a la venta de ropa entre los clientes que se acercan hasta su peluquería.
Ella compra las ropas de Argentina y el Brasil viajando semanalmente a esos lugares. Comenta que se inicio con un dinero que junto con otros trabajos anteriores, mes a mes va aumentando su negocio con su trabajo de peluquera y las ropas que vende. Ella es una persona muy responsable y con ganas de superación, tiene un espíritu jovial y emprendedor que no cabe duda que va a llegar a conseguir todas las metas que se ha propuesto.
Solicita el crédito para la refacción de su peluquería, ya que este es su medio de trabajo y le gustaría poder ofrecer una mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luciana is a young woman.  She’s separated and has two adolescent children.  She has a beauty salon with a good clientele.  She also sells clothes to the customers that come to the beauty salon.

She buys clothes in Argentina and Brazil traveling weekly to those places.  She comments that she started out with money she saved from previous jobs.  Her businesses, both the beauty salon and the clothes sales, grow every month.  She is a very responsible person who wants to get ahead.  She has a jovial, enterprising spirit and without a doubt she will reach all the goals she’s set for herself.

She is asking for the loan to do some improvements to her beauty salon since this is her source of employment and she’d like to make it more comfortable for her customers.

loans.use: to make improvements to her beauty salon.

loans.name: Gaelle

texts.fr:
Cliente de 29 ans avec 4 enfants, elle se lance dans le commerce il ya de cela 7 ans quand elle reconsidère les charges de sa famille, donc pour aider sa famille , elle achète des sacs,valises  pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
ayant deja beneficiee de plusieurs prêts auprès de Hope, c'est une cliente modèle qui a rembourse sans difficultés et a fait des épargnes considérables.Elle a des bonnes stratégies de vente,fournir des meilleurs produits et des meilleurs prix a ses clients.
Pour ce quartrieme  cycle prêt, elle va renforcer le stock des séries des sacs, des valises, des cartables a Kinshasa et fait des commandes en Chine pour satisfaire ses potentiels clients.

Dans l'avenir, elle a le projet d'ouvrir une bagagerie ou l'on trouvera tous les models de sacs et cartables et elle fera la vente en gros et en détail.
texts.en:
This borrower is a 29-year-old married woman and mother of four children. Due to the extent of the household expenses, she became a merchant seven years ago as a means of helping her husband. She buys and sells bags and suitcases to help support her family. 

A model member of Hope, she has already obtained several loans, which she repaid without difficulty. She also accumulated substantial savings. She relies on good sales strategies to provide her customers with better merchandise at better prices. 

She will use this 4th loan to increase her stock of bags, suitcases, satchels, etc. in Kinshasa. She will also place orders in China to meet the needs of potential customers.

In the future, she plans to open a store offering all types of bags and satchels at retail and wholesale.

loans.use: to buy bags, suitcases, satchels, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Monarca Group

texts.es:
Monarca en un grupo solidario muy bueno conformado por 6 mujeres muy trabajadoras todas con un objetivo en común, “sacar a sus familias adelante”. Ellas le pusieron al grupo monarca en honor a la mariposa morarca, por sentirse identificadas con ella al luchar contra todo para llegar a una meta o sueño.

Reyna es una de las integrantes del grupo, es una mujer muy trabajadora de 42 años de edad que habita felizmente con su esposo e hijos en el municipio de Monterrey. Ella decidio dedicarse a la venta de poroductos de belleza y ropa interior para poder ayudar a su marido con los estudios de sus hijos, ya que para ella son lo mas importante en el mundo y quiere verlos triunfar.

Con el crédito que recivió, Reyna va a continuar surtiendo mas productos y ropa, ya que además de que le gusta su negocio, ella quiere luchar para poder progresar poco a poco así como lo a a echo y de esa manera poder tener una mejor calidad de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Monarca is a really good microfinance group comprised of 6 very hardworking women who have one goal in common: to help their families get ahead. They called themselves the Monarca Group in honor of the monarch butterfly because they identify themselves with the butterfly, since they have to fight against all odds in order to reach a goal or a dream.

Reyna is one of the group members. She is a hardworking 42-year-old woman who lives happily with her husband and children in Monterrey. She decided to start selling lingerie and beauty products in order to help her husband cover their children's educational expenses, since her children are the most important thing in the world to her, and she wants to see them succeed.

With this loan, Reyna will continue to acquire more lingerie and beauty products because in addition to liking her business, she wants to work hard to be able to progress little by little, as she has been doing so far, thus she and her family will be able to obtain a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase lingerie and beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Thirty-six years of age with a family of six, Gladys has the responsibility of supporting her husband and children. Gladys is an innovative micro-entrepreneur who builds jikos and stoves for a living. 

She became interested in solar lanterns when her neighbor’s house burnt down as result of a kerosene lamp incident. Her young children have also burnt their fingers while touching the flame of the lamp out of curiosity. For these reasons, she sought out a solution, and that is when she joined Renewable Energy Ventures. She has since stocked on a few units which she has sold to members of her community. 

To support her cause, Gladys needs $700 to buy solar lanterns, which she plans to sell to her community to further alleviate the fire incidents that are associated with the use of kerosene lamps.

loans.use: to increase her solar lantern stock to supply to her village to reduce fires.

loans.name: Jiguisseme A Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe JIGUISSEME A sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  32 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KADIANA, une des sous-préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur onzième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est: le riz et l’arachide avec KONZA la 1ère personne à droite sur la photo position debout. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter: 1 hectare. La production est vendue à KADIANA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 60 000F cfa qui la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants, de semences et frais de labours pour la campagne agricole.

loans.name: Abdurahmon

texts.ru: Абдурахмону 45 лет. Он житель района Н. Хусрав. Абдурахмон отец четверых детей. Детям 18, 15, 14 и 9 лет. Абдурахмон заботливый и честный отец. Его жена занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Им помогает его дети. Абдурахмон имеет большой земельный участок. Он занимается растениеводством. Абдурахмон 10  лет трудиться на земле. Он хочет купить минеральные удобрения и обработать урожай ими. Для купли минеральных удобрений ему требуется сумма денег, по этой причине Абдурахмон обратился за кредитом.

loans.use: Для купли минеральных удобрений.

loans.name: Brice

texts.en:
Brice D. is married, the father of three, and is the guardian for two of his brothers. He is a mechanic by training and has demonstrated a good mastery of his trade. The quality of his work is what has won him a good reputation in his neighborhood and beyond. Very energetic and a go-getter, he has noticed that there is not one single shop selling spare parts in his area while the need for them exists. He would like to seize the opportunity to establish one next-door to his shop. This would provide him with extra income and allow him to better ensure the education of his children and apprenticeships for his brothers.

This is why he is requesting a loan of $850 which will serve to buy tools and to build an inventory of spare parts. The loan will allow him to increase his income in support of his family’s welfare.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur D. Brice est marié et père de trois (03) enfants et a à sa charge deux (02) de ses frères. Il est mécanicien de formation et fait preuve d’une bonne maîtrise de son métier. La qualité de ses prestations lui confère une bonne réputation dans son quartier et ses environs. Très dynamique et pleine d’initiatives, il s’aperçoit qu’il n’y a pas une boutique de vente de pièces détachée dans son quartier alors que les besoins et existent. Il veut saisir cette opportunité pour mettre à côté de son atelier, une petite boutique de vente des pièces détachées qui peut lui procurer des revenus complémentaires lui permettant de mieux assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants et l’apprentissage de ses frères.

C’est ainsi qu’il sollicite un crédit de $850 qui va lui servir de d’acheter de petit outillage et de s’approvisionner en pièces détachées. Ce crédit lui permettra d’accroître ses revenus pour le bien-être de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy tools and sell spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Esther intends to expand her fruit/vegetable business and to fund the family furniture business.

loans.name: Gulyar

texts.en:
Gulyar, 35 years old, is a widow and has 4 children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of  Azerbaijan, Lachin  region. She and her 4 children are settled in Absheron region, Masazir village.
She owns a grocery store which she opened 3 years ago.  Now she needs a loan of US$1000 to buy a refrigerator .

loans.use: Purchase of a refrigerator

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a widower with three children to look after. He says being a widower is more difficult than being a bachelor. The death of his supportive wife left him saddened. He has had to start doing some of those things his wife did that  he had taken for granted. Challenged by these realities he has doubled his effort towards meeting the needs of his children. This made him  join GHAPE in early part of 2006. With his first loan he bought palm nuts for processing as he already had an oil mill. The demand for palm oil is very high now and people come from neighboring communities to buy oil from him. Relying on one oil mill is not enough as it sometimes get bad and may take some time to be repaired.

Given a loan of $300, George plans to buy another small oil mill in order to increase his production. His community will have good palm oil for cooking and stands a chance of benefiting from his activities as he will have to employ somebody to work with the mill because he cannot work with both machines by himself. He plans to repay the loan during the loan term

loans.use: purchase of a palm oil mill.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
Doña María Antonia is a married woman, her husband works as a security guard and they have four children. She started her business to contribute to the household income. She is fond of sales so 4 years ago she started selling cosmetics of a well-known company in Mexico, and little by little she has contributed to the income and helped keep her family going. She started sales from catalogue among her friends who have recommended her and thus she has improved her sales and wishes to expand her business.

María Antonia needs a loan of $375 to buy more products to offer her clients and also she has several orders to fulfill. Her plan is to repay in 3 months. She and her family appreciate the support offered to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

María Antonia es una mujer casada y su esposo trabaja como guardia de seguridad y tienen cuatro hijos, ella empezó con su negocio para ayudar a la economía familiar. A ella le encantan las ventas y fue por ello que hace 4 años atrás decidió iniciarse en la venta de productos de belleza de una reconocida marca en México y así poco a poco ha ido colaborando en los ingresos a su hogar y poder sacar adelante a su familia. Empezó su negocio de venta por catálogos primero entre sus amistades quienes a la fecha la han ido recomendando con otras personas y han mejorado sus ventas y desea continuar con su negocio.

María Antonia esta solicitando un préstamo por US 375 para comprar mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes y por que tiene varios pedidos que surtir, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses, ella y su familia te agradecen mucho el apoyo que les brindas para continuar con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics to improve sales and fulfill orders.

loans.name: Kamran

texts.en: Kamran N. is an Internally Displaced Person from the Fuzuli region of Azerbaijan. Now he is settled with his wife and three children in Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan. Kamran is 36 years old. He sells women's clothes in the Beylagan city bazaar. He started his business ten years ago. He wants a $1200 loan to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Huy

texts.en:
Mrs. Huy A., 45, works with her husband raising pigs and earns collectively about $2 per day in revenue.

She has six children; three are currently employed A. a garment factory and three are enrolled in school.

This couple hopes to use the loan to purchase more piglets and feed in order to improve their lives in the next four to five months.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets and feed for her livestock

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria I. has been selling cosmetics during the past 17 years at La Estacion market in Nicaragua´s Leon province.

She began her business subletting her stall in the market, but she was not making enough money so she decided to speak with the market managers to obtain her own stall. This was a sound business decision which lowered her fixed costs and helped her to reach her sales targets and increase her benefits.

Mrs. Maria Teresa I. has been able to do this thanks to the business loan given to her by Ceprodel. Thanks to this loan she has incresed her product range at her market stall in León.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.<

loans.use: Cosmetics purchase

loans.name: Ugo

texts.en: Ugo A. is married with 5 children. She is 40 years old and hails from Okoko, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells drinks and cooked food. She has been in business for the past 13 years and she needs the loan amount of $875 to buy more drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more cooking items and drinks

loans.name: Kamuli Rd Village B(Ii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Mirabu N.. She is currently in the business of running a kiosk and is requesting a loan to add more stock and buy a weighing scale. Mirabu is 32 years old and is married with a husband who is a coffee trader for work. She has 3 children ranging from ages 11 to 17 and her children go to school. Each week, Mirabu makes approximately UGX 35000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to re- invest in her business. Mirabu has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Mirabu is joined in her small group by Happy Tibinwera and Jane K.. Happy Tibinwera has a business in craft sales and wants to increase her capital stock. Jane K. is currently operating a business selling matooke and wants a loan to boost business.

loans.use: To increase stock in kiosk shop

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 25 years old and is a single woman. Mariam is a clothes seller, a business she started in 2006. She works from 7am to 7pm each day and can earn a monthly profit of about $170 from her sales.

Mariam has taken out a previous successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Raky

texts.fr:
Raki B., age 48, is married and has three persons in her care, in addition to her five children. She has been a member of the village bank of Sinthiang Houlata, in Vélingara, for five years. She wants to buy peanuts, shell them, and make peanut butter from them to sell. The income derived from her business enables her to take care of schooling for her children. Raki is applying for a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months. Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Raki B., 48 ans, mariée, 03 personnes en charge en plus de ses 05 enfants est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Houlata à Vélingara depuis 5 ans. Elle veut acheter des arachides, les décortiquer , les transformer en pâte d’arachide et vendre. Les revenus tirés de son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge la scolarité de ses enfants. Raki sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy peanuts to make peanut butter

loans.name: Mairam

texts.en: A. Mairam is 48 years old, married, and has 3 children. She lives in Khujand and is engaged in the commercial services and national boot sales businesses. Mrs. A. works as a registered nurse in the local policlinic and has been selling massi, the national boots, in her free time for the past 18 years. Mrs. A. has now applied for a business development loan of US$775 to be repaid within 4 months. She will use the money to increase her business assortment and turnover. Mrs. A. thanks KIVA for its important work and the support it provides to small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Increase in business assortment and turnover

loans.name: Thol

texts.en: Mrs. Thol H. is a farmer in Trapaing Angkrorng Village in Kampong Speu Province. Her husband, Mr. Phan Rim, uses transport soil by motorbike to sell in different villages. They have three children who are too young to work or attend school. On her plantation, Mrs. Thol H. faces a small problem because she does not have enough animals to plow the rice field. Thus, Mrs. Thol H. is requesting a loan to buy a cow to help her plow her field. Mrs. Thol H. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow to help plow field

loans.name: Aminjon.

texts.ru:
Aminjon A. is a citizen of the city of Yavan. He is 32 years old, married and has four children. He is unemployed. He earns an income by raising large-horned cattle and selling milk. Two of his cows have given birth so it is important that he increases the size of his cow barn. That is why he wants to receive a loan so that he can buy building materials. By building a strong cow barn he will be able to be well prepared for the winter and not worry that the cold weather would injure the cows. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Азимов Аминджон житель города Яван. Возраст 32 года , женат и имеет четверых детей. Нигде не работает . Зарабатывает на жизнь путем разведения крупно-рогатого скота и продажи молока. Двое из коров отелились и теперь ему необходимо увеличить коровник. Поэтому он хочет получить кредит , для того , чтобы закупить стройматериалы. Построив крепкий коровник он сможет хорошо подготовится к зиме и не беспокоится о том , что холодная зима повредит животных. Погашать кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of building materials

loans.name: Maiyas

texts.en:
Mrs. Maiyas K., 42, and her husband, Mr. Ly K., 43, who live along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1988 and have five children; three sons and two daughters. One of her daughters is married and lives in the family home and the other three children study in the local school.

Mrs. Maiyas and her husband have been raising ducks for ten years. They sell duck eggs to the middleman in the village. Beside this business, the couple has been fishing since they were young. Ly fishes in the Mekong River and his wife sells the fish in the village.

Maiyas is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase feed and ducks for raising and to buy fishing nets for her husband.

loans.use: To raise ducks and purchase fishing nets for fishing.

loans.name: Veronica Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Verónica tiene 41 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Memorial Sandino, tiene dos hijos de 2 y 18 años de edad, el mayor esta estudiando, su esposo es albañil trabaja independiente y a veces por contratos. Doña Verónica trabaja en una casa particular en servicios domésticos desde hace veinte años a diferentes familias, pues anteriormente cuando comenzó era madre soltera ya que su esposo la abandono y tenía que cubrir sus necesidades con la suerte que le dieron trabajo el cual hasta hoy ha sido su sustento y ayuda para su familia, con suerte se volvió a casar y tiene una familia. Con la solicitud del préstamo es para infraestructura ya que quiere cambiar el techo de su vivienda que esta en mal estado, y con estas lluvias ha estado pasando necesidad ya que se moja.  A largo plazo es poder tener un negocio propio y así poder estar en su casa, ayudar a sus hijos con los  estudios.
texts.en:
Veronica is 41 years old and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood of Managua. She has two children ages two and 18 years old. Her oldest child is in school. Her husband is a construction worker who works independently and is also sometimes contracted. Veronica has worked as a domestic worker for over 20 years for different families. She was given the opportunity to work as a domestic worker when she was a single mother who had been abandoned by her husband. She had to pay for the necessities and this work has, until this day, allowed her to support her family. Luckily she remarried and she now has a family. This loan will be used to repair the infrastructure of her home. She wants to change the roof of her home which is in bad shape and is in need of repair because it leaks. Her long term goal is to have her own business and be able to stay at home and to help her children with their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of the roof of her home.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth O. owns a restaurant where she sells cooked foods like rice, beans, amala (a dish made from ground, dried yams), pepper soup, and drinks. She is 40 years old and married with 5 children. She is a LAPO client. She is requesting the loan amount of N52,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga owns a small cafeteria in an industrial district of Uzhgorod, Western Ukraine. She offers quality services and delicious meals to all workers of this factory zone (4 factories in the district). Olga has been in the trade for 6 years. Her perseverance, confidence, experience and consistency in work have guaranteed the growth of her business. She is constantly increasing the assortment of dishes she serves in her cafeteria, which helps her increase her income.

Olga is presently renting the facility which serves as her cafeteria. She is hoping to generate enough income and eventually to purchase these premises, which would give her more flexibility and income as a result. Olga is very focused. She is a typical high-achiever and knows how to set goals and achieve them. 

This time, she is requesting a loan of 5000 Grivnas to purchase additional grocery items to diversify her cafeteria menu. She is hoping to repay the current loan in 6 months.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items

loans.name: Tiem

texts.en:
Mrs. Tiem S. is a duck breeder who lives in Por Steang village in Kampong Cham province. Because her ducks have grown very fast, she does not have enough money to buy food to feed them; so she decided to ask for a loan to buy duck food.

Her husband, Mr. Phin Phan, is a farmer who can gather a little rice revenue, which cannot support the family well. Mrs. Tiem S. is 45 years old and the mother of five children -- one of whom is a chicken seller, while another three are attending the local school, and the youngest one is only two years old and too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy duck food for her duck breeding business.

loans.name: Neth

texts.en:
Neth N. is 46 years old and lives with her husband in the Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She earns a living buying rice for re-sale after taking off the husk. On average, she makes US$6 a day. Her husband, Ty Saruon, 49, pictured here, is a moto-taxi driver. He has been operating his business since 2004 and is able to make US$7 per day. Neth N. and her husband have six children, one of whom is employed, and two are students. 
Mrs. Neth N. presently needs a loan of US$1,000 to purchase rice in bulk for re-sale.

loans.use: Purchase of rice in bulk for sale.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Cecilia es socia del Banco Comunal “Ciudad Blanca” centro poblado D. Chijichalla, distrito D. Ilave, Provincia Del Collao, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 60 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, tiene 04 hijos y posee estudios D. primaria incompleta (tercero D. primaria). 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 06  meses, su negocio es la elaboración, compra y venta D. productos D. la zona (chuño negro, tunta cebada, quinua, etc.); su primer préstamo fue D. S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir mercadería D. la zona para poder venderlo en las ferias D. Arequipa y Puno. 
Con este préstamo D. S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 3 cuotas mensuales; podrá adquirir y mantener su mercadería (mas chuño, papa, cebada, etc.), su anhelo es convertirse en mayorista D. los productos que venD.; asimismo quiere dedicarse al engorD. D. ganado mayor (toros) y sostenerse así misma.
texts.en:
Cecilia is an associate of the "Cuidad Blanca" communal bank in the central village of Chijichalla, Ilave district, province of Del Collao, department of Puno. She is 60 years old, is married, has four children and has completed a part of her primary education (up to graD. three). She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for six months. Her business is the production, purchase and sale of local products (dehydrated black potatoes, dehydrated potatoes, barley, quinoa, etc.). Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles, with which she was able to purchase local goods to sell at the markets in Arequipa and Puno.

With this loan of 500 nuevos soles, an amount which she undertakes to pay off in three monthly instalments, she will be able to purchase and maintain her merchandise (more dehydrated potatoes, potatoes, barley, etc.). Her desire is to become a wholesaler of the products she sells; likewise she would like to fatten up larger livestock (bulls) and to support herself on her own.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase and maintain her merchandise (more dehydrated potatoes, potatoes, barley, etc.).  Her desire is to become a wholesaler of the products she sells; likewise she would like to fatten up larger livestock (bulls) and to support herself on her own.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 26 year old Bahati M. from Mwanza.  She is married with two children, between the ages of 1 and 4 years old. Bahati has been running a shop since 2006.
She works at the business for 13 hours per day, 6 days per week. Bahati currently earns about 120USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to purchase cooking oil, sugar and kerosene.
In the future, she plans to expand her business. 
Bahati thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, sugar and kerosene

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
La socia FORTUNATA; nació en el pleno corazón del valle sagrado de los inkas,  vive en el barrio de nombre callejón chico en Urubamba a 10 minutos de la provincia.

Nuestra socia tiene 56 años de edad, ella tiene 4 hijos de (33, 30, 24, 23) años, ella es madre soltera, y alterna sus actividades del hogar con la compra y venta de chicha de jora, ella compra maíz y jora para la elaboración de la chica a base de estos productos y los macera y procesa para su venta, ella vende en su casa, para lo cual requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz y jora, así mismo ella criará algunos cuyes para hacerlos reproducir y posteriormente venderlos.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo que le permitirá mejorar sus ganancias, y se compromete al pago total del préstamo en el plazo programado.
texts.en:
Fortunata was born in the middle of the sacred valley of the Incas. She lives in a neighborhood called “Callejón chico” or “Little alley” in Urumbamba, Peru, about 10 minutes from the provincial capital. Fortunata is 56 years old and has four children (33, 30, 24, and 23 years old respectively). She is a single mother, and she alternates her activities between home and the purchase and sale of chicha de jora (a corn-based traditional Incan alcoholic drink). She purchases corn and jora in order to make the chicha from those products and she soaks and processes them for their sale. She sells them from home. She needs the loan in order to invest in the purchase of corn and jora, and she will also raise some guinea pigs in order to make them reproduce and later resell them. Fortunata is thankful for and values this loan which will permit her to improve her income. She promises to repay the full loan in the time period allotted.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase and sell corn in order to make chicha de jora (a corn based drink)

loans.name: Saidakram

texts.en:
R. Saidakram is dedicated to agriculture and the sale of home-grown vegetables, which means that he can be around his family, helping to raise their quality of life and educate all his three children. Saidakram has been characterized as a person who is hard-working, since he has been working in agriculture since he was very young. This kind of work requires effort, dedication and above all, strength, as it can include heavy work, meaning that people get tired quickly. In spite of this, Saidakram is determined to raise the standard of living in his family, and to improve the quality of the seeds he cultivates. For this reason, he is asking for help in order to be able to receive more credit from IMON International.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Horacio Israel

texts.es: Horacio Israel  A. sus planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos y darle un mejor bienestar. El construyo una barda en la parte trasera de su casa el cual la quiere utilizara para levantarla mas y así hacer un cuarto para extenderse y estar mas amplios tanto como el como su familia. El necesita material para la losa y pagar mano de obra. Su casa es de interés social por lo que es muy pequeña el quiere hacerla mas grande poco a poco pero primero una cosa y luego otra.
texts.en:
Horacio Israel A.’s plans for his family are to better the conditions of life for his children and to give them a better situation. He built a wall in the rear part of his home which he wants to use to raise it more, and so to make a room to extend the house, and to be larger like his family. He needs materials for the flagstones and to pay labourers. His house is public housing and so it is very small and he wants to make it bigger, little by little, but first one thing and later the other.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build

loans.name: Milcerio

texts.es: Milcerio tiene 46 años, es un hombre muy sensible y responsable, vive felizmente con su esposa que es la madre de sus 5 hijos, de los cuales viven con tres de ellos que lo apoyan en los trabajos agrícolas. La siembra y cosecha de papa es la actividad a la que se dedica diariamente desde hace 30 años, pero antes de acudir a su chacra alimenta a los animales que tiene como su burro y sus mulas, los cuales le son muy útiles para transportar los sacos durante la cosecha. Por ello que a  las 8.00am sus animales ya deben estar bien alimentados para que no sientan cansancio ni hambre durante la jornada de ida y vuelta a su almacén. Después de haber acumulado las papas, comienza la selección con la ayuda de su esposa, y finalmente los transporta al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Milcerio ama la labor que realiza, puesto que sabe que gracias a ella obtendrá el dinero para sostener a su familia. En los 30 años que lleva en esta actividad ha disfrutado de la abundancia de sus cosechas que le permitieron vivir temporadas de bonaza, como también de impotencia al ver que sus siembras se quedaban bajo el hielo y otras veces los gusanos malograban la totalidad de sus cultivos, pero esas circunstancias sólo han sido pasajeras, pues no han mellado en su ánimo de seguir luchando para mantener a su familia. Este es el cuarto crédito de Milcerio con MFP, durante los anteriores ciclos demostró mucha responsabilidad en sus pagos, y para este ciclo se compromete seguir la misma dinámica, ya que los demás integrantes son muy buenos colaboradores para el progreso de su banco comunal. Los dos mil soles que solicita serán invertidos en la compra de fertilizantes químicos, para sus próximas siembras.
texts.en:
Milcerio is 46 years old, he is a very sensible and responsible man. He lives happily with his wife, the mother of his 5 children, three of whom are still with them and help him work the fields. He sows and harvests potatoes, daily work that he has been carrying out for the last 30 years. But even before he starts tending to his fields he must feed the his donkey and his mules. They help him transport the large sacks of harvest. By 8a.m. the animals must already be well fed so that they do not feel tired or become hundre during the trip to and from the silos. After having collected the potatoes he and his wife must go through a selection process, and only then will they transport them to the wholesale markets in the city of Tarma. Miclerio loves his work and it is thanks to this work that he obtains money to support his family. In the 30 years that he has been working he has enjoyed abundant harvests, giving him the opportunity to live through times of plenty. He has also seen harvests fall under a sheet of ice and other harvests that were completely spoiled by pests. But these times of hardship have been temporary and they have not impeded his will to keep struggling for the sake of his family. This is the fourth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). In the past he has shown great responsibility in his payments and for this time around he promises to be equally responsible. The others inthe group are wonderful collaborators in the progress of their community bank. The two thousand soles he is requesting will be invested in the purchase of chemical fertilizers for this next harvest.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Elisa Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Elisa Margarita L. G. tiene 54 años, vive en el Asentamiento Humano Víctor Raúl II etapa, distrito del Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella no tiene estudios, tiene 1 hija que depende económicamente de ella.
Elisa se dedica a la Crianza de aves también teje y lo vende en las ferias semanales de la sierra, este negocio se inicio hace 15 años, su negocio se desarrolla en su casa.
Su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Lideresas en Acción II, lo invirtió en la compra cuyes, patos, pollos.
El crédito de 500 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de lanas de diferentes colores y gruesor para tejer chompas, ropones.
Elisa tiene como sueño tener  granja de animales para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Elisa Margarita L. G. is 54 and lives in the el Asentamiento Humano Víctor Raúl II Etapa, in the Porvenir District, Trujillo Province, La Libertad Department, Peru. She has no education, and has one dependent daughter. She earns her living raising birds and knitting, and sells her products in the weekly fairs in La Sierra. She started her business 15 years ago, and she works from her home. Elisa used her first loan, 300 soles that she received from Lideresas en Acción II (Women Leaders in Action II) Village Bank, to buy guinea pigs, ducks, and chickens. She plans to use this loan of 500 soles to buy wools in different colors and widths to knit sweaters and christening gowns. She dreams of having an animal farm so she can grow as an entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wools in different colors and widths to knit sweaters and christening gowns.

loans.name: Equator Kyotukire Molly Group

texts.en:
K. Molly is 25 years old and married with one child and also takes care of one dependent who attends school. She has been running her retail business for a year. She is using the loan to purchase items such as sodas, sugar, salt, soap, match boxes, etc., for her retail shop. 

She is expanding on her business for more profit. She believes in growing her business, and she is a living example to others in the community. Her hope for the future is to educate her child and purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase retail items such as sodas, sugar, salt, soap, match boxes, etc., for her retail shop.

loans.name: Trần Thị

texts.en:
H. Trần Thị (1816071351) is a 44-year-old woman living in the town of Đô Lương. She is married and has three school-aged children.

H. owns and operates a business running a food stall, primarily selling pork products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month.

In 2007, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business.

H. is now requesting a new loan of 12,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 3rd from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 51-year-old father of seven. He joined GHAPE all the way back in 1998, when the organization was founded. Since that time, he has been able to take out eight separate loans to be able to develop his farm, purchase a motorbike, and also to pay for renovating his house and sending his children to school. 

In his life, Moses has been able to overcome many different obstacles, from the death of his first wife to his political imprisonment in the wake of the strikes that occurred in Cameroon in 2008.In spite of this all however, Moses has been able to develop his businesses and provide his children with more opportunity than he was ever afforded.

With his next loan, Moses hopes to be able to purchase a motorbike, fund the necessary documentation, and also be able to sponsor a driver in the short term, with these arrangements being made.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of motorbike, licensing, documentation

loans.name: Winfred Mwende

texts.en:
Winfred Mutene is twenty-five years old and single. She has been operating a cosmetics shop for the last three years.

She was introduced to KADET through a marketing awareness exercise that took place in one of the churches in Nairobi. This will be her first loan and she does not have a credit history with any other Microfinance institution. Winfred believes she is hardworking and focused, and with the extra profit she plans to supply cosmetics wholesale. Winfred's future plans are to own a supermarket of beauty products. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To increase stock of hair pieces and imported cosmetics.

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.es:
Jacqueline vive en casa D. los suegros con su esposo e hijos en la calle Rosendo Gutiérrez D. la zona D. Sopocachi D. La ciudad D. La Paz el esposo trabaja con su auto como transporte publico. La actividad que ella tiene es la elaboración D. queques, tortas, empanadas, etc. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y comprar en cantidad los ingredientes D. esta manera tener mayores ingresos.

Es cliente D. Impro y paga muy bien pueD. acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Jacqueline lives with her husband in sons in her in-laws' house on Rosendo Gutiérrez street in the Sopocachi zone of La Paz. Her husband works driving their car. She works as a baker, making sweet breads, cakes, empanadas, etc. She is asking for a loan to increase her capital and to buy her ingredients in bulk so she can make more money. She is a member of Impro, and since she repays very well she can ask for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ingredients

loans.name: Yirtankaka

texts.fr: Cette femme est divorcée de son époux et a à sa seule charge son enfant, pour subvenir à ses propres besoins et à celle de son enfant elle a entamé en 2005, le commerce de sacs de charbons de bois. Elle veut augmenter son stock pour vendre plus et assurer les charges de la rentrée scolaire de son enfant, elle sollicite donc un crédit pour acheter 200 sacs de charbons de bois.

loans.use: Achat de sacs de charbon de bois

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en: After being so upset with her two eldest children who did not pursue their education until college, Emerita G. who is a mother of three children whose age range is from 17 to 29 learned to accept her failure in life. She can not blame her children for such default because their life being poor has m made that circumstance to happen. Instead of getting herself stuck in bitterness, she decided to have her own business which is bamboo buy and sell to be able to augment the income of her husband being a laborer. Profits she will be getting through her business will be used to sustain the education of her youngest child who will be going to college until she graduates. Emerita also wants her business to grown further so that she can be of help to her grandson who lives with her and to her two unemployed children. She wished that she can still make their lives better through her business and with the loans she can request in the next cycles (increasing amount of loan after the other).

loans.use: Will be used to pey for purchasing bamboo (used for manufacturing house furniture, and material for housing) for selling.

loans.name: Tun

texts.en:
Tun S. is a 54-year-old retired soldier who lives in Phnom Penh with his wife and two of his children. He typically receives approximately US$1 on account of his military service. His wife, Kong Phalla (pictured), is 44 years old, and she runs a grocery store in the local market. By doing so, she normally earns approximately US$4 of profit per day. Tun and Kong also receive financial support from one of their children, who is a construction worker.

Tun is now requesting a loan in the amount of US$1,000 so that his wife can expand her grocery store.

loans.use: To expand his wife's grocery store by purchasing additional inventory

loans.name: Katy Karina

texts.es: Katy Karina es una mujer emprendedora, vive en el distrito de Yarinacocha región de Ucayali, tiene 29 años, es madre de tres hijos menores de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de pescado, actividad que lo realiza junto con su esposo. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Nuevo Edén” desde hace ocho meses, el primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 300 soles, que le permitió invertir en la compra de pescado fresco y seco para vender, ahora Katy necesita un crédito de 1500 soles que será utilizado para comprar redes para pesca. La meta de Katy es construir su casa y tener un galpón para dedicarse a la crianza y venta de pollos.
texts.en:
Katy Karina is a hard-working woman. She lives in the Yarinacocha district, which is in the Ucayali region, is 29 years old, and mother of 3 minor children. Her business is selling fish, which she does along with her husband. She has been a member of the Community Bank “Nuevo Edén” for 8 months. The first loan she received was for 300 soles, which enabled her to invest in the purchase of fresh and dried fish to sell. Now Katy needs a loan of 1500 soles, which she will use to purchase fishing nets. Katy’s goal is to build a house and to have a coop so she can raise and sell chickens.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fishing nets

loans.name: Fili

texts.en:
Fili V. is a 64-year-old woman living in the town of Faiaai. She is married and has 6 children. To make a living, Fili owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Fili has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 250 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Fili joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fili has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase harvesting equipment. Fili is now requesting a new loan of 1,500 WST which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Fili plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Ngen

texts.en: Ngen S. U., 39, is married with three children. She resides in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia with her husband and children. To make a living, she rents parts of her house, earning an income of about US $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, and he also operates his motorbike as a taxi driver when he is available from his work from the construction site. He earns an income of US $10 per day. These sources of income from S. U. and her husband help cover the family expenses especially for the children’s education in their future. S. U. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, S. U. is asking for a loan of US $1200 to repair the house they rent so that the customers are satisfied with the condition of the house.

loans.use: repair the house they rent

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa L. is from the village of Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 52 years old. Nimfa is widowed and has three adult children. To make a living, Nimfa owns & operates a business making and designing curtains in her community. Nimfa has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nimfa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nimfa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Nimfa is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Nimfa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Analine

texts.en:
Analine P., 39, is separated from her husband and lives in Prk. Pasil, Brgy Zone1, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. She earns a living by selling fish and potholders.

Analine joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001, in the hopes that she would be able to improve her family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she was able to increase her family's income by engaging in a fish vending and potholder vending business. Now, she earns an average monthly income of 12,500 PHP from her business activities.

Analine is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of 12,000 PHP was used to fund the operation of her fish vending business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now, she is borrowing for her 15th loan, the amount of 14,000 PHP, which she intends to use for her fish vending business. Analine is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Ma. Christina

texts.en:
Ma. Christina C.  is a 50-year old married woman who lives in Elona Subdivision Brgy 2, Silay City, Negros Occidental. She earns a living as a manicurist and food vending.

Her husband Joselito also works to support their family.  They have five children who are between eight and 26 years old.  Two children go to school and help their parents operate their business, as part of their daily chores.

Ma. Christina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000.  With the help of loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase her family income by engaging in food vending and by giving manicures. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 5,000.

C. is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of Php 10,000 funded her food vending business and it had a positive impact on her business and family. Now she is borrowing her 14th loan, Php 12,000, for her food vending business.  Ma. Christina C.  is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to give them a brighter future and a more comfortable life.
--------------------------------------------
About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital.

loans.name: Rounh

texts.en:
Mrs. S. is 31 years old. She is a married mother blessed with three children, all of whom are students in the local public school. Her husband, Sean, age 33, farms rice to earn a living. 

S. has built a pigpen behind her house where she raises many pigs. Because the pig-raising business is a very profitable one for S. and her family, S. has requested a loan of US $300 to buy additional feed and piglets to raise and then sell during the period when pork commands the highest price.

loans.use: To buy additional feed and piglets to raise.

loans.name: Lofranco

texts.en:
Lofranco F. is from the village of Malagana, Claveria Misamis Oriental. He is 38 years old. Lofranco is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Lofranco owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling green bananas, spices, vegetables and other daily used products in the local community. Lofranco has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lofranco joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lofranco is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Lofranco from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es: Enrique tiene 63 años, su actividad económica es la compra y venta de ropa. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que el inicio como un medio para sufragar los gastos de su hogar. El tiene 4 hijos y todos trabajan de manera independiente. Por lo que no tenía un trabajo estable y esto le ocasionaba problemas porque no podía ofrecerle a su familia el pan de cada día, motivado por una amigo que le ayudo con este negocio empieza su arduo trabajo. Es así que el financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de ropa interior, pantalones, faldas, trajes y ropa interior. Sueña con ampliar su negocio y además ofrecer sus productos de manera ambulante.
texts.en:
Enrique is a 63-year-old man who buys and sells clothing for a living. He has been in business for over 5 years. He started this business as a way of covering the household expenses. He has 4 children who are self-employed. He did not have a steady job, which caused problems because he could not provide his family with their daily bread. Motivated by a friend who helped him with the business, Enrique started his arduous work. The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase undergarments, pants, skirts and suits. He dreams of expanding his business, as well as becoming a street vendor.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Malia

texts.en:
Malia M. is 65 and married with 65 children.  She owns a business venture, selling lavalavas (bottom-half wrap-around prints worn by both men and women).  Malia has 6 years of experience in this business.  Malia needs a loan of WST $2500 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Malia joined SPBD.    This is her 4th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Malia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Sorbeh Group

texts.en:
Fatu K., on the right in the photo, is the leader of this group. She is a 48-year-old woman who lives in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone, with her husband and one child. Fatu has been selling groundnuts/peanuts for twenty years. 

She has requested a loan of SLL 800,000 from SMT, a Kiva field partner, to purchase bags of ground-nuts to add to her current stock. This is the first loan Fatu and her group members have requested from SMT/Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy groundnuts wholesale to add to her business

loans.name: Tursunova Ozodahon`s Group

texts.ru:
Озадахон, 30, замужем. Ее супруг работает прорабом.У нее  4 детей: дочерям 12 и 7 лет, сыну 10 и 2 года. 'Дети учатся в школе, самый младший ходит в садик.Клиентка занимается оптовой реализацией фруктов и овощей. Клиент на кредит планирует закупить для реализации помидоры, клубнику и огурцы. 

Потмахон, 51, вдова. У нее 5 детей: сыну 29 лет, дочери 21 лет, невестке 28 и внукам 2 года и 1 год. Сын занимается частным извозом пассажиров, дочь и невестка член крестьянского хозяйства. Клиент посеяла хлопок, а также присматривает за живностью. На кредит она закупит удобрения для хлопчатника.

Мадинахон, 19, замужем. Она  проживает вместе супругом и его родителями. Они с семьей посеяли хлопчатник, дом расположен на природе, часто сдают в аренду помещение отдыхающим. Кредит необходим для закупа минеральных удобрений.

Муминахон, 48, замужем. Ее супруг работает частным строителем. Ее старший сын частный строитель, а младший находится на заработках в РФ. Они также занимаются полеводством. Кредит запрашивается для закупа минеральных удобрений для хлопчатника.
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Ozadahon is 30 years old, she is married. Her husband works as a foreman. She has four children: the daughters are twelve and seven and sons are ten and two years old. Her children go to school and the youngest one goes to kindergarten. She sells fruits and vegetables in wholesale. She plans to use the loan to buy tomatoes, strawberries and cucumbers for resale. Potmahon is 51 years old, she is a widow. She has five children: her son is 29, her daughter is 21 years old, her daughter-in-law is 28 and her grandchildren are two and one years old. Her son has a private taxi business and her daughter and daughter-in-law are members of the farmer's union. Potmahon sowed cotton and is also taking care of livestock. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer for the cotton. Madinahon is 19, she is married. She lives with her husband and his parents. Their family has sown cotton, also their house is located in the nature and they often rent it out to vacationers. They need the loan to buy a mineral fertilizer. Muminahon is 48 years old, she is married. Her husband works in construction. Her oldest son is also a construction worker and her youngest one is now working in the Russian Federation. They are also in agriculture. They are asking for a loan to buy mineral fertilizer for cotton.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, strawberries, cucumbers

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Reyna es una mujer trabajadora de 45 años de edad,  casada su esposo es comerciante. Ella tiene una pulpería con varios años de administrarla, comenzó trabajando en una sastrería en donde tomo experiencia, luego comenzó con la venta de tortillas, y con ayuda de su esposo y ahorros puso la pulpería en donde vende varios productos, pero no lo suficiente es por eso la necesidad de aumentar su inventario para poder crecer, tener mejores ganancias, y así poder ir mejorando su casa, ya que donde tiene la pequeña venta es parte de la sala. Y desea ahorrar para poder hacer un local para la pulpería y así lograr tener un espacio para su familia. 
Con este financiamiento aumentara la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, gaseosas, lácteos, productos enlatados entre otros para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Doña Reyna is a hard-working forty-five-year-old woman who is married. Her husband is a shop keeper. She has had a pulpería (a small store in her home) for several years. She started out working in a tailor's shop where she gained experience. After that, she started selling tortillas. Then, with her husband’s help, and savings, she started the pulpería. She sells some things, but not enough, which is why she needs to increase her inventory. Increasing her inventory will help her grow and earn more and in this way make some improvements to her home since she has her small store in a corner of the living room. She would like to save so she can build a stand-alone store making more room for her family. With this loan she will buy more basic grains, sweets, sodas, dairy products, canned foods and other things to increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more basic grains, sweets, sodas, dairy products, canned foods and other things to increase her earnings.

loans.name: Gertrudis Alexandra

texts.es:
Doña Gertrudis tiene la edad de 46 años, madre de dos hijos, su negocio es la venta de ropa, cosméticos, perfumes, zapatos, negocio que desde hace varios años inicio, con ahorros productos de su esposo el cual trabaja como técnico de operaciones.
Últimamente las ventas han bajado, hay días regulares como días buenos, es por eso trata de comprar productos accesibles y bonitos de precios para lograr equilibrar las ventas. Con los financiamientos ha mejorado la infraestructura de su casa, como la inversión de su negocio.
 
Con el crédito anterior logro remodelar un cuarto, ahora comprara hojas de zinc para cambiar parte del techo de su casa, que por ser ya de varios años tiene muchos agujeros el cual desea poder cambiar para que no se le pase el agua ya que es una situación muy incomoda. 
Sus planes es seguir invirtiendo en su pequeño negocio para lograr apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios y en la economía de su hogar ya que la situación esta muy difícil hoy en día.
texts.en:
Gertrudis is 46 years old and a mother of 2.
