Her business is in the sale of clothing, cosmetics, perfumes, and shoes, a business that she has had for a number of years, beginning with the savings from her husband who works as an operations technician. Lately her sales have been down. There are average days just like there are good days; because of this she tries to buy things that are pretty and accessible in price in order to balance her sales. With loans she has improved the infrastructure of her home as well as invested in her business. Through a previous loan, she remodeled a room; now she will buy zinc sheets in order to change part of her home's roof that for years now has had various holes. She wants to be able to change it so that water no longer leaks through since that makes for an uncomfortable situation. Her plans are to keep investing in her small business so she can support her children in their studies and in the economic management of her some since that situation is very difficult these days.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of zinc sheets and other materials in order to make changes in her roof that now leaks water and causes discomfort

loans.name: Everliene

texts.en:
Everliene M. is from the village of  San Isidro Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 48 years old. Everliene is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Everliene works in a family member's business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Everliene has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Everliene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Everliene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Everliene is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Everliene from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia O. is from the village of Waterfall, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 40 years old, separated from her spouse, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop in the local community, selling clothes, shoes and other personal needs in addition to both food and daily use products. Delia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $125 a month from these activities. 

In 2006, Delia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Delia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 14th loan from HSPFI. She chose to lower her loan request from 20,000 PHP to 5,000 PHP because she finds it easier to pay back. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra es socia del Banco Comunal Milagros.
Sandra es soltera y vive con sus padres, Sandra es la mayor de los hermanos y estudia Biología en la Universidad. Sandra junto a su mama realiza manualidades del material corospum, productos que vende en el mercado y en ocasiones en colegios dependiendo de los pedidos que tenga. Sandra tiene proyectado iniciar con la venta de zapatos a pedido para lo cual solicita un préstamo de 2000 soles.
Sandra sueña con tener un laboratorio y ayudar a sus hermanas menores.
texts.en:
Sandra is a member of the Community Bank Milagros. Sandra is a single woman and she lives with her parents. Sandra is the eldes of the kids and she is studying biology at the university. Sandra, together with her mom, makes crafts out of foam material. She sells her crafts in the market and at times she goes to the schools depending on the orders she receives. Sandra's idea is to sell shoes, which is why she is requesting a loan of 2000 soles. Sandra dreams of having a laboratory one day, and she wants to support her younger sisters.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shoes.

loans.name: Bejing Group

texts.en:
Regina E., age 28, is married with two children, who are 7 and 11 years old. She has had a business of selling fruits and vegetables for two and a half years. She works from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. and she is able to earn a monthly profit of about $197.

This will be Regina’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy more fruits and vegetables and she has successfully paid back the loan. 

She hopes for a new loan to expand her business by adding more stock of fruits and vegetables. Regina’s future dreams include opening another fruit and vegetable place.

Regina will share this loan with her loan group, Bejing, which totals 19 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. 

In the picture,  Regina is standing in the center, wearing a red and white dress.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Micheal is 29 years old with three children aged 2, 5, and 7 years old. He looks after his family and lives with other four dependents. He owns his home and his family goal is to educate his children. He lives in Masindi, Uganda. 

He is into the motorcycle transport business and has been doing it for three years. He started by working for someone and then later bought his own motorcycle. He faces challenges of accidents and bad roads. He hopes in future that his business will grow into a big transport business. He wants the loan as a top-up to buy a car for his transport business.

loans.use: Buying a car for his transport business.

loans.name: Bashiran's Group

texts.en:
Bashiran is a resident of Borewala, Pakistan, which is famous for its shrines. She owns a small house with two rooms in the area 303 EB and lives in it with her family.  

Her husband's name is M. H., and he runs a grocery shop in the nearby market. His shop is a popular one in the area due to his excellent products and quality services. 

Bashiran is a seamstress. She sews clothes for her neighbors/clients. She has been running this business for the last seven years and is very popular among her clients due to the quality of her work and the timely delivery of her finished goods. Both Bashiran and M. H. use their incomes for household expenses. They are also able to save money for rainy days.  

Bashiran has applied for a loan for her husband’s business. With the loan amount he will buy groceries such as cooking oil, spices, lentils, and candies for his grocery shop. 

Bashiran is hopeful that this investment will be a good one for her husband’s business and that he will be able to increase his income.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “Banco del Desarrollo”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Miguel Angel; el tiene 33 años de edad y es soltero; el socio tiene un consultorio particular de la especialidad de Obstetricia, también se dedica al negocio de venta de calzados que trae de lugares como Trujillo, el socio quiere mejorar su negocio de venta de calzados. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar calzados al por mayor para mujer y varón.


El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Señor Miguel Angel is 33 years old, single and is a member of the communal bank "Banco del Desarrollo" (Development Bank).  The bank is located in the Wanchaq district in the province and department of Cusco.  

Señor Miguel Angel has a private practice specializing in Obstetrics.  He also sells footwear that he brings to places like Trujillo.  He would like to improve his footwear business.  He is requesting a loan to buy men's and women's footwear wholesale.  

He is grateful to everyone who will help make this dream come true and is committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase men's and women's footwear wholesale

loans.name: Ana Jane

texts.en:
Ana Jane M. is 26 years old and married. She is from the town of Plaridel within Claveria municipality, a part of Misamis Oriental province on the Mindanao islands. Ana Jane is a fisherwoman who harvests and sells ocean-caught fish to the local community. Ana Jane has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2008 Ana Jane joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Ana Jane is requesting a new loan, her fourth from PMPC, of 20,000 PHP that will be used to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her fishing business

loans.name: Pekeshe

texts.en:
Pekeshe M. is a married woman with one boy aged three years old who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is medical bills for her child.

Pekeshe operates an open-air business cooking chapati (flat bread) to sell from her home. Her major customers are neighbors and passersby. Previously she was making dumplings to sell. Pekeshe cites seasonality as a major challenge.

With a 20,000 KES loan Pekeshe wants to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil and 5 kilograms of beans. She decided to join Yehu because it provides sustainable financial services to low-income earners. She hopes to attend a beauty college and get the skills to open a salon in the future.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, cooking oil and 5 kilograms of beans

loans.name: Sara Martha

texts.es:
Sara Martha Q. M. tiene 18 años. Es casado vive el esposo y con el hijo, vive  en el cantón de Guaranda en la Provincia de Bolívar.  Tiene 1 hijos.

Sara pertenece a la Ventanilla  Guantucoto ubicada a media hora de Guaranda perteneciente, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería especialmente a la siembra de maíz y papas en la zona de la sierra y en la zona de la costa al arroz, esta ventanilla tiene 25 miembros.

Sara  se dedica a la agricultura por varios años,  siembra maíz y papa, además tiene animales de cría y ganado para luego vender,  las comprar las realiza en Guaranda y vende en el mercado mayorista de la  misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, papa. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Enfrentan desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar vehiculo y comprar casa.
Le gusta hacer deporte con los hijos.
texts.en:
Sara Martha Q. M. is 18 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and son in the Guaranda subdivision of the Bolivar province. She has one son. 

Sara belongs to the solidarity group Guantucoto which is located half an hour from Guaranda. The group is dedicated to agriculture and livestock especially corn and potatoes in the highlands area and in rice in the coastal area. The group has 25 members. 

Sara has been farming for several years. She grows corn and potatoes and also raises livestock and cattle to sell. She buys at Guaranda and then sells at the wholesale market in the same city. 

She is requesting this loan to purchase supplies to plant corn and potatoes. The support from this loan will help her financially to provide for her family's needs.  She faces challenges such as pests and crop diseases. Her dream is to buy a car and a home. She enjoys playing sports with her children.

loans.use: Purchase supplies to plant corn and potatoes.

loans.name: Judith Odelit

texts.es:
Judith es una madre de familia de 52 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Cayalti, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.   

Se dedica desde hace cinco años a la venta de productos de belleza y cosméticos por catálogo, ella cuenta con un grupo de clientes que le compran sus productos con frecuencia, mientras más pedidos le realizan obtiene mas puntos de parte de la empresa que le provee los productos y por consiguiente obtiene mayores ganancias. Por este motivo siempre se esfuerza por obtener cada vez mas clientes.

Judith desea contar con un capital estable para adquirir mas productos y contar con un stock fijo de cosméticos que permita a sus clientes adquirir los productos que necesitan rápidamente y no esperar hasta fin de mes, que es cuando le entregan los pedidos. Por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a conseguir su meta.

Judith es una mujer trabajadora y que gusta mucho de mantenerse activa, en la zona donde vive es bastante conocida y estimada por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Judith is a 52 year old mother who lives with her family in Cayalti district, a farming area with a lot of commercial activity, which is located one hour from the city of Chiclayo.

Judith has been selling beauty products and cosmetics through a catalog for five years.  She has a group of customers who frequently buy her products.  The more orders her customers make, the more points she gains from the company which provides the products and, therefore, the more profit she makes.  For this reason, Judith is always working hard to attract more customers.

Judith would like to have stable working capital so that she can acquire more products and have a fixed stock of cosmetics which will allow her customers to acquire the products they need quickly instead of having to wait until the end of the month which is when her orders are delivered.  For this reason she has requested a loan for 1,500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help her achieve her goal.

Judith is a hard-working woman who really likes to keep herself active.  She is quite well known in her district and is well liked by her neighbors.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to expand her sales business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase compost and fertilizer

loans.name: Munafa Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Munafa” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Fatmata K.. Fatmata is thirty-five years old.  She was born in Kabala town where she currently resides with her husband and five children. Her husband is a farmer and three of her children are attending primary school. 

Fatmata has been selling market food for the past three years.  With her share of this loan, she will buy garden eggs, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), onions, tomatoes, salts, etc. in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy food to resell

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
La señora Leticia T. Martínez vive en la localidad de Moyotepec, municipio de CD. Ayala en el estado de Morelos, México. Actualmente tiene 35 años concluyó la educación básica termino la secundaria tiene su certificado. Ella tiene su negocio de renta de manteles, mesas y sillas. El préstamo lo va a utilizar para comprar más manteles para incrementar su negocio. Se enteró de KIVA y Fundación Realidad a través de una amiga que la invitó a participar en un grupo que había en su localidad. Su negocio se llama “casa Vargas”, ella y  su esposo tienen este negocio desde hace ocho años. Ellos regresaron hace ocho años de trabajar en Estados Unidos y no sabían en que invertir el dinero que traían. Entonces un amigo les platico que era buena idea invertir en mesas y sillas para rentar y adquirieron el material para poner su negocio. Antes de este negocio había vendido ropa pero ese negocio no le convenció. Su negocio esta en su casa y atiende a sus clientes su esposo lleva las sillas, las mesas y manteles en su camioneta. Considera su negocio muy importante porque de ahí obtienen los ingresos para los gastos grandes de su casa y también para los gastos del diario. Los mayores desafíos que enfrentan es el de surtir contratos grandes, porque es mucho trabajo. Su negocio le enorgullece que entre más tiempo pasa lo van recomendando más y viene gente incluso de otros pueblos a rentarles. Un momento muy especial para ella fue cuando compraron las primeras mesas y sillas para rentar las utilizaron para la fiesta de los tres años de su hijo. Nos menciona que su negocio es popular porque aunque vengan de lejos ellos les dan servicio al precio. Algunos de los problemas que enfrenta es que a veces se le pierde al cliente y se los tienen que cobrar; no tienen competencia en su localidad y eso les facilita el trabajo. Piensa que a futuro va comprar más material para su negocio, mesas redondas fundas para silla y se vean más presentables, ella espera que con las ganancias extras del préstamo lo pueda lograr.
La señora Leticia es casada, su esposo trabaja dando clases de inglés de manera particular. Tiene dos hijos, Sergio de 9 años estudia la primaria y Cynthia de 3 años. Su esposo le ayuda entregando las mesas y recogiéndolas  considera que su negocio es muy importante porque aunque invirtieron mucho al principio ahora el negocio les da buena ganancia. En cuanto a su domicilio nos comenta que quiere hacer un segundo piso y más recamaras para sus hijos. Sus esperanzas son que a través de su negocio y esfuerzo puedan sacar adelante la educación de sus hijos. Comenta que cuando recibe el préstamo se siente muy contenta y comprometida  a la vez porque sabe que tiene que invertir para su negocio y dar mejor servicio al cliente y pagar su préstamo. La señora Leticia quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “que está muy bien que presten el dinero porque el interés es bajo y ayudan a los negocios”- Moyotepec localidad en donde vive le gusta mucho porque es muy tranquilo el paisaje se ven muchos árboles y la gente siembra maíz y caña de azúcar.
texts.en:
Leticia T. Martínez lives in the City of Moyotepec, located in the state of Morelos, Mexico.  She’s 35 years old, has completed junior high school and has her diploma.  She runs a business where she rents out tables, tablecloths, and chairs and will use the money from this loan to buy more tablecloths to grow her business.

She found out about Kiva and Fundación Realidad through a friend who invited her to participate in a local group.  Her business is called “Casa Vargas,” and she and her husband have had it for eight years.  When they returned from working in the United States eight years ago, they didn’t know how to invest the money that they had.  A friend told them that it would be a good idea to invest in tables and chairs to rent out, so they acquired the items they needed to start the business.  Before starting this business, [Leticia] had sold clothing, but that business was not in her best interest.

She runs the business out of her home, where she attends to the customers and her husband delivers the tables and tablecloths in his van.  She considers her business to be very important because it provides the money for their major expenses, as well as for their daily ones.  The biggest challenge is in servicing large contracts because it is a lot of work.

They are proud that their business is recommended more and more as time passes, and people come from all around, even from other towns, to rent from them.  A special moment for her was when they bought their first tables and chairs to rent out.  They used them for their three year old son’s birthday party.

She tells us that her business is popular because, even though people come from far away, they give good service at good prices.  One of the problems they face is that sometimes the customers lose the items and they have to charge them.  They don’t have any competition in the local area, so it makes things easier.

She believes that in the future they will buy more items for their business; round tables and seat covers, so that they will look more presentable, and feels that she will be able to do it from the extra income facilitated by this loan.

Leticia is married and her husband works as a private English teacher.  She has two children; nine year old Sergio who attends elementary school, and three year old Cynthia.  Her husband helps by delivering and picking up the tables.  She thinks that her business is important because, even though they invested a lot of money up front, it now provides them with a good income.  She tells us that she wants to add a second floor to her home, complete with more bedrooms for their kids.  Her hopes are that they can provide an education for their children through their business and effort.

She tells us that when she gets the loan she feels very happy and committed because she knows that she needs to invest in her business, give better service to her customers, and repay her loan.  Leticia wants to tell Kiva and Fundación Realidad, “It’s great that you loan the money because the interest is low and you help the businesses.”  She likes Moyotepec, the place where she lives, very much because the landscape is very peaceful, one can see many trees, and the people there raise corn and sugar cane.

loans.use: Tablecloths

loans.name: Kuuwa

texts.en:
Kuuwa A. is married and has four children. Kuuwa bakes bread at Abura for sale and distribution. She has been in this business for four years. Her husband is a surveyor. Kuuwa uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of the home.

 Kuuwa will use the loan to purchase more ingredients to bake bread for distribution. She anticipates reinvesting the new profits.

loans.use: purchase more ingredients to bake bread for distribution

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es:
El señor José A. tiene 14 años de laborar en una empresa ubicada en el Municipio de Masaya, del departamento de Masaya. Es importante destacar que él es el encargado de llevar el sustento a su hogar y beneficiar a sus dos pequeños hijos.

En estos momentos el señor se acerca a CEPRODEL ya que quiere solicitar un crédito para realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda por la razón de que le es de mucha necesidad y además quiere brindar un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
A. G. has been working as a well operator for the company ENACAL, in the town of Masaya, in Masaya department, for 14 years.  He is married and has two dependent children.

This gentleman approached CEPRODEL to request a loan so that he can make some improvements to his home as he would like to provide his family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: To improve his home

loans.name: Rout's Group

texts.en:
Rout has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s agriculture business. Her husband started this business 10 years ago and it has proved to be a profitable one for him. He works in the field and grows different seasonal crops. With the loan, he will purchase fertilizers and seeds, etc., to get maximum output from his business. 

Rout lives in Khanewal, which is a small city of Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has lived there in a 2-room brick house with her family, in the area of Shanty Nagar, for the past 15 years. She is a mother of 4 sons. Her eldest son is a rickshaw driver and provides transport services to his passengers. The remaining children are young and are at home.  Rout is also a very good mother and housewife. She is raising her children with great care and discipline. She couldn’t provide them an education due to financial constraints. She prays to GOD that they will get some source of income in the future. She is a regular loan user of Asasah, and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.  

Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rout”.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer & seeds for agriculture business

loans.name: Nora Del Socorro

texts.es:
Nora del Socorro O. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 50 años quien se dedica a la realización de fresco, sopa y verduras desde hace 4 años. Ella invertirá el crédito en verduras y frutas para su negocio.
O. tiene tres hijos de 32, 28 y 25 años quienes le ayudan.
texts.en: Nora del Socorro O. is a hard-working and enterprising 50 year old woman who has worked selling juices, soup, and vegetables for four years.  She will use the loan to buy fruit and vegetables for her business.  She has three children, ages 32, 28, and 25, who help her.

loans.use: Fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa T. is a palm oil extractor and a chop bar operator (a food joint where people come to eat) at Abura in Cape Coast. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. Adwoa has been in the food business for 5 years. She supports her husband in the provision of the household expenses. A loan is going to help her expand her cooking business. She hopes to put up a better structure with her new profits.

loans.use: to expand a cooking business

loans.name: Las Misioneras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS MISIONERAS” iniciará su tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada.  Está compuesta por doce integrantes y tiene como presidenta a la señora Ana.   Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos comercio, producción y servicio.

La señora Ana, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que es la primera vez que participa en Pro Mujer, se integro a la institución por la invitaron las compañeras de la asociación las misioneras.

En la actualidad la señora Ana tiene un negocio de hilandería de lana de vicuña y elabora mantas, nos cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de su cuñada hace 18 años. El crédito que sacará ahora es para  aumentar su capital (comprar mas lana), que comprará de la feria 16 de julio (zona comercial de la ciudad de El Alto), luego lo venderá a crédio.

Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, porque ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud
texts.en:
The 'Las Misioneras' (The Missionaries) community bank is just about to start its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Cascada regional office.  The group has 12 members and its president is Ana.  The ladies all have different businesses which include sales, production and services.

Ana, the president of the community bank, tells us that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer.  She joined the institution as she was invited by her fellow group members from 'Las Misioneras'.

Ana currently has a business spinning vicuna wool.  She also makes blankets.  Ana tells us that she learned this business from her sister-in-law 18 years ago.

Ana will use the loan that she is requesting to increase her capital and buy more wool.  She will buy her wool in the 16 de Julio street market (a commercial area in the city of El Alto) and then sell it on credit.

This work allows Ana to make money with which to support her family.  She lives with her partner and has three children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer she replied that she likes the health program.

loans.use: to increase her supplies for spinning vicuna wool and knitting blankets

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es:
Oscar, reside en Jiquilisco, departamento de Usulután, vive con su esposa y su hija de 3 años de edad, él se dedica a una panadería, la cual inicio hace 5 años, aprendió trabajando como panificador y luego decidió instalar su propia panadería.
El necesita realizar compras de harina, leña, manteca, azúcar y otros que forman parte de la materia prima, para esto solicita un préstamo que le ayude a realizar la inversión y contar con el material necesario para seguir trabajando y produciendo pan.
Oscar tiene como objetivo invertirle al negocio e ir aumentando la producción de la panadería, así mismo mejorar su condición económica y la de su familia.
texts.en: Oscar lives in Jiquilisco, a town in the departament of Usulután, with his wife and a 3-year old daughter.  He runs a bakery, which he has managed for the past 5 years, having trained as a baker before opening his own business.  Oscar seeks credit for basic ingredients, such as flour, firewood, lard and sugar, to continue the bakery's operations and to grow the business.  He plans to invest in the bakery and increase production, in order to benefit his family.

loans.use: To buy flour, firewood, lard and sugar.

loans.name: Hilder Manuel

texts.es:
Hilder un joven soltero de 25 años de edad que radica en Olmos, vive en una casa alquilada en la zona urbana de dicho distrito contando con algunos servicios (luz y agua).  Olmos es un distrito donde se desarrolla la actividad agricola principalmente, está ubicado a unos 40 minutos de la provincia y mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Hilder recorre los caserios de Olmos en busca de animales para comprarlos, engordarlos y posteriormente venderlos como el ganado ovino (ovejas), caprino (chanchos) y  aves de corral. Cuenta con una experiencia de 2 años en esta actividad. Cría los animales en corrales cerca a su domicilio para que sea de fácil acceso.  A los animales los alimenta con comida balanceada (granos y pastos naturales), también cría animales que son propios, la venta lo realiza en el mercado del mismo distrito.

Este préstamo es para comprar mas animales y engordarlos para su posterior venta, también una parte del préstamo será para la compra de alimentos balanceados para seguir alimentando a dichos animales y obtener mayores ganancias. Para lo cual ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para poder lograr su meta.

A pesar de ser Hilder una persona joven ha demostrado anteriormente a esta empresa lo responsable, trabajador y las ganas de seguir saliendo adelante para así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Hilder is a young, 25-year-old, single man living in a rented house in the urban zone of Olmos, an area that has some basic utilities (electricity and water).  Olmos is a district where the main activity is farming and it’s located about 40 minutes from the province and over an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

Hilder goes around the hamlets in Olmos seeking animals, like sheep, goats, pigs and barnyard fowl, to buy, fatten up and later sell.  He’s been in this line of work for 2 years.  He raises the animals in corrals near his home so that he can access them easily.  He feeds the animals with nutritionally balanced feed (grains and natural grasses).  He also raises animals to keep.  He carries out his sales at the local district market.

This loan is to buy more animals to fatten up for subsequent sale.  Part of the loan will also be used to purchase nutritionally balanced feed to continue feeding said animals and obtain higher profits.  To reach his goal, he’s asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan.

Despite Hilder’s being a young person he has demonstrated previously to this firm how responsible, hard working and dedicated to succeed and continue getting ahead to improve his quality of life he is.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Rosa Lidia

texts.es: Rosa Lidia,  D. 52 años D. edad, habita en casa propia con su compañero D. vida, dos hijos y su pequeña nieta. Como toda mujer emprendedora Rosa no quiso ser la excepción. Dentro D. su hogar ha instalado un pequeño negocio  el cual consiste en la venta D. productos personales como: lociones, variedad D. cremas, desodorantes, maquillaje, esmaltes, champo, etc. A pesar D. su avanzada edad no deja D. trabajar y soñar. Quiere surtir su negocio para ofrecer  mejor variedad D. productos a sus clientes. Para esto necesita contar con los recursos económicos necesarios que le permitan realizar su sueño, es por esta razón que solicita el préstamo a INTEGRAL para poder comprar diferentes artículos como diferente tipos y marcas D.: lociones tanto para hombre como para mujer, cremas para manos, cremas para el cabello, champo, maquillaje, esmaltes, jabón, etc. Con lo que espera obtener mayores ingresos que le permitan mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia.
texts.en: Rosa Lidia, 52 years old, lives in her own home with her partner, two children, and her small granddaughter.  Like all entrepreneurial women, Rosa refused to be the exception.  In her home, she has installed a small business which consists of the sale of personal products such as lotions, a variety of creams, deodorants, makeup, nail polish, shampoo, etc.  Despite her advanced age, she hasn't stopped working or dreaming.  She wants to stock her business in order to offer a better variety of products to her customers.  For this, she needs to rely on the necessary economic resources that will allow her to realize her dream.  That is why she is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL so she can buy different types and brands of lotions for men and women, hand creams, hair creams, shampoo, makeup, nail polish, soap, etc.  With the loan, she hopes to earn more money, which will allow her to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase lotions for men and women, hand cream, hair cream, shampoo, makeup, nail polish, soap, etc.

loans.name: Lilly

texts.en:
From the town of Litein in Rift Valley, Kenya, Lilly has been a dairy farmer for 10 years, employing one farmhand and selling her milk to Kabianga Dairies in Litein. She also earns income from her small-scale tea and poultry farming. She is a 39-year-old married mother of five children who all attend school.

Lilly has requested a loan of 50,000 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. She says that the dairy cow will be an additional asset to be used as collateral to secure loans in future. The income from the sale of milk will improve her family's livelihood. Lack of knowledge of animal diseases and insufficient land to plant grass for animal feeds have been her greatest challenges. Lilly hopes that her business will become profitable enough to enable her to buy additional quality dairy cows and more land for planting nappier grass.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Wendy Santana

texts.es:
La señora Wendy esta agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual pudo surtir su negocio y con las ganancias pudo adquirir un puesto para la venta de alimentos. 
Esta solicitando su cooperación en este préstamo ya que necesita comprar inmobiliario, que es sillas, mesas y  materia prima para iniciar a trabajar en su nuevo puesto. 
Doña Wendy pagara el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio. 
Desea que su negocio este mejor acondicionada para darles un buen servicio a su clientes y que su familia tenga una mejor vida y poder darles los estudios necesario a sus dos hijos.
texts.en: Wendy is pleased that a prior loan helped her to grow her business, allowing her to use profits to open a food stand.  She now seeks credit to buy chairs, tables and other materials to outfit her now food stall and allow her clients to enjoy her food in greater comfort.  Wendy plans to pay off her loan with profits from her new business.  She hopes to better provide for her family, allowing her two children to study.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía para el negocio

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 51 years old and married to Otiende. She has been running her embroidery and secondhand clothes business for 18 years. She earns a monthly income of about 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), which she uses to stock up for the business and take care of her family.

Mary has been loaned 50,000 KES by KADET Ltd. This is her second loan from KADET. She intends to use her loan to purchase more stock materials and secondhand clothes for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business to buy more machines and open a dressmaking school. In the future, she hopes to have a very big boutique with a variety of wears.

loans.use: to purchase embroidery and buy secondhand clothes for sale.

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora Aidee quién  invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.Actualmente el comité tiene 16 integrantes, todas ellas trabajan de forma solidaria, en un ambiente de cooperación y respeto.
La sra. Aidee esta casada hace 11 años con el señor Juan, tienen dos hijos menores que van a la primaria.  la señora Aiide se dedica a la venta de ropas de todo tipo. Ella sueñan con abrir una mercería logrando de esa manera construir para su casa y  brindar lo mejor a sus hijos en educación, salud, osio, vestimenta.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de prendas de la temporada. Sabe que con mayor variedad de ropas podrá atraer a mas clientes.
texts.en:
The person who was the group contact when this committee started was Sra. Aidee. She invited and organized her friends in order to join the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs Program. The committee has 16 members, all of whom work in a supportive manner and in a spirit of cooperation and respect.

Sra. Aidee has been married 11 years to Sr. Juan. They have two young children who attend elementary school. Sra. Aidee sells all types of clothing. She dreams of opening a variety store, which is why she has a built a house. As a result, she will be able to provide the best for her children in terms of education, health care, activities, and clothes.

Aidee is requesting a loan to buy seasonal clothing. She knows that a large variety of clothing will attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing such as coats, scarves, and other items.

loans.name: Chilo

texts.en:
Chilo is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Chilo has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Chilo is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Chilo hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima is a married woman with eight children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a coconut selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of theft because of insecurity in her area of operation. She dreams of establishing a retail shop business in the future.

With the 10,000 KES, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly de 27 años, es una mujer muy luchadora y fuerte, recién acaba de convertirse en madre y es un gran motivo para poder salir adelante y darle una buena alimentación y educación a su pequeña hija, vive en casa de su mamá junto a su pareja y sus cuñadas. El trabajo de Nelly consiste en la crianza de pollos, este trabajo lo hace en su casa y lleva ya por dos años en este trabajo, ella también es estudiante de educación de la universidad y costea sus estudios con la ganancia que le da este negocio, lo hace sola.
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le da tiempo para hacer otras actividades, además ella aprovecha en vender sus pollos cuando esta en temporada de precio alto, y si baja demasiado lo hace en parrilladas o a la plancha y vende preparado, a ella le gustaría poder sacar su titulo de educación que le corresponde como egresada y agrandar la crianza de sus pollos. Este es el tercer préstamo que hace Nelly con la institución MFP, espera que le siga yendo bien en su grupo como le fue hasta ahora y espera poder seguir con el trabajo junto a la institución. Con el monto solicitado 1200 soles, ella comprar mas pollos bebes para seguir n la crianza y poder pagar sus cuotas a tiempo.
texts.en:
Nelly, age 27, is a very tenacious and strong woman.  She has just become a mother, and that is a great motive to be able to get ahead and give her little daughter good nutrition and education.  She lives in her mother’s house with her life partner and her sisters-in-law.

Nelly’s work consists of raising chickens.  She does this work at home, and she has been doing this work for two years.  She is also studying education at the university.  She pays for her education with the income from this business, and she does this by herself.

What she likes about her work is that it gives her time to do other activities.  Also, she takes advantage of the season when prices are high by selling her chickens then.  If prices decrease too much she barbecues or grills them and sells them prepared.

She would like to be able to get her degree in education that goes with being a graduate, and she would like to expand her business of raising chickens.

This is Nelly’s third loan with the MFP institution.  She hopes that it continues to go well for her in her group like it has so far.  She hopes to be able to continue working with the institution.  She will use the 1,200 soles that she has requested to buy more baby chickens in order to continue raising them and to be able to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy more chickens.

loans.name: Gonzalo Armando

texts.es:
Gonzalo, vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y crianza de ganado, lleva muchos años trabajando en la agricultura y ha logrado mantener a su familia y apoyar a sus hijos a través de esta actividad.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de 5 sacos de abono y herbicidas, esta compra es muy importante para poder dar los cuidados que el cultivo necesita, previniéndole posibles daños por plagas.
Su objetivo es que con el apoyo del préstamo, su cultivo sea provechoso, dándole buenos frutos para el alimento familiar.
texts.en:
Gonzalo lives with his wife and four children.  He grows corn and raises cattle for a living and has been involved in agriculture for many years.  Through this activity he has been able to maintain his family and support his children.

He is requesting a loan to buy five sacks of fertilizer and herbicides.  This is an important purchase required to give the proper care to his crops in order to avoid possible harm from plagues.

His goal is to obtain a good harvest so he can provide the best for his family.

loans.use: To buy five sacks of fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Nzisa

texts.en:
Nzisa is a 28 year old single woman. For the last six years she has been manufacturing and selling yogurt in Emali town. 

She was introduced to KADET by a KADET client. This will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan amount to buy milk for manufacturing yogurt. In the future Nzisa hopes her to expand her business and supply yogurt in the whole country.

loans.use: to buy milk for manufacturing yogurt.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora, aged 60, is a resident of GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She is a widow with five children. She, together with her children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Leonora operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg.  She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this, she also offers herbal products to her customers. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 800 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 37,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Leonora hopes her business will grow more in the coming years and she dreams of being able to give her children a good future and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and she can also draw strength and inspiration there from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional materials for her abaca weaving business. Lorena has been in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income from pig fattening.

Lorena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her abaca weaving

loans.name: Kula

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Kula. She is married and has three children aged 17, 12, and 9. Living with her also is her sales assistant. In the year 2000, Kula established her foodstuff business. She began her business because she wanted to enhance her independence and to assist her husband in settling some domestic problems. 

Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 1,200,000 Leone (SLL) every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Kula requires a loan in order to buy brown bulgur, white bulgur, corn flower, and palm oil. 

She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. In the future, Kula plans to own a larger store, to erect a house and to continue with A.R.D. until she is financially strong. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, corn flower and brown bulgur for her business

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with two children one of whom is enrolled in school while the other is too young for school. Her husband who is employed also contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Mwanajuma has operated a cashew nuts selling business for the past 5 years; her potential clients are people at the market place. She faces a major challenge of seasonality; cashew nuts are harvested in seasons. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase more cashew nuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access funds to improve her living standard.

loans.use: To purchase more cashew nuts for resale.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is widowed with 9 children. 

Victor has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Victor has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Victor hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma, de 42 años de edad, quien a duras penas logro terminar el primer grado de primaria, ha sabido salir adelante como madre, ama de casa y comerciante, ella es originaria de la trinidad municipio de Estelí. Sus comienzos fueron a los 22 años de edad cuando vendía ropa de manera ambulante este fue su primer negocio posteriormente estableció su pulpería donde vender productos alimenticio y de uso para el hogar. 
Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar granos básicos, aceite, azúcar, leche, cosméticos, productos para limpieza, ropa, zapatos. Pues el crédito le ayudara  a mantener surtido de productos que mas demandan sus clientes y le ayudan a mejorar sus ventas. Una de sus metas es lograr convertir su pulpería en una miscelánea de productos varios.
texts.en:
Vilma is 42 years old and barely finished the first grade. She knows how to succeed as a mother, a homemaker, and a merchant. Vilma is originally from Trinidad in the town of Estelí. She started out when she was 22 years old by selling clothes as a street merchant. This was her first business, but she later opened a store where she sells food products and household goods.

She is requesting a loan to buy basic grains, oil, sugar, milk, cosmetics, cleaning products, clothing, and shoes. This loan will help Vilma maintain her inventory of products that are most requested by her customers, thereby improving her sales. One of her goals is to convert her shop into a variety store that carries different products.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, oil, sugar, milk, cosmetics, cleaning products, clothing, and shoes.

loans.name: Javo Welfare Group

texts.en:
Maina is the facilitator of the Javo Welfare group. Maina and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Maina takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Maina had a very good maize yield, harvesting 18 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Maina was only able to harvest 9 bags of maize on ½  acres of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Maina and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Maina will educate his children.

In 2012, the members of Javo Welfare group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Uganda.  She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her father).  Sarah  has a business selling bananas.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week.

Sarah   sells her products from home, retail.  Sarah has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas.  The main business challenges for    Sarah    include thieves and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to   see her business grow big and start selling wholesale only and also to build her own house. 

Sarah lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, paying utility bills and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Jannet

texts.es: Jannet, de 27 años, es una mujer amable, buena y muy trabajadora, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene una hija de 4 años, viven en casa de los padres de su pareja en donde también comparten sus días a lado de sus hermanos y sus padres. Ella desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida en base a mucho trabajo a sus hijos. El trabajo de Jannet consiste en la venta de bebidas heladas gaseosas y cervezas. Tiene una refrigeradora muy surtida con variedad de bebidas, es lo que siempre buscan los clientes que haya de todo para así poder escoger. Lleva realizando su trabajo por dos años y lo hace sola, cuando se indicio en esta actividad pues le iba regular ya que tenía que ganarse a sus clientes. Con el tiempo, el buen precio y el trato especial que les da se supo ganar a los clientes y ahora es muy visitada. Le gusta mucho lo que hace pues le permite tener tiempo para poder realizar todo tipo de actividades. El promedio de venta es de 14 cajas a la semana y eso significa mucha venta, por lo que espera seguir creciendo con lo que hace y así ampliar su negocio. Este será el crédito número 4 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Ella por su parte se compromete una vez mas en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual así como lo hizo en sus créditos anteriores. Esta muy feliz de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy amables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado de 1,800 soles, comprará más bebidas ya que desea implementar con más variedad, tamaño y presentación.
texts.en: Jannet is 27 years old.  She is a loving, good and very hard working woman.  She lives with her husband and they had a 4 year old daughter.  They live in the home of her husband's parents which they also share with his brothers.  She wishes to bring a better quality of life to her children through her hard work.  Jannet makes a living selling cold sodas and beer.  She has a well stocked refrigerator with a variety of beverages, that is what her customers look for: a variety to choose from.  She has been in this business for two years and she works alone.  When she started, her business went fairly well because she had to find customers.  As time went on, her good prices and special treatment that she provides have attracted many customers and now she has a lot of traffic.  She likes what she does because it allows her time to do various types of activities.  The average sale is about 14 cases per week which is a lot of revenue and she expects to keep on growing and expanding her business.  This is loan number 4 with MFP and she is very happy knowing that she will have financial support, since this way she can feel sure that her business will get ahead.  For her part, she is once again committing to prompt payments of her installments as she had done for the past loans.  She is very happy belonging to her community bank because all the members are kind and supportive.  The amount requested of 1800 soles, will allow her to buy more beverages to increase her supply with more variety, sizes and presentation.

loans.use: to purchase more cases of beer and sodas.

loans.name: Yeny Andrea

texts.es: Luchadora es la mejor palabra para describir a Yeny Andrea, una joven que a la edad de 18 años, ya tiene un hijo de 2 años, es madre soltera cabeza de familia y trabaja fuertemente para cubrir sus necesidades. Yeny Andrea trabaja por horas en un cultivo de flores cerca de su casa, y como independiente con unas vacas lecheras que tiene. La actividad de la crianza de las vacas lecheras la aprendió de su padre, quién siempre ha sido un gran apoyo para ella. Yeny Andrea sueña con poder tener su propia casa, su propio hogar y poder brindarle a su hijo todo lo que necesita.
texts.en:
Tenacious is the best word to describe Yeny Andrea.  She is an 18 year old young woman, and she has a two year old child.  She is a single mother and the head of the family.  She works very hard to cover their necessities.

Yeny Andrea works for hours cultivating flowers close to her house.  As an independent worker she has dairy cows.  She learned how to raise dairy cows from her father, who has always been a big support for her.

Yeny Andrea dreams of being able to have her own house and her own household.  She wants to be able to give her child everything that he needs.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia es socia del Banco Comunal Marcela, tiene 56 años, es feriante de ropa y mochilas, es madre de 3 hijos, es casada, agradece a Finca porque en los momentos que mas lo necesitaba recibió la ayuda con la enfermedad de su hijo, este tiempo pudo aprender a administrar su dinero y de esa forma mejorar su negocio, ahora este préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de mochilas y ropas para llevar a la selva.
texts.en: Antonia‘s a member of the “Marcela” communal bank; she’s 56 years old and sells clothes and backpacks in street markets.  She’s married and the mother of three children.  She thanks Finca because in the moments when she most needed it she got help with her son’s illness.  This time she learned how to administer her money and improve her business.  Now, she’ll use this loan to buy backpacks and clothes to take to the jungle.

loans.use: to buy backpacks and clothes.

loans.name: Joselyn

texts.en: Joselyn is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single and has one child. Joselyn has a stall that sells a variety of fruits. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy a larger variety of fruits to sell in the market. Joselyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business to support the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy a larger variety of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Khydija

texts.en: Khydija  was living a tough life some years ago; it was very difficult to bear her household expenditures. She is 45 years old, married woman running a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffaloes for milking purpose. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has 6 children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation, now, she has requested for a loan of 60000 PKR  to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Mrs. Florence Y. is a 40 year old woman who is married and has 6 children.  She lives in a semi-urban area in the Edo State in Nigeria, and she runs a small food market in her community.  Florence hopes to use her loan to buy more goods and increase her business growth.

loans.use: To buy goods for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Emily would like to increase stock of necklaces, bracelets, belts, and bags

loans.name: Murad

texts.en: Murad is an IDP from the Jabrail district of Azerbaijan. He fled to Baku in 1993. He is married and has three children. He started his business in 1999, and borrowed three Normicro loans from Baku branch  totaling $2800. Now he would like to borrow $1200 to increase the variety of goods he can offer.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 28 years old has a small mini market in Kirkuk. He has two children, both of them in school. He is applying to get $1000 to purchase more goods for the shop. He wants to develop his business and increase his income to enhance his standard of living.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase more goods

loans.name: Ignacia Loyola

texts.es:
Doña Ignacia is 47 years old, a selfless mother of 5 children and a caring grandmother of her young grandchildren. She comes from a humble, but hard working family. She has worked since she was 14 years old, packaging and selling cooking spices on foot. She learned this trade from her aunt, and it has now become an important means to generate income for the family, whose members have all contributed to its development. In order to market her products, she must visit many establishments and the day turns into never-ending hours of walking in the company of her younger children and, occasionally, her oldest grandchild.

Her second job consists of recycling plastic and paper products, in addition to selling buckets of motor oil which she cleans re-sells as water containers after they are used. These endeavors also generate important income to increase her quality of life. The hopes of Doña Ignacia are to have more capital to establish a small store in which to sell her spices. She asks for a loan of $500 to invest in and develop her current businesses in order to start her next enterprise. With your help, she will be able start her projects in a small period of time. ?

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

? Doña Ignacia tiene 47 años, es una abnegada madre de 5 hijos y abueL. cariñosa de sus pequeños nietos, proviene de una familia humilde pero laboriosa, empezó ha trabajar a L. edad de 14 años empaquetando y vendiendo condimentos para cocinar en forma ambulatoria, esta actividad L. aprendió de su tía y ahora se ha convertido en un importante generador del ingreso económico familiar, en el que todos los miembros de su hogar colaboran con el propósito de consolidarlo muy pronto. Para ofrecer sus productos tiene que recorrer muchos establecimientos y el día se convierte en interminables horas de caminata en compañía de sus hijos menores o su nieto mayor ocasionalmente. Su otra labor consiste en reciclar artículos de plástico y/o papel; adicionalmente L. venta de baldes de aceite para carros, que luego de lavarlos vende como depósitos de agua. también le genera ingresos económicos importantes para elevar su nivel de vida. El deseo de Doña Ignacia es contar con más capital para poner una pequeña tienda de venta de especerías, para esto solicita un préstamo de 500 dólares, dinero que invertirá en sus actuales negocios con el objetivo de consolidarlos para iniciar su próximo anhelo. Con tu ayuda en poco tiempo podrá poner en marcha sus proyectos.

loans.use: Increase capital to develop current business.

loans.name: Santos Victoria

texts.es:
Mrs. Santos is 52 years old, with six children, two of whom are currently dependent on her. Though she never finished primary school, she’s very optimistic about her business. She lives in the Florencia de Mora district of the Trujillo province in the Department of La Libertad. For many years, she has devoted herself to making bread, rolls, and various cakes. Although her business has had some declines, she has always picked herself back up. Now, she sells not only bread, but also basic necessities, such as rice, sugar, oil, milk and so on. Mrs. Santos joined the communal bank “God Guide Our Steps II” at the invitation of her neighbor. She received her first credit for S/300.00 ($100), which she used to purchase flour. With other credits that she received, she made more bread, and her business began to grow; before, she baked bread with just five sacks of flour - now she uses 25 sacks. With a recent loan from Manuela Ramos for S/600.00 ($200) that she will pay in four months, she will purchase groceries such as milk, sugar, rice, oil, and other tools for the bakery. It is her dearest dream to have a large bakery available to her neighborhood and to distribute throughout her district.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Santos a sus 52 años de edad, con grado de instrucción primaria incompleta y con 6 hijos (actualmente 2 dependen de ella), es una señora muy optimista en su negocio. Vive en el Distrito de Florencia de Mora, provincia de Trujillo. Departamento de La Libertad. Ella desde hace muchos años se dedicó a la elaboración de pan, roscas, bizcochos y pasteles a pesar que tuvo algunas caídas en el negocio se ha vuelto a levantar y ahora no solo vende pan sino también algunos productos de primera necesidad como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, etc. La señora Santos ingresó al Bancos Comunal “Dios Guía Nuestros Pasos II” por invitación de una vecina; obtuvo su primer crédito de S/.300.00 con los cuales compró harina. Con los otros créditos que recibió elaboró pan en mayor cantidad y el negocio fue creciendo, antes elaboraba pan solo con 5 sacos de harina y actualmente lo hace con 25 sacos. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/ 600 soles ($ 200) el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará abarrotes como: leche, azúcar, arroz, aceite, y algunos utensilio para la panadería, ya que su mayor sueño es tener una gran panadería a disposición de su barrio y también distribuir pan en todo su distrito.

loans.use: Purchase of general groceries and tools for the bakery

loans.name: Endah

texts.en: Endah is a 51-year-old woman who has a small shop and sells rice, snacks, vegetables etc., and she usually earns US$17 per week. Her husband, A., has no fixed income. Endah requests a loan to buy some goods to fill the shop. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To fill her shop

loans.name: Hosiyat

texts.ru:
Hosiyat K., 43, is married and has 4 children. Hosiyat is accountant by training. For 15 years, she has been selling traditional fabrics for Tajik national clothing. Hosiyat has a sales location at “Tidzhorat,” a large market in Yavan. Hosiyat plans to use this loan to purchase a new type of fabric for women. Hosiyat’s regular buyers will have an opportunity to buy the new fabric from her. Hosiyat plans to repay this loan within 18 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Каримова Хосият, возраст – 43 года, образование в средне-техническое, по специальности бухгалтер, замужем, имеет 4-х детей. Хосият заниамется торговлей национальными тканями для пошива национальной женской оджеды. Этим видом деятельности она занимается в течение 15 лет. Она имеет свою торговую точку на одном их крупных рынков города Явана под названием «Тиджорат». На полученный кредит она хочет приобрести новый вид женских тканей появивишихся недавно. Так как такой товар пользуется большим спросом у местного населения и Хосият имеет постоянных клиентов, данный кредит даст возможность женской половине приобретать нужные им виды тканей для пошива национальной одежды на мероприятия различного рода, такие как свадьбы, национальные обряды и просто для повседневной жизни. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 18 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of new fabric

loans.name: Ifeoma

texts.en: Ifeoma A.is married and 30years. She lives in Ajamgbadi, Lagos State, Nigeria. She makes calls, sells telephone lines, and recharge cards. She needs a loan of $875 to enable her buy more cards for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more phone lines and recharge cards to sell

loans.name: Mehrinisso

texts.ru:
Mehrinisso H. lives in Khuroson, Tajikistan. She is 34, married, and has 1 child. Mehrinisso H. has a college degree in teaching. She works as a school teacher at the local secondary school number 24. In addition, Mehrinisso H. would like to purchase a milk cow, so that she can sell milk to earn some extra money for her family. She needs this loan to finance the purchase. Mehrinisso H. plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Хасанова Мехриниссо Джураевна проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст 34 года. Замужем , имеет 1 ребенка.Образование высшее. По профессии учитель средней школы. Работает учителем в средней школе № 24 района Хуросон.Кроме того хочет приобрести дойную корову ,для тогочтобы получаемое молоко продавать и получать дополнительный доход.Это поможет улучшить финансовое положение семьи.Кроме того у населения всегда пользуется спросом молочная продукция , поэтому продавать молоковсегда выгодно. Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce operates a clothing and cosmetics shop in Kariakoo, Dar Es Salaam’s busiest trading area. She specializes in clothing for ladies and kids. She will use her loan to grow her business by investing in more inventory with a greater variety of items.

loans.use: To purchase more stock and grow her business

loans.name: Adjaratou

texts.fr:
Adjaratou C. buys cosmetics in Dakar for re-sale in Thiadiaye, a community located 35 kilometers from Mbour. The income from her business allows her to pay school fees for her children and contribute to daily expenses. She doesn't yet have a shop, so she sells house-to-house and neighborhood to neighborhood.

This is her first loan with IMCEC Mbour, and her file shows her to be a woman who honors her commitments. The income from her business will allow her to make on-time loan payments without difficulty.

Her clientele is essentially made up of women and she has got good experience in this field.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Elle achete des produits cosmetiques à Dakar pour les revendre à Thiadiaye, une commune située à 35 km de Mbour. Les revenus tirés de son activité lui permettent de payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants et contribuer à la dépense quotidienne. Elle ne dispose pas encore de Boutique. Elle est une brave ambulante qui vend de maison en maison et de quartier en quartier.

Ce crédit réprésente son premier crédit au niveau de l'IMCEC de Mbour et d'apres l'étude de son dossier, c'est une femme qui honore ses engagements et les revenus qui sont tirés de cette activité peuvent permettre d'honorer sans difficultés les échéances de ses remboursements.

Sa clientele est essentiellement constituée de femmes et elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.

loans.use:
purchase and re-sale of cosmetics

Achat et vente de produits cosmétiques

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H., joined the TYM Fund since 2001. At first, she used the borrowed money to buy general products and fertilizer and sell them to local people. Besides working on the rice field, and breeding animals, her husband also helps her in travelling to the wholesale stores. She has 1 child who is 17 years old. Her family economy improves and she has a stable income from her business. She wants to borrow 925 USD to buy more fertilizer to provide the local people for the upcoming crops. Her income is approximately 200 USD/ month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Huệ tham gia vào Quỹ Tình Thương từ năm 2001. Từ những vòng vốn đầu chị đã sử dụng để mua hàng tạp hóa và phân đạm về bán cho bà con ở địa phương. Ngoài việc làm ruộng, chăn nuôi ở nhà chồng chị cũng hỗ trợ chị trong việc đi lấy hàng từ các đại lý về cho chị bán. Hiện gia đình chị có 1 con đã 17 tuổi. Qua thời gian tham gia vào Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị đã ổn định hơn nhờ có thu nhập từ công việc buôn bán của chị. Chị mong muốn được vay mức vốn 15 triệu để đầu tư vốn mua thêm phân bón để bán cho bà con trong vụ mùa tới Thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: buy fertilizer to sell

loans.name: Nurkhon

texts.en:
Nurkhon M. is 32 years old. She is married and the loving mother of three children. 
Her husband is a businessman. Nurkhon is the head of the Health Center in the village of Hamid Aliev. Since the salary of Nurikhon and her husband was not enough for their family expenses, two years ago she started her own business. Nurkhon  raises cattle.  She buys  small cattle on the market at a low price, feeds them and then resells them on the same market at a more profitable price. Her elder son is also involved in this business. Nurkhon works hard in order to make the business successful and to generate a stable income for the family.  
Nurkhon is planning to purchase cattle for her household for raising and further selling. With this purpose she requests $500 for the term of 12 months. As this is her first loan, Nurkhon promises to manage the loan without violations and delinquency.

loans.use: Purchasing of cattle for raising and selling.

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Yun H., age 37, lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 2000, she has been growing vegetables and selling it in the market to earn a living and is able to earn around $1 each day. Her husband, Tuon Try, age 38, is a construction worker who has built houses since 1998. On average, he makes about $2 each day. This couple together has four children, one of whom works in Phnom Penh weaving bags, and provides $100 each month to support the family.

Mrs. Yun H. would like to ask for a loan from Kiva via Credit, a local partner, to purchase a stand in the market for her son who weaves bags in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase a stand in the market for her son who works weaving bags in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace A. sells fish which she buys from the fishermen for processing then makes them consumable and attractive to her costumers at Elmina. Grace has received a junior high education. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a fisherman. Grace has been selling fish since 1999. She is responsible for the feeding of the family and the payment of utility bills and the children's school fees. Her loan will be used to add to her capital to increase the stock for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to support her husband in meeting the children's education.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to add to her capital to increase stock for sale.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es: Wilma es una alegre agricultora, nos dicen sus vecinos y amigos, que la mejor de su localidad, por el empeño que le pone a su trabajo cada mañana.  También es una buena   madre, y por el bienestar de sus hijos es que realiza todas las tareas que embarga la labor de agricultora, sin descuidar el cuidado y atención de sus 5 pequeños hijos, quienes tienen sueños por realizar.  Para ayudar a sus hijos a cumplir sus metas, entiende que tiene que mejorar su economía, para ofrecerles una educación de calidad, para ello espera incrementar su producción, tener la capacidad económica de brindar lo necesario a sus seres queridos.  Para eso requiere de  un préstamo, para comprar lo necesario para su próximo sembrío y cultivo de sus productos, contando con su apoyo, Wilma podrá seguir siendo la mejor agricultora y la mejor madre.
texts.en:
Wilma is a cheerful farmer, her neighbors and friends tell us; the best in her area because of the effort that she puts into her work every morning. She is also a good mother, and it is for the well-being of her children that she does all the tasks that make up the work of a farmer, but without neglecting the care and attention of her 5 small children, who have dreams to fulfill. To help her children achieve their goals, she understands that she needs to improve her finances, to offer them a quality education. For this, she hopes to increase her production to have the economic capacity to give what is needed to her loved ones. For that, she requires a loan to buy what she needs for her next planting and growing of her products. With your support, Wilma will be able to continue being the best farmer and the best mother.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment capital to purchase all that is necessary for her next crop

loans.name: Loveth

texts.en:
Loveth A. is a tailor. She is 35 years old and married with five children. She sews clothing of various styles for people in her community.

Loveth would like to add to her sewing business by also selling second-hand clothes. She says that this additional business will enable her make more profits. She needs the loan for N70,000 to purchase more second-hand clothes to sell. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jafar

texts.en:
Jafar Y., a 29-year-old farmer with four years of experience breeding calves in Saatli, Azerbaijan, is married and has three children. An accountant by profession, he became unemployed in 2004 and so started his own business, assisted by his father, an experienced farmer. Now livestock breeding yields a stable monthly income, but more is needed to meet basic family needs and provide good living conditions for his three children.

To develop his business he needs to purchase more animals to sell, and therefore is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase three calves and fodder. Let’s do our best to help this hardworking man!
