loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Oin

texts.en: Mrs. Oin M. is a farmer in Traping Ampil village in Kampong Cham province. Mrs. Oin M. is 55 years old and the mother of a child who is employed in a garment factory.  Her husband, Mr. Chhoem Kroeun, is a construction worker who can only make a small income to support the family. Although they try to work hard, they still cannot support the family well. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Oin M. decided to ask for a loan of $500 to buy a cow to start a cattle breeding business.  Her husband appears next to her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a cattle breeding business.

loans.name: Mohammad Parwiz

texts.en:
M. Parwiz is the son of M. M.. He lives in a big family that has eight members. He is completely responsible for his family and has to pay all the expenses. He has a general store and works hard there.

He wants to take out an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for a term of 10 months to purchase additional materials to expand his business. He is confident that with the loan, he can work in a good way and earn more money.

loans.use: To expand his general store

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Martha C. quiere construir un cuarto en su casa ya que nos comenta que solo son dos cuartos (cocina y una recamara). En su vivienda vive ella, su esposo y un hijo lo cual quiere darle privacidad tanto como ella como el. 
También quiere aprovechar ese espacio que tiene de patio para tener su vivienda confortable y amplia.
Para empezar su proyecto  Martha necesita comprar material de construcción como pagar mano de obra.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marta C. would like to add a room to her house. The house has only 2 rooms, a kitchen and a bedroom, and she lives in it with her husband and son. She is hoping the addition, would give all of them some privacy. She wants to use the space, behind her house, to build the room and to make the house more spacious and comfortable. To start this project, Marta needs to buy the building materials and pay for the labor.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials and pay for labor

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 37-year-old Esther M. from Mwanza. She is married with five children between the ages of 12 and 19 years old. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because they are orphans. Esther has been running a tailoring business since 2006. Her business is to make clothes and sell them to customers. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week, and is assisted by two employees. Esther currently earns about 250USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to buy thread, a sewing machine and kangas. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Esther thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy thread, a sewing machine, and kangas

loans.name: Sarwari M. Aslam Group

texts.en:
Sarwari baji, the wife of M. A., has lived in Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan for the past 10 years. She is the mother of three children, one son and two daughters. All of her children get their education from a local school near their house.

Sarwari baji has a business sewing clothes. She sews clothes to share the financial burden with her husband. Her husband has a dairy business. He gets milk from a buffalo and sells it to the milk shops. Sarwari baji is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand her husband’s milk-selling business.

Sarwari baji is the leader of a group of three women from her locality. Gaman baji, Jamila baji, and Asia baji each want a loan to buy buffalos for their dairy businesses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: 'Baji,' which means 'older sister,' is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for a dairy business

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
T. Gulbahor is the happy mother of three children. She is 37 years old and married. Gulbahor is a teacher. Her salary is very little, which is why she has been running her own grocery business. For two years, she has been selling foodstuffs in her grocery store. Gulbahor’s wish is to increase her business by offering a variety of food items to the customers who pass through this market. She works with one aim in mind: to provide the best possible example and way of life for her beloved children who are all the apple of her eye and the reason for her daily efforts. With this opportunity, along with the immense love she feels as a mother and her desire to succeed, she is appealing to your generosity and is requesting a loan of $800 in order to increase the range of her goods. She promises to repay the loan within nine months. You can be an important link in the growth of this business by supporting Gulbahor.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase food items in order to increase the range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Duong

texts.en: Mr. S. is 56 years old and his wife, Noeun, is 53. They earn their daily income by selling traditional clothes that they buy from a wholesale supplier. The clothing is made from silk. S. and his wife use their own motorbike to transport the clothing from village to village. They sell the silk closthing to their clients’ at their homes and they earn around $7 a day. The couple lives with their five children, all of whom are employed and work in different jobs. The family owns one hectare of farmland that was inherited from their grandparents. The farming season is approaching and Mr. S. is looking for a $400 loan. This loan will be used towards growing all kinds of vegetables the farmland that they own. (Mr. S.'s wife is pictured.)

loans.use: Towards costs of growing all kinds of vegetables on their farmland.

loans.name: Flora Lucila

texts.es:
La señora Flora Lucila Huamán M., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras de Catac” , vive en el Barrio 2 de Mayo S/N, del Distrito de Catac - Provincia de Recuay, Departamento de Ancash.  Está casada, tiene 06 hijos, de los cuales sólo 01 hija se encuentra en su poder, en tanto que el resto de sus hijos ya tienen sus familias constituidas.
Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 compró carnero para la venta de carne en el mercado de Lima – Huamantanga.  Es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras de Catac” desde hace 03 años.  Ella se siente muy agradecida porque aprendió el ahorro y la práctica de la solidaridad entre otros.
En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio, siempre vendiendo en Lima, y se apoya con su esposo que también vende en Lima.  El vende verduras y papas que lleva desde el Callejón de Huaylas.

Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00 comprará más carneros para vender la carne al por menor y así obtener mayores ganancias.
 Ella se siente una mujer realizada por haber logrado darles una profesión a sus 05 hijos y dar estudios a su hija menor.
texts.en:
Mrs. Flora Lucila Huamán M. belongs to the "Las Triunfadores de Catac" ("The Triumphant Women of Catac") Village Bank. She lives in the 2 de Mayo neighborhood in an unnumbered house in Catac District, Recuay Province, Ancash Department. She is married and has six children. Just one of her daughters still lives at home, since her other children all have families of their own. With her first loan of 300 soles, Flora bought a ram so that she could sell the meat in the Lima - Huamantanga Market. She has been a member of her village bank for the past three years, and is very grateful because she has learned to save and learned about the concept of solidarity, among other things. At present, Flora has the same business selling meat in Lima. She and her husband support one another; he also works as a vendor in Lima, selling vegetables and potatoes that he brings from the Callejón de Huaylas Valley. With this loan of 800 soles, Flora will buy more rams to sell their meat by the kilo so that she can increase her income. She feels like an accomplished woman, since five of her children are now working professionals and her youngest daughter is in school.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rams to sell for meat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To dye and sell pagnes

loans.name: Annah's Group

texts.en:
T. Annah is a hardworking and bold lady and the leader of Akatongore group in Ibanda. Annah has had a business rearing goats in Akatongore village for the past three years . The main business challenge is accessing drugs for her animals. She is able to make ~70,000 profit per week and is able to look after her children and pay their school fees.

Annah is also a farmer, though on a small scale. The food helps to feed her children and the excess is sold for income. She has a dream of buying more goats and growing more crops so as to turn into a modern farmer with more profits from more customers. She needs a loan to be able to buy more goats and to employ labor on her farm.

loans.use: To buy more goats and employ labor on her farm

loans.name: David Ba Group

texts.en:
Joseph is thirty-nine years old. He is married and has two children. He is a trader in hardware. Joseph is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘David Ba’ which literally means Son of David. He is the only male in the group photograph. The members of this group are mostly traders, food vendors, and farmers. They work to support their spouses to provide for their families.

They buy their raw materials, wares or goods from other towns and sometimes from nearby communities and sell at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on market days as well. The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. It is in light of this that they are requesting for a loan to procure more goods to expand their businesses.

The members of the group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan. It is their desire to give their children a good education.

loans.use: To buy stock.

loans.name: Zenelia

texts.es: Zenelia L. M. tiene 51 años. Ella es madre soltera. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica es la venta de cosmético. Hace más de 2 años que se dedica a su negocio. Su mayor desafío que enfrento con este negocio fue aprender ofrecer a sus clientes sus productos, ya que no tenía la suficiente experiencia para hablar fácilmente con sus clientes, además es una mujer que ha sufrido ciertas enfermedades. Pero esto no le es imposible salir adelante. Ella solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de cremas faciales, pinturas de labios, pinturas de uñas, brillos y cremas. Su mayor deseo es tener más clientes para su incrementar su inventario.
texts.en:
Zenelia L. M. is 51 years old. She is a single mother. She has 2 children in her care. Her work is the sale of cosmetics. She has worked for more than 2 years at this business. The greatest challenge that she faces with this business was to learn to offer her clients her products, and she didn’t have sufficient experience to speak easily with her clients. Also, she is a woman who has suffered certain illnesses. But with that, it is not impossible for her to move her life forward. She is asking for the loan for working funds in order to buy facial creams, eyeliner, eye shadow, nail polish, and creams. Her greatest desire is to have more clients in order to grow her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Funds

loans.name: Idowu

texts.en:
Idowu sells drinks and has been in this business for a long time. She buys drinks in crates from those who buy directly from the company. She hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase drinks from the company directly as this would make the goods less expensive and more profitable for her.

Idowu is 40 years old and married with three children. She says thank you all.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks directly from the company

loans.name: Mauata

texts.en:
Mauata A., 34-year-old woman living in the town of Lano, is married and has two small children. To make a living, Mauata owns and operates a business providing hairdressing and beauty services in her community. Mauata has been in this business for over two years and earns approximately 150 WST a month.

In 2009, Mauata (0) joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mauata is requesting a loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide her service. This will be Mauata's first loan from SPBD. Mauata plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Villa Pachamarca Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal VilL. Pachamarca, se encuentra ubicado en L. comunidad D. Pachamarca, distrito del mismo nombre, provincia D. Churcampa, departamento D. Huancavelica. Esta comunidad se caracteriza por L. producción D. cereales como el maíz, trigo, cebada, así como frutos, como naranjas, papayas y otros.

Marcelina es divorciada y tiene 01 hijo. Marcelina, se dedica a L. crianza y venta D. animales menores, los cuales venD. en las minas y en L. ciudad D. Huancayo, con L. ayuda D. su hijo. Marcelina requiere D. un préstamo, con el cual comprará mas animales para su venta. ElL., está ahorrando para L. educación D. su hijo.

Miriam, es casada y tiene 04 hijos. ElL. se dedica a L. venta D. diversos productos en su pequeña bodega, así como a L. venta D. animales menores. ElL., se abastece D. productos en L. ciudad D. Huancayo, para lo que requiere un préstamo, así como para habilitar una pequeña granja para sus animales. Miriam, piensa en el futuro D. sus hijos, para lo cual ya se encuentra ahorrando, ya que le gustaría que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The VilL. Pachamarca Communal Bank is located in the Pachamarca community in the district with the same name, Churcampa province, Huancavelica department. This community is characterized by grain production such as corn, wheat, and barley. Oranges, papayas, and other fruits are also grown. Marcelina is divorced and has one child. Marcelina raises and sells small animals. She sells them, with help from her son, in the mines in the city of Huancay. Marcelina needs a loan to buy more animals to sell. She is saving for her son’s education. Miriam is married and has four children. She sells diverse products in her convenience store. She also sells small animals. She stocks up on products in the city of Huancayo. She needs a loan to set up a small farm for her animals. Miraim, thinking of her children’s future, is already saving. She would like them to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in their businesses

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Phal S., 32, lives with her husband and three young children in Takeo province, Cambodia. Her husband is a carpenter who is able to make around US$4 each day. Phal was not available for the photo and so her husband is shown instead.

Phal S. is a professional decorator of women’s dresses. Since 2000, she has been using beads and other materials to make flower designs on women’s clothes to earn a living and typically makes US$4 each day. A decorated dress is a kind of Khmer traditional dress and people wear it during Water Festival, P’chum Ben or Khmer New Year.

It takes around 7-10 days to complete each dress and so it is expensive. Most of the people prefer hand-made designs rather than machine-made. Phal S. said she learned how to decorate from her mother and she has operated her business since before she was married.

Phal S. would like a loan of US$700 to purchase wood and other material to expand her husband’s business.

loans.use: To buy wood and other materials to expand her husband’s business

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph N. is from the village of Brgy. 24, Gingoog City. He is 43 years old. Joseph is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Joseph runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Joseph has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Joseph joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joseph has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Joseph is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the third loan taken out by Joseph from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of his children, to pay bills and for land installments. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Hermogenes

texts.es: El Sr. Hermógenes, trabajó con grupo solidario "La Merced" en seis secuencias, luego se individualizo siendo esta su decimatercera secuencia, el Sr. Tiene un Frial en el que se dedica a la venta de carne vacuna especialmente, el viaja por carne al altiplano, trae ganado parado y lo lleva a carnear al matadero municipal, el trabaja con varios negocioa pequeños a los que provee de ese producto, la esposa  tambien se dedica a la venta de carne pero de pollo, ellos tienen 3 hijos que  ya cursan estudios superiores, dos de ellos y el otro pequeño se encuentra en colegio, es un cliente muy responsable.
texts.en:
Señor Hermógenes was part of the group “La Merced” for six loan periods, but then he took out a loan independently. This will be his thirteenth loan. He runs a food store where he sells meat with beef as a speciality. He travels into the mountains to buy the meat. He takes the cattle to the municipal slaughterhouse where they are butchered. Hermógenes sells the meat to several small businesses. His wife sells meat also, but chicken rather than beef. They have three children, two of whom are in college, and the youngest is still in high school. He is a very responsible client.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cattle to resell as meat

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La señora Irma, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sargento Lores”, Distrito de Morales, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 40 años y no tiene hijos.

Irma, lleva 15 años en el negocio, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida, las ganas de salir adelante le dieron buenos resultados y hoy en día con el negocio que maneja se siente muy contenta, se inicio vendiendo cosméticos y ahora cuenta con un Salón de Belleza, muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en la parte céntrica de la Ciudad.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,200.00, comprará productos de belleza para su como: tinte, oxigeno, shampo, cremas, gorros térmicos, tijera, navajas, ganchos, entre otros y así brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes.

Irma, con su madurez es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Irma belongs to the Sargento Lores Communal Bank in the Morales district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 40, single, and does not have children. Irma has been in the business for 15 years. She is a woman who has overcome many difficulties in her life. Her desire to get ahead gave her good results. She currently feels very pleased with the business she runs. She started selling cosmetics, and she now has a very well equipped beauty salon. It is located in the central part of the city. With this loan for 1,200 PEN she will buy beauty products like tint, bleach, shampoo, creams, heating caps, scissors, razors, and hooks, among other things to provide her customers with good service. Irma, with her maturity, is an example to follow for other women who want to start their own business. With perseverance they can achieve their dreams. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her own business and for helping other women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty materials

loans.name: Jaka's Group

texts.en:
B. Jaka is the leader of his lending group in Kihihi. He is 43 years old and married with 10 children, of whom 4 are in school, as he takes care of other orphans. Jaka is friendly and hard-working, dealing in agriculture mostly in the selling and buying of green bananas and tea leaves from Mayanja Cell for the past 22 years. He is able to make 700,000/= as profit a month. He is grateful that he was able to secure a good location for his business hence attracting more customers. His motive is to become very rich to the advantage of his family.

Jaka needs a loan to help with buying more tea leaves for resale; his previous loans have helped him with paying his wages on time.

loans.use: Buying more tea leaves for resale

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani A. is from the village of Tagoloan , Misamis oriental. She is 39 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she makes and sells food in her local community. Lani has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lani joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lani is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed to make more products for sale. This loan will be the first from HSPFI.  Lani plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 
---------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is fifty-four years old. She is married and has four children who are all still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a community where the major occupation is trading.

Margaret works very hard to support her husband to be able to provide for the family. She runs a provision store by the roadside in the community, procuring her goods from Accra. She has been in business for some years and wants a loan to buy provision in bulk to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This entreprener is 33 years old and married. He attended primary school and passed the primary school exam. 

For more than three years, he has been operating a restaurant. The purpose of this loan is to develop his restaurant by purchasing rice, beans, okra, broad-bean-cabbages, and other food to attract more customers. He will also purchase huge pots, an oven and a grilling machine. He has a good reputation in the market because of the good quality of his food. He has many waiters to serve his customers. 

It is significant and worth mentioning that this loan is a renewal of a loan that he used to expand his restaurant. He made all payments on the original loan in a timely manner and is a worthy and trusted customer. With his original loan, he had the capacity to improve his restaurant significantly and to  decorate it in a nice and tidy style. 

He prepares the most delicious and flavorful foods. His food has turned customers into permanent clients. The cleanness and delicious food are two significant advantages of his restaurant.

loans.use: To buy food, huge pots, an oven, and a grilling machine.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali has worked in construction since 1994. He’s 28 years old and married, and has 3 young children who go to school. He started working in this occupation 16 years ago when he was very young. He works on a freelance basis and he's well known in this field with his long history. 

Ali is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy wood that he needs for his construction work.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Constancia

texts.en:
Constancia B. is from the village of Caluya, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental.  She is 43 years old, married and has 1 school-aged children. To make a living, Constancia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising hogs. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling and buying hogs in the local community. Constancia has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2003, Constancia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Constancia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC.  Constancia is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional pigs for her hog raising activity. This loan will be the 4tth loan taken out by Constancia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital of her hog raisning

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es:
La solicitante es la Sra Maria Lourdes B. D. D. Ñuñez la misma es casada posee casa propia con todas las comodidades necesarias   del hogar, es Microempresaria y realiza D. servicios D. masajista , reflexologia y masaje Sueco  a domicilio también posee otros ingresos venta D. joyas   y confección D. ropas D. ao poi cuenta con 7 años D. antigüedad en rubro lo que le permite contar con muy buena clientela he ingresos.
 La misma solicitó el crédito para a la compras D. cremas reductoras , cremas para masaje D. relax en cantidad que es le seria mas rentable y le dejaría mayor ganancia.
texts.en:
The applicant is Maria Lourdes B., from Ñuñez. She is married and has her own home with all the necessary comforts. She is a micro businesswoman and provides a massage service, including reflexology and Swedish massage, in her home. She also has other forms of income including selling jewellery and making clothes. She has been in this line of business for 7 years, and she has very good customers and profits. Maria is seeking a loan to purchase slimming, massage and relaxing creams in quantity as this is more profitable and will give her better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase massage creams, silver jewellery, mercandise

loans.name: Bbogo Women's Group 1, Lugazi

texts.en:
Nantumbe Margaret, with hand raised, is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is a 52-year-old single woman, but a happy-go-lucky and cheerful business woman.

Margaret’s ten-year-old flourishing fish-vending business in Kombwe, Lugazi, has enabled her to give her six children an education. Her modest business has been generating her profits to the tune of 30,000 shillings per week.

With this new loan, Margaret wants to be financially empowered and to buy more fish, which she hopes to sell not only to old clients but also to new ones.

Margaret got inclined to this business after her erstwhile husband prevailed upon her to join him. Since then, she has never looked back, notwithstanding the marital adversities the family had. She wants to buy another canoe boat to facilitate easy delivery of fish to her operating area as well as to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy another canoe boat and to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: Monsieur Mamadou Diabaté est un tailleur étranger de 39 ans qui a longtemps vécu dans la localité de  Ouakam.  Il est sociétaire de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC a Ouakam depuis déjà 8 années et a bénéficié de 6 prêts antérieurs. Monsieur Diabaté est marie et père de trois enfants. Cela fait 20 ans maintenant qu’il évolue dans la couture, la confection et la vente de  chemises et d’habits  pour dames. Il a choisi cette activité  par passion et par amour du métier. Il sollicite un crédit de 250 000 frs dans le but d’acheter des tissus pour la confection de nouveaux modèles de chemises et d’habits. Ce prêt  pourra contribuer a l’amélioration  de son niveau de vie.
texts.en:
Mr Mamadou Diabaté is a 39 year-old foreign tailor who has lived in the Ouakam area for a long time. He has been a member of the U-IMCEC microcredit association in Ouakam for eight years and has received 6 loans from them. Monsieur Diabaté is a married father of three. He has been working in his field for twenty years, sewing, producing and selling women's blouses and suits. He chose this field because of his love of the craft. Mr Diabaté is seeking a 250 000 FRS loan in order to purchase cloth for creating new styles of blouses and suits; this loan could go a way to improving his quality of life.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: investment

loans.name: Oyunbaatar

texts.en:
Oyunbaatar U. is 49 years old. He lives with his wife and two children in Hentiy province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger (a Mongolian nomadic tent). Oyunbaatar operates a shoe repair business. He shares his workplace, which is located near the largest local market, with a friend. He has been operating his business since 2000, and has built a loyal customer base over the past ten years. His daily revenue is 30,000 MNT, and his monthly revenue is 900,000 MNT.  He charges 2,500 MNT to repair one pair of shoes. 
Oyunbaatar's wife, Oyunbileg, is a nurse at a local hospital, and earns 220,000 MNT per month. Both of Oyunbaatar's children are university students. With his business profits, he has been able to purchase his own plot of land with a house and yard, and has been paying his two children's university fees. Oyunbaatar has a demand deposit in our bank, and deposits his daily revenue in it. It is therefore possible for us to monitor his revenue. He is requesting a 4,000,000 MNT loan to purchase necessary materials and equipment to manufacture shoes. In addition, he will use the loan to finish building a new house for his family.

loans.use: To purchase materials and equipment

loans.name: Ivania Maritza

texts.es: Ivania Maritza tiene 46 años, por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que siempre ha sido una persona muy luchadora y trabajadora. Ella tiene 10 hijos pero todos trabajan de manera independiente, por lo que sus inicios no fueron muy fáciles ya que ella era madre soltera y tenía que buscara la manera de sufragar los gastos de su hogar, pues con todos los sacrificios que Ivania ha hecho ha podido salir adelante. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de lápiz labial, sombras, pintura de uñas entre otras cosas. Su deseo es continuar realizándole mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ivania Maritza, 46, has sold cosmetics for the last 15 years; she's always been a hard-working, tenacious person. She has 10 children who work independently. At the beginning, things were not very easy for her because she's a single mother and had to find ways to cover household expenses. However, all of Ivania's sacrifices have made it possible to get ahead. She will use the requested funds to buy lipsticks, eye shadows and nail polish among other things. Her wish is to continue to make home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Ida

texts.es: Ida tiene 36 años, convive con su pareja y tienen 3 hijos en su haber. Juntos viven en la comunidad de Sirenachayocc, ubicada en la selva cusqueña peruana, donde tienen su casa propia a base de madera. Ida, una mujer de mentalidad ganadora, asegura “que su padre le inculcó a trabajar ya que así obtendría un mejor futuro”. A los 24 años tuvo a su primer hijo, apoyándose solo de la ayuda de su pareja, eso le daba motivos para alcanzar lo que quería. Ahora se dedica en la producción y comercialización de cacao y le va muy bien la competencia con otros productores en el mercado.  Por consiguiente sus ventas fueron creciendo paulatinamente, además ya tiene posicionado su producto en su comunidad, siente que ha logrado el primer paso ahora le falta mantener y lo logrará siempre y cuando trabaje con mucha dedicación y  amor propio. Usualmente su producto los vende en los centros de acopio de su comunidad a un buen precio, en donde su pareja lo apoya y juntos toman decisiones efectivas tanto para la comercialización. Ida anhela tener su propia tienda para vender ropa, ya que en su comunidad falta cubrir esa necesidad. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus compromisos de pago, además hace hincapié al buen equipo de trabajo que ejercen en su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en ampliar su producción en terrenos que aún no son sembrados para ello necesitará comprar semillas de cacao de alta calidad, así como también de abono.
texts.en:
Ida is 36 years old and lives with her partner. They have 3 children. They live in the community of Sirenachayocc, located in the Peruvian forest of Cusco where they have their own wooden house. Ida is a woman with a winning mentality. She assures that "her father taught her to work in order to have a better future". At 24 she had her first child, her only support being her partner, which gave her motives to achieve her goals. Now she produces and sells cocoa and she competes well with the other producers at the market. Her sales has been increasing constantly, and her product is well accepted in her community. She thinks that she has succeded in the first step and now she needs to maintain her position through hard work and self-esteem. Usually her product is sold at the collection centers of her community at a good price. Her partner supports her and together they make decisions related to the marketing. Ida wants to own a store to sell clothes, as there is a need in her community. This is her second loan with MFP, and she promises to continue being punctual with the payments. She also mentions the good teamwork they have in her community group. With the loan she will invest in increasing her production on land that has not been in use and therefore she needs to buy good quality cocoa seeds as well as fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cocoa seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard M. is from the village of Talon Gingoog City. He is 25 years old and single. To make a living Richard runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where he sells food and daily use products in the local community. Richard has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Richard joined HSPFI to improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Richard successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI which he used to to purchase additional products to sell. Richard is requesting his third loan, for 9000 PHP, which he will use for the same purpose. He plans to use the additional revenue to expand his business.

About HSPFI

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.en:
Guillermo B. is from the village of Magsaysay, Baliangao. He is 55 years old, married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Guillermo owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting assorted crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling his own harvested crops in the local community. Guillermo has been engaged in his business for over 12 years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Guillermo joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Guillermo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for his business. Guillermo is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used for house repair. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Guillermo from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For house repair

loans.name: Igor

texts.en:
Igor is married with two children. He is an entrepreneur from Stryi who runs a food sales business in his home town. After recession hit Ukraine many people cut their expenses. However, groceries are a basic need for any family, which is why they still sell well. Igor finds favor with all his customers and has been working in this sphere of business for four years.
Igor is seeking a loan of 17,000 UAH to increase his capital. He is a businessman who sees an opportunity for business growth. This loan will be a big help to him as he looks for ways to increase his business activity.

loans.use: To increase his capital

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity G. is currently in the business of selling green vegetables such as dodo (amaranth greens), okra, etc. at the market and is requesting a loan to stock dried fish and jerrycans of cooking oil to sell.  Charity is 49 years old and is a widow.   She has seven children and none of them go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her children.

loans.use: Stock dried fish and jerrycans of cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Henry Gregoric

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MI PERU”; el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santiago, provincia y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es la Sr. Henry; el tiene 34 años de edad y es conviviente  tiene 2 Hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el comercio minorista, El socio se dedica a la venta de madera;  El socio es solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería para la veta.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “Mi Perú” communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Santiago, in the province and department of Cusco. The member is Henry. He is 34 years old, lives with his partner, and has 2 children. He alternates his daily activities with sales. He sells wood. He is requesting the loan to invest in merchandise. He is grateful to the people who are part of his dream through this program. He promises to make his payments in the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood for resale

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 30-year-old man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a teacher at one of the primary schools in the area. As a salary earner, his income is fixed irrespective of what he achieves at work; thus, he says he needs to have a side income. His biggest priority is education for his dependants. He is starting a prominent business for increased income generation. He is constructing a commercial house so as to earn extra income to sustain them. This is his first loan from HOFOKAM and he intends to purchase iron sheets and doors for the completion of his commercial house which is now under construction.

loans.use: To purchase iron sheets and doors to complete his commercial house

loans.name: Santos Yrene

texts.es:
Santos tiene 69 años D. edad y vive junto a su familia en el distrito D. Pacasmayo, perteneciente a la provincia del mismo nombre y ubicada en la región La Libertad, a más D. dos horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace mas D. treinta años a la venta D. artículos D. plástico en un puesto ubicado en el exterior del mercadillo D. la ciudad donD. vive. Ella trabaja todos los dias desD. muy temprano y, gracias al tiempo que lleva trabajando en esta actividad, cuenta con un grupo D. clientes fieles que siempre acuden a su negocio cada vez que necesitan D. alguno D. los articulos que venD..

Santos desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo mas mercadería para ofrecerla en venta. D. este modo podrá contar con mas productos que ofrecer a sus clientes y sus ventas aumentarán. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer tranquila y que siempre está dispuesta a ayudar a los que le necesitan. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento D. asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Santos is 69 years old and she lives together with her family in the district of Pacasmayo, it is located in a province by the same name. It is located in the region of La Libertad, more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo. She has worked for more than thirty years in the sale of plastic goods, selling from a store located in the exterior section of the small market in the city where she lives. She works every day from the very early morning hours. Thanks to the years she has had in this business she has a well established client base that always come to her business to purchase what they need. Santos wishes to expand her business by adding new merchandise to put on sale. She will be able to have a greater variety of products to offer the clients and her sales will increase. In order to meet her objective she has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles. She is a very reserved person and she is always ready to help anyone in need. She has worked with Edpyme Alternativa in the past and she has always demonstrated responsibility in making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase plastic goods for resale in the market.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe Benkadi sont essentiellement des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37ans, 3 enfants et  vivant dans des familles monogames à Hamdallaye  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, (3ème région administrative du Mali : Sikasso). 
Elles sont à leur huitième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les  sept prêts précédents ont tous été bien soldés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles différents et de poissons  avec AMI K..
AMI K. compte acheter avec son  prêt 15 kg de poissons frais + 1 barre de glace.  Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso ville.
Elle mène son activité à Sikasso ville (au marché de Hamdallaye et à domicile). Elle effectue sa vente  au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 32.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elle  ambitionne s’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation à Sikasso.
texts.en:
The five members of the Benkadi group are essentially married women, who average 37 years of age and have on average three children each. They live in monogamous families in Hamdallaye, one of the districts of the town of Sikasso (Mali's third administrative region).

They are on their eighth loan from the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with the goal of satisfying customer demand. All the seven previous loans have been repaid in full. This group of women sell a variety of items, including fish (this is the case for Ami K.).

With her loan Ami K. is planning on buying 15kg of fresh fish and a block of ice. She gets her supplies at Sikasso town's large market and she carries out her business in Sikasso town (at the market in Hamdallaye and from home). She sells for cash, on a retail basis and for credit to a customer base made up of men and women. 

She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 32,500FCFA, of which part will be used for savings and family needs, and the rest invested in her business. Her ambition is to buy a piece of land to live on in Sikasso.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica N. is 26 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children. One of her children is currently in school. Monica has a business of a salon, which she has had for 4 years.         

To help expand her business, Monica has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase braids. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Monica hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes buy food. In the future, Monica hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy braids.

loans.name: Union Por El Progreso Group

texts.es: Humberto es el presidente del grupo “Unión por el Progreso”, tiene 41 años D. edad, está separado y tiene cinco hijos que ya viven D. manera independiente, el ha vendido caldo D. gallina por 20 años motivado por ver a sus hijos en una mejor calidad D. vida, el prestamos que recibe lo está utilizando para invertir en su negocio, con este mismo él se mantiene y construye su casa poco a poco, el indica que si tuviera un buen capital D. dinero pondría un restaurant D. pollos a L. brasa. El está contento D. integrar el grupo, en total son ocho personas que tienen una relación D. amigos y vecinos, además el nombre que eligieron les incita a progresar con L. ayuda D. Edaprospo y las habilitaciones que tanto les ayuda a cada uno en su propio negocio.
texts.en: Humberto is the President of the group “Union por el Progreso” (United for Progress); he is 41 years old, separated and has 5 children who are independent. He has been selling chicken soup for 20 years, always motivated to offer his children a better quality of life. The loan he is receiving will be invested in his business which provides for his support and the construction of his house, little by little. He indicates that if he had enough capital he would setup a grilled-chicken restaurant. He is happy to be a member of the group; there is a total of eight members that are friends and neighbors; the name they chose incites them to “progress” with help from Edaprospo and what they facilitate for everybody in their respective businesses.

loans.use: Buy products and consumables

loans.name: Salim

texts.en: Salim is a 52-year-old married man with 12 children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda who is longing to see all his children independent from him. He is a mechanic and has been in service for 20 years, which has enabled him to educate his children and sustain the family. His business goal is to extend his services to most of the urban centers in the district. Salim intends to use the loan to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to sell

loans.name: Gabriel Mateo

texts.es:
Gabriel Mateo A. Q. tiene 50 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUZ Y PROGRESO se encuentra ubicada 20 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y otras labores profesionales, en esta ventanilla son 17 socios.

Gabriel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho además tiene gallinas de crianza. Compra sus productos en Chillanes y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener mas tierras para seguir cultivando.

Le gusta ver la televisión.
texts.en:
Gabriel Mateo A. Q., 50, is married living with his wife and children in Chillanes canton, Bolívar province.  He has four children.

The members of the LUZ Y PROGRESO (Light & Progress) communal bank are located 20 minutes from the Chillanes Office.  It is part of Chillanes canton and the bank is dedicated to farming and other professional jobs.  It has 17 members.

Gabriel is a maize, broad bean, pea and chayote farmer; he also raises chickens.  He buys his supplies in Chillanes and sells his products in the Chillanes market and in his settlement.

He is asking for a loan to buy maize, broad bean, pea and chayote seed.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  They face challenges like illnesses, infestations and weather changes.  His dream is to have more land to continue farming.

He enjoys watching television.

loans.use: For seeds.

loans.name: Steven

texts.en:
Steven O. O. is twenty three years old. He is single and does not yet have children. His business is located in Kisumu near a fish market. Kisumu is the region in Kenya which harbours Lake Victoria.  It is well-known as the Lake's basin. 

Steven provides transport services by use of a bicycle around the busy Kisumu city. He has been in this business for two and half years. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is rain.  During the rainy season, business is low since bicycles lack cover from rain and so people don't like to use them. However he works very hard to keep his business doing well. 

Steven is using his loan of Kes 50,000 to buy bicycles to expand his business. He hopes to acquire a motorbike for transport services in the future. He also hopes to have his own family some day. He describes himself as energetic, motivated and respectful.

loans.use: To buy bicycles

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER DE URUBAMBA”; Este banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Ignacio; El socio tiene 46 años de edad, el socio es conviviente; el socio tiene 4 hijos; el socio trabaja como moto taxista; el socio brinda el servicio de moto taxi en la provincia de Urubamba, el socio acondicionó su moto a una especie de carreta llamada moto taxi, el vehículo transporta pasajeros de tramos cortos, el socio manifiesta que le va muy bien y que desearía tener una flota de este tipo de transporte público, por el momento el socio requiere el préstamo para arreglar su casa, el socio hará unos acabados en su sala y baño principal, el socio también cubrirá una pequeña deuda que adquirió por concepto de un regalo que le compro a su conyugue. El socio solicita el préstamo para realizar un acabado en su hogar específicamente la sala y baño.

El socio está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ignacio is a member of “NUEVO AMANECER DE URUBAMBA” (Urubamba’s New Dawn) communal bank which is located in Urubamba province, Cusco department.

He is 46 years old, has a spouse and four children.  He works as a taxi driver.  He provides mototaxi services in Urubamba province.  He modified his motorcycle adding a type of cabin called a mototaxi.  The vehicle transports passengers on short runs.  He states that he does quite well and would like to have a fleet of these kinds of public transportation vehicles. 

For the moment, however, he needs a loan to do some home improvements.  He will do some work in the living room and bathroom.  He will also pay off a debt he incurred buying a gift for his spouse.  He is asking for the loan to do some finishing touches in his home, specifically in the living room and bathroom.

He is happy with the granted loan and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To do some home improvements, specifically in the living room and bathroom.

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman is married with two sons. He lives in Belaya Tserkov. Roman manufactures custom-made cabinet furniture and re-sells factory-manufactured furniture pieces. He has an individual approach to every customer; every furniture item is of high quality and manufactured on time. Roman has recently opened a new vending location in the same area of his hometown. He has been in the trade for five years. Currently, his net profit amounts to 4,000 Grivnyas a month.     

Roman is seeking a loan of 5,000 Grivnyas to prepare all the paperwork for a wholesale furniture delivery contract with a furniture supermarket called MEBITAR. He is hoping to increase his scale of manufactured furniture items and thus increase his sales and income as a result. Roman is an ambitious businessman. He is ready to work hard and make his enterprise grow and succeed in the future.

loans.use: To prepare paperwork for wholesale supply contract

loans.name: Ishtvan

texts.en:
Ishtvan is married with a teenage son named Maxim. He and his family live in Beregovo, Western Ukraine. Ishtvan offers reconstruction and remodeling services (i.e., plastering and stuccoing, painting, glazing, panel lining, and flooring services). Ishtvan started this business only a year ago. However, his good grasp of new techniques and his natural ability to learn fast have helped him reach entrepreneurial success. Ishtvan has already invested about 20,000 UAH in the business. His monthly net profit amounts to 6,000 UAH. 

Ishtvan is requesting a loan of 10,000 UAH to purchase additional plastering and stuccoing tools for his daily work. Newer instruments will facilitate remodeling and help him improve the quality of his work. Ishtvan is very diligent and scrupulous. He tries to guarantee the high quality of performed repairs. One of his short-term plans is to expand his business and gather a construction crew to work with him.

loans.use: To purchase tools

loans.name: Fareed

texts.en:
Fareed is an advertising magazine owner. His small company designs and publishes advertisements in his commercial magazine. Fareed is trying to expand his business. He hired more employees and requested a loan from FATEN to purchase computers for them to use to manage the magazine's work.

Fareed appears in the photo in his office.

loans.use: To purchase computers for magazine employees

loans.name: Doris Tatiana

texts.es: Doris Tatiana tiene una pequeña pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera y posee 3 hijos. Esta no es la primera vez que solicita créditos por lo que se siente muy agradecida con este medio de vida. De lo que obtiene de su negocio lo utiliza para comprar más mercancía y realizar su venta más días a la semana, para que mejor sea sus ingresos y con ello cubrir algunos gastos que se generan en su hogar. el crédito será invertido en la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos naturales y pan.
texts.en:
Doris Tatiana has a small store that she manages in her home. She is 35 years old and a single mother of three children. This is not the first time she has applied for loans since she is grateful that they have helped her earn a living. What she earns from her business is used to buy more merchandise so that she can generate more sales throughout the week. This enables her to improve her income and cover some of the household expenses.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of basic grains, candy, natural beverages, and bread.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy basic grains, candy, natural beverages, and bread

loans.name: Lylliam Yenny

texts.es:
Lyliam Yenny M. proveniente de una familia campesina, decidió buscar futuro en Medellín,  fue entonces cuando se vio obligada a montar su propio negocio para aportar a cubrir los gastos del hogar, pues su esposo trabaja por días en el campo y con lo que gana no es suficiente para el sustento diario. 

Esta emprendedora necesita de un préstamo para comprar una nevera y surtido de lácteos para ampliar su oferta de productos y así incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Lyliam Yenny M. comes from a peasant family, but she decided to look for a better future in Medellin. She was then obliged to establish her own activity in order to contribute to the payment of her family expenses, as her husband works in the country every day but what he earns is not enough to provide for their daily needs.

This entrepreneur needs a loan to buy a fridge and a supply of dairy products in order to increase the number of goods she offers and so improve her sales.

loans.use: To buy a fridge and a supply of dairy products

loans.name: Exitosas De Boshindo Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama  "EXITOSAS DE  BOSHINDO"  porque las integrantes del grupo buscan el éxito cotidiano en su negocio dia con dia, buscando  una oportunidad  de tener más ventas y crecer. Están ubicadas en el Boshindo en Acambay en el Estado de México. El grupo está conformado por  9 integrantes y es la primera  vez que solicitan un prestamo. Maria Guadalupe O. es integrante del grupo. Tiene 47 años, estudió hasta la secundaria, es ama de casa y tiene 3 hijos hombres. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de abarrotes y miselanea que inició hace 5 años. Solicita el prestamo para comprar más mercancia de productos que le encargan, sus ventas son mixtas y tiene que invertir priemero para adquirir el producto. Sus clientes  son personas del mismo barrio, cada una prefiere comprar los productos con la señora, por la calidad  de los productos y la atención muy amable que tiene. Su carisma  es una de sus fortalezas por lo que sus clientes la recomiendan, eso ayuda a incrementar su mercado  y siga creciendo en clientes y ganancias. Al monento  de solicitar este  préstamo se siente feliz y con una motivacion por tener la oportunidad de invertir  nuevamente y poder distribuir más productos. Su negocio es tan importante  ya que con ello puede salir adelante con los gastos de su familia y mejoramineto de su hogar para obtener una mejor calidad de vida.  Observaciones. la señora que no se ve bien se llama Maria del Carmen.
texts.en:
This group is called ‘Existosas de Boshindo’ because the group members look to succeed daily in their businesses and look for opportunities for more sales and to grow. They are located in Boshindo in Acambay within the State of Mexico. The group is comprised of nine members and this is the first time they are requesting a loan.

Maria Guadalupe O. is one of the group members. She is 47 years old, completed up to high school, is a housewife, and has three sons. She works buying and selling groceries and miscellaneous items, a business which she started five years ago. She is requesting the loan to buy more merchandise, as her sales are mixed and she has to invest first to buy the product. Her customers are people from her same neighborhood and all of them prefer her products due to their quality and her friendly service. Her charisma is one of her strengths which is why her customers recommend her. This helps to expand her market and continue growing in terms of customers and profits. She feels happy and motivated from having requested the loan because she has the opportunity to invest again and is able to distribute more products. Her business is very important, as it is a means for her to cover the family expenses and housing improvements so that she can have a better quality of life.

Note: The woman who is difficult to see is named Maria del Carmen.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her store

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: El señor Felix A. desde hace varios años se separo de su esposa, por lo que el tuvo que llevar la responsabilidad de cuidar a sus 3 pequeños hijos que están entre 10 y 5 años de edad. Para Félix ha sido un reto ser padre y madre para estos pequeños ya que no cualquiera acepta tener este tipo de responsabilidad. El trabaja en maquiladora como ayudante de soldador desde hace 13 años por lo que hay ocasiones que se queda tiempo extra para obtener mayores ingresos para llevar a sus hijos el pan de cada día. La casa de esta persona necesita mejoras como lo es enjarrar y darle una pinatada para que se vea bien.
texts.en: Mr. Felix A. split up from his wife many years ago, and since then he has been responsible for taking care of his 3 young children, aged between 10 and 5. To Felix, being a father and a mother at the same time to these young ones has been a challenge, and not everyone would have accepted such responsibility. He has been working as assistant welder in a "maquiladora" [a bonded assembly plant set up by a foreign firm near the US border] for 13 years, and sometimes he works overtime to earn more money to provide his children with their daily meals. This borrower’s house needs improvements such as plastering and painting it to give it a better look.

loans.use: To have his house plastered and painted.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin V. V. vive en Pilas de Pérez Zeledón y se ha dedicado toda su vida a la agricultura.
Don Edwin tiene una pequeña finquita en la cual quiere sembrar tubérculos. Específicamente jengibre   y ñampi. Para eso necesita un préstamo de ₡500 000 (quinientos mil colones) para comprar los insumos necesarios para la siembra de los tubérculos. 
El espera sacar provecho de la temporada y aumentar sus ingresos, para el beneficio de su familia.
El es socio de la empresa de Crédito Comunal La Danta S.A una de las 110 empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Edwin V. V. lives in Pilas de Pérez Zeledón.  He has devoted his whole life to farming.  Edwin has a small farm where he grows tubers.  Specifically, he grows ginger and “ñampi” (a vegetable in the sweet potato family).

He needs a loan of 500,000 colones to buy the needed supplies to sow the tubers.

He hopes to take advantage of the season and increase his income for his family’s benefit.  He is a member of the La Danta S.A communal credit company, which is one of the 110 organizations affiliated with EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to sow tubers.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 33 ans,  4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Boumoutou, sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’arachide, de savon, de gâteaux et d’oignon.                                                                                                                               
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur premier prêt solidaire.
La cliente KIATOU  compte acheter de l’arachide avec les grossistes de Fana et les revendeurs du village. Elle effectue ses ventes au village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 5 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Benkadi group are all married, are of an average age of 33, have four children each and live in large extended families in the village of Boumoutou  in the municipality of Fana, in the Koulikoro region (the second largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali). 
They met through family and friends, and sell peanuts, soap, cakes and onions for a living. This is the first loan that they have sought. 
Kiatou is seeking to purchase peanuts from the wholesalers of Fana and the village. She sells her goods in the village for cash and credit sales to a customer base made up of men and women. 
She aims to generate an average monthly profit of 5,000 CFA which she will use to pay the loan interest and for social occasions, and the rest will be reinvested into the business.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts

loans.name: Felicien

texts.en:
Felicien is 50 years old. He is married and has 5 children between 5 and 24 years old. He has owned a store selling various goods such as:  soap, biscuits, sugar etc. His business is well-organized and open for business from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m. every day, except on Sunday. He has one year of experience. He employs one person to help him.

Felicien has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase various goods such as: soap, biscuits, sugar, etc. to sell. With any profits, he plans to reinvest in his business and to save for his future.

loans.use: to purchase various goods such as: soap, biscuits, sugar, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Oscar Tomas

texts.es: El señor Oscar tiene  51 años, es casado. El señor se dedica a brindar sus servicios como fontanería, electricidad y mantenimiento de líneas telefónicas. La mayoría de sus clientes siempre lo buscan para que realice sus trabajos.  Tiene 30 años de ejercer esta profesión a pesar de que no es fácil ha sabido aprovecharlo, ya que tiene que proporcionarle a su esposa los ingresos necesario. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de herramientas, alambres, pinzas, destornilladores entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Oscar is 51 years old and married.  He provides plumbing, electrical, and maintenance of telephone lines services.  Most of his customers look for him to do their work.  

He has been in this profession for 30 years.  In spite of the fact that it is not easy, he has known how to make it work.  He has to provide his wife with the necessary income.

The reason for the loan is to buy tools, wire, pincers, and screwdrivers, among other products.

loans.use: to buy tools, wire, pincers, and screwdrivers, among other products.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica  is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She  is married and has 3 children. 

Jessica  has a shop that sells snacks, canned goods, coffee, drinks and juices. She has had this business for 2 years.  Jessica has requested a loan for PHP 5000 to purchase additional goods to sell so that she can earn a bigger profit to save for family needs.

Jessica  has been a member of HSPFI since this year, 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business for her family.

loans.use: buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Weedor

texts.en:
Weedor, 40, lives in Paynesville. She is married to a tailor and they have two children, aged 6 years and 2 months, both of whom live at home and one who attends school.

Weedor runs a small shop selling a wide range of goods including oil, drinks, rice, bread and batteries. She was taught how to run the business by a friend. Her main challenge is increases in price for the things she sells. She is happy when she sells things, as it enables her to help pay her child's school fees. She is requesting a loan to purchase and sell more goods. She would like to increase the size of her shop and the range of goods that she sells.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for resale.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie, 42, lives in the Philippines and is married with four children. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and detergents. She has had this business for two years. She has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

Margie has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Margie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Africana Group

texts.en:
Agnes is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Forty-nine-year-old Agnes is married to a professional worker and the couple has 10 children. Agnes sells locally manufactured soap called “Africa” and has been doing business for many years now. Agnes and members of her team have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 600,000 SLL for each in order to develop their respective businesses. Agnes is going to use her share of the loan to buy soap making materials (oil, caustic soda, etc.) in order to produce a larger quantity of soap for sale. 

(Also included in the left of the photo is loan officer Edna B. Conteh, handing over the loan to the borrowers)

loans.use: to buy soap-making materials (oil, caustic soda, etc.) in order to produce a larger quantity of soap for sale

loans.name: Gulrukhsor

texts.ru:
Гулрухсор честная, добросовестная и целеустремленная женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать 2 детей. Она занимается приготовлением национальных лепешек. Её муж и брат помогает ей в данном бизнесе. В день она производит около 220 шт. лепешек и раздает их в местных магазинах. Гулрухсор хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свой прибыль. Она хотела бы получит кредит в размере 750$ США на покупки муки для запаса. Она заранее благодарна всем за поддержку и поощрение. Спасибо вам!  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Gulrukhsor is an honest, conscientious and goal-oriented woman.  She is a married and loving mother of two children.  She is involved in cooking national flatbread.  Her husband and brother help her with this business.  She prepares about 220 flatbreads per day and delivers them to local stores.  Gulrukhsor wants to expand her business and maximize her profits.  She wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $750 for the purchase of flour.  She is thankful in advance to all for the help and support.  Thank you!

loans.use: to purchase flour

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Manuel tiene 63 años de edad esta casado con la señora Juana desde hace 38 años, del cual dicho matrimonio nacieron 4 hijos todos ya estan grandes ya no tiene hijos que dependan de don Manuel.

El nos comenta que tiene un negocio el cual lleva por nombre "Cartonera familiar" tiene este nombre porque realizan laminas de carton, y el negocio lo integran mienbros de la familia, el comenta que quizo iniciar este negocio para no depender tanto de la fabrica y ofrecerle el producto a sus clientes.
En esta ocasion el credito lo solicito para comprar materia prima, como papel, carton, periodico, este material lo compra para realizar laminas de carton, la elaboracion es apartir de una pulpa de carton, se obtiene moliendo todo el papel recolectado, para posteriormente ponerlo a secar al sol y asi obtener la lamina de carton. 

Uno de los deafios que presenta en su actividad es cuando no se seca, poque quizas llueve y no  sale el sol, pero esto no es motivo para que decaiga el animo por lo cual su actividad lleva ya 11 años funcionando, las ezperanzas que tiene el señor Manuel es que su negocio se fortalesca, y ya no tenga que pedir el prestamo. Sin embargo el esta muy agradecido con el prestamo que le otorgan para que su negocio siga creciendo ya que tiene existos haciendoce de mas clientes
texts.en:
Manuel is 63 years old. He is married to Juana, 38, with whom he has four children who are all grown up and no longer depend on Manuel. He tells us that he has a business which he has called 'Cartonera familiar' ('Family Cardboard Collection'), because they produce cardboard sheets and members of his family work for the company.

He says that he wanted to start this business so that he would not be so dependent on the factory and so that he could offer this product to his customers. On this occasion, he asked for the loan to buy raw materials like paper, cardboard and newspapers, which he buys to make the cardboard sheets. The manufacturing process uses a cardboard pulp, obtained by mashing together all the collected paper, which is put out to dry in the sun. One of the challenges Manuel faces is when the cardboard doesn't dry because it rains or the sun doesn't come out, but he doesn't see this as a reason to lose motivation.

Manuel has been doing this job for 11 years and hopes that his business will grow stronger so that he doesn't have to ask for any more loans. However, he is very grateful for the loan he is being given to help him to build his business and gain more customers.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like cardboard, paper and newspapers.

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en: Dalal is a 33-year-old young woman. She is married and has seven sons and three daughters. Her husband works as a taxi driver and gets a low salary. She has her own project, which is a general store selling different products such as home products, toys, etc. This is another source of income for the family. Dalal wants to open a new section in her store for selling toys. She wants to purchase toys to have a good collection, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of $3,000 from FATEN.
