When Dalal gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to pay for purchasing toys, open a new section in her store and have a good collection to sell. This loan will change her life for the better and will increase her income because her store is located in a well-known area and she has her customers. Dalal is photographed in the picture with her son in her store.

loans.use: To purchase toys to sell

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.ru: Махмуд житель города Душанбе. Ему 40 лет. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Его сын находится на заработках в России. Сам Махмуд имеет среднее образование. Он имеет пекарню, где печет лепешки. Вместе с ним работают четверо ребят, его родственники. В этой области Махмуд уже шесть лет. Он берет кредит для покупки муки, угля и для ремонта пекарни.
texts.en: Mahmud lives in the city of Dushanbe.  He is 40 years old, married and has one child.  His son is working in Russia.  Mahmud has a secondary education.  He owns a bakery, where he bakes flatbread.  Four of his relatives work with him as well.  Mahmud has been in this business for six years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of flour, coal and to make repairs to his bakery.

loans.use: to purchase flour, coal and to make repairs to his bakery

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 58 years old, married and has six grown-up children. Rice and corn production is the primary source of income in the barrio (district) where Corazon and her family live. She has been engaged in rice farming for almost 20 years. Together with her spouse, she plants and harvests rice to sell to traders in the barrio. 

Corazon would like to ask for a loan of P10,000 to pay the laborers who helped in transplanting rice seedlings on the farm. She also needs to pay additional laborers because they were not capable of doing all the activities on the farm such as sowing, tilling and transplanting rice seedlings.

She hopes to save enough money to use when emergencies arise because they are getting weak and old.

loans.use: to pay the laborers who helped in transplanting rice seedlings on the farm.

loans.name: Walter Arcenio

texts.es:
Walter, es empleado, es soltero, vive con su familia, todos trabajan, él desde hace tres años trabaja como visitador médico, su horario es de 8:00am a 4:00pm.
Él solicita un préstamo para reparar su vehículo en el cual trabaja, ya que presenta algunos problemas y debe enviarlo al mecánico, el préstamo le ayudara para tener en buenas condiciones su vehículo, ya que le permite trasladarse hacia su trabajo y viceversa. 
Su aspiración es tener un buen desarrollo en su trabajo, colaborar con su familia.
texts.en:
Walter is an employee.  He is single and lives with his family.  They all work.  Walter has been working as a medical sales rep for three years.  He works from 8.00am to 4.00pm.

Walter is requesting this loan to have his work vehicle repaired as it has some problems and he needs to send it to the mechanic.  This loan will help him to have his vehicle in good condition so that he can travel to and from his work.

Walter's aspiration is to make good progress in his job and to cooperate with his family.

loans.use: to pay a mechanic and buy spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a half a bale of pagnes and a half a bundle of hand bags.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Marivic makes and sells snacks like rice cakes and pancakes. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.

Marivic has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marivic hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.

loans.name: Terbish

texts.en: Terbish is 51 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Govi-altai province, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business and his two daughters are college students. He started his business in 1995 by selling garments by renting a counter in the market. Now he also runs a business trading raw materials like metal, copper, etc.  However, his raw material trading business needs 1,500,000 to purchase more iron. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says "Now that my daughters are in college, I need to do everything in order to support them."

loans.use: To purchase more iron.

loans.name: C9298  Abakozi Group

texts.en:
Evode is 23 years old and is single. He sells beans and maize  from 6 am until 5 pm every weekday. He is the leader of the group called "C9298 Abakozi" in the local language. In the photo, Evode is the second person from the left.  He has 16 years of experience in this work. 

Evode has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to purchase more beans and maize for sale. With the profit, he expects to save money for his future, pay his medical insurance and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman, living in a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

For the past one year, she has operated a vegetable stall business at the market, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop of vegetables in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables for resale at her stall. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables for resale at her stall.

loans.name: Margarita's Group

texts.es:
Margarita's group es un grupo de tres mujeres responsables por sus familias y trabajo, en este grupo la presidenta es Margarita ya que es una mujer fuerte, muy luchadora, proactiva, amable además le gusta mejorar cada día su estilo de vida. Margarita es madre de familia, vive con su esposo y cuatro hijos en la ciudad de Cayambe que se encuentra a media hora de Otavalo.

Margarita tiene una tienda, en la cual trabaja su familia ya que es la única fuente de ingreso de su familia para sustentar sus gastos. Es la primera vez que realiza un crpedito en Fodemi, este crédito va a ser invertido en la compra de productos variados para su tienda ya que en la temporada de navidad incrementan las ventas y los ingresos es por eso que quiere qprovechar ya que directamente beneficiará a su familia mejorando su calidad de vida.

El sueño de Margarita es poder exportar productos y que sus hijos aprendan del negocio ya que les puede generar buenas utilidades.
texts.en:
Margarita's Group is a group of three women responsible for their families and work.  Margarita is the president of this group because she is a strong woman, very much a fighter, proactive, kind.  She also likes to improve her lifestyle every day.  Margarita is the mother of a family.  She lives with her husband and four children in the city of Cayambe, which is located a half hour from Otavalo.

Margarita has a store in which her family works because it is the only source of family income to support their expenses.  This is the first time she is getting a loan from FODEMI.  This loan will be invested in buying various products for her store because during the Christmas season sales and income go up.  This is why she wants to take advantage, because it will directly benefit her family, improving their quality of life.

Margarita's dream is to be able to export products and for her children to learn the business since it can generate good profits for them.

loans.use: to supply her store with various products to get good Christmas sales.

loans.name: Joshua Kioko

texts.en: Joshua Kioko is 30 years old and earns a living as a bodaboda (or motorcycle) operator in Mshomoroni, Mombasa. He is married and has been in this line of work for two years. He is doing well and is applying for his first loan, for 12,000 shillings, to buy a new motorcycle. He will use the additional income made possible by this loan to support his family. His goal for the future is to own a shop.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Naftaly

texts.en:
Naftaly owns a mobile money transfer shop; the business has been in operation for one year. He is married and resides in Mombasa, Kenya. He heard about Milango from his friends.

Naftaly began the business from his savings. He is now applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to increase the till amount/float. The challenge comes from the competition; there are other shops dealing in the same business in the area.

Naftaly will purchase refreshments from the additional income since some customers request these during the transactions.

loans.use: To increase the till amount/float for his mobile money transfer business.

loans.name: Count You Blessing Group

texts.en: Akosua  is a 51-year-old woman. She is married with 3 children. She loves selling, the business through which she makes a living. She sells earrings and beads. She has been in the trade for the past 6 years. For lack of adequate working capital, she is not able to pick enough stock to make enough profit to support her family. With the loan, she wants to purchase earrings and beads in bulk to enable her to scale up her sales. She believes the loan would enable her to save more income to support her family. She is a member of the group called Count Your Blessing Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee for each other as a means of collateral.

loans.use: to purchase earrings and beads in bulk to enable her to scale up her sales

loans.name: Mizuka Youth Group

texts.en:
Mizuka Youth Group is composed of young people who are passionate about football. Upon winning numerous local trophies the youth decided to embark on economic activities that will make them self sufficient. As a result they started growing and selling vegetables, distributing water and movie screening.

Antony on the far left has a passion for football and he is married with one child. His desire is to see football players having decent living after their professional career is over and he believes that is possible through entrepreneurship. Last year, the group successfully completed a Junior Achievement entrepreneurship program where the program build their capability of growing and expanding their businesses. Upon graduation the group carried out market research and observed the demand for rabbit meat within their community.

Antony hopes to take a loan to start a rabbit rearing business which will supplement the group's vegetable and water business and will increase their realized income.

loans.use: The group will use the loan to purchase materials required to build a rabbit rearing unit and rabbits to establish the business.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a 53-year-old farmer with a family of seven. Like many families in Africa, he lacks electricity in his home. Since he joined Renewable Energy Ventures, he has loved the idea of selling solar lanterns to the farmers in his area. 

He took up this business quickly and stocked on a few units that sold fast. He restocked on more units that sold out even faster due to the rising demand. 

Thomas has a vision of lighting up the homes of his area and growing a sustainable solar business. He likes the fact that he no longer has to take his mobile phone to the local shopping center for charging but he can do it from his home. He hopes that his fellow farmers could enjoy the same service.

Thomas needs a loan of $700 to buy more lanterns to sell to the people in his area.

loans.use: to buy new solar lanterns to sell to his fellow farmers who have no electricity in their homes.

loans.name: Camilo De Jesus

texts.es:
Camilo es un veterano de mil batallas que lucha cada día contra la fuerte competencia del mercado en busca de realizar alguna venta para llegar con una sonrisa y un pan para la cena tiene una legumbrera donde vende verduras y frutas hay en una acera del mercado. 
Solicita un crédito para comprar mercancía como plátano, papa, zanahoria, cilantro, lulo, mora, fresas, cebolla, tomate etc. y cancelar un crédito anterior que le permitió salir de una crisis que casi arrasa con su negocio.

El crédito le permitirá seguir creciendo y mejorando sus ventas destacándose en el mercado y atraer clientes para seguir con su estilo de vida. 

Sueña con poder estar firme con su negocio y poder mantener su hogar y tener una vida digna y tranquila.
texts.en:
Camilo is a veteran of a thousand battles that he fights every day against the strong competition of the market in the quest to make a sale so he can arrive home with a smile and bread for dinner. He has a stall where he sells fruit and vegetables on a sidewalk in the market.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandise, such as plantains, potatoes, carrots, cilantro, naranjillas [solanum quitoense], blackberries, strawberries, onions, and tomatoes, and to pay off a previous loan that enabled him to get out of a crisis that almost levelled his business.

The loan will allow him to continue growing and improving his sales, distinguishing himself in the market, and attracting clients so he can continue with his style of living.

He dreams of being able to have a stable business and being able to maintain his household and have a decent and peaceful life.

loans.use: to buy plantains, potatoes, carrots, cilantro, naranjillas, blackberries, strawberries, onions, tomatoes, etc., and to pay off a previous loan that allowed him to get out of a crisis that almost destroyed his business

loans.name: Wangnina 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement WANGNINA 1 composé de dix huit personnes qui résident dans le même village. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupement sollicite pour la première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Pascaline (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 40 ans. Pascaline est mariée à un commerçant du nom de Bruno. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Pascaline vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour ce faire, Pascaline achète du vin de palme qu'elle transforme à son domicile depuis huit ans. Parallèlement, à cette activité, Pascaline  vend également du maïs, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Pascaline s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Pascaline sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupement WANGNINA 1, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter de vin de palme.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 48-year-old married woman, living in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband owns an retail business in which he offers different products to the buyers of different firms. He sells different types of products. Her husband wants to grow his business and wants to offer more products to the firms, but he does not have enough capital for investment. So Nasreen requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which is the field partner of Kiva. Through this loan her husband will buy more products to sell to the firms.

Nasreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell with private firm.

loans.name: Ayesha

texts.en:
Ayesha is a very hard working woman who sells shawl by clothing. She has been in business for ten years so she has many customers who request her shawl. She is 44 years old and lives with his life partner and six children. Her husband is a driver by profession, who is responsible for entire family. 

Ayesha wants to stock her business for the winter season in order to have enough variety to offer customers. Therefore she is requesting a loan through BRAC Pakistan to buy clothing, shawl to offer her customers.
 Ayesha and her family will be thankful to the KIVA’s lender and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy shaall for her shaall business

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: A 38 year old experienced business woman, Mrs. Mabel O. sells building materials to the public. She is married with four children and she hails from Benin City in the Edo State of Nigeria. A loan will help Mabel purchase more building supplies to satisfy the demand of her customers.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustie is 52 years old and married with 4 children who are all in school. She runs a small stationery supplies shop close to a cluster of schools in the metropolis. Items such as confectionary, packaged snacks, and water are also available in her shop. Schools are on holiday now but will be reopening in May for the final semester of the year.

Faustie would like to access the KIVA loan to purchase additional stocks for when schools come on stream in a month's time.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Rejena

texts.en:
Mrs. Rejena Nakarni, 31 years old, is a tailor in the town of  Kalanki.  She opened her tailoring shop 3 years ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses like the Kurta Sulwar which are very popular with Nepali women. Before starting her own business, Mrs Nalarmi took a 6 month training course in tailoring from a tailor shop near her locality.
She plans to use the loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring work. She wants to use the shop's income for self improvement and  for her daughter's education. In Nepal the cost of good education is increasing and Mrs. Narkami  is saving her income to provide a good education for her daughter.
Her husband's name is Sudip Singh N. and he is a high school and college teacher. She has one daughter, 3 years old in pre-nursery school .

loans.use: To buy raw material for her tailoring work

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Born in 1980, Violet B. is a widow with three children who are all in school. She suffers from ill health and emotional stress caused by the death of her husband that left her to singlehandedly take care of her three children. With all of these setbacks, she sought the help of GHAPE and was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline.

Given a loan of $100, she plans to invest in her seamstress job and to open a telephone booth so she can raise money to educate her children. She believes this business will make a profit because she has been trained as a seamstress and she is the only seamstress in her locality. Also, most people communicate now every day through the telephone. She plans to pay the loan in 15 months.

loans.use: Purchase sewing thread, cloth, school books, and pay school fees

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en: Dilbar is 42 years old, married and has three children. For the last 15 years, she has owned and operated an orchard in Yenikand village in the Salyan region. She has requested a loan of $1200  to buy pesticides.

loans.use: to buy pesticides

loans.name: Emi

texts.en: Emi has been working on a plantation for some time. The assistance from SPBD will be utilized to purchase tools for the plantation, as she is now looking into expanding her crops. She also hopes to be able to have more surplus supply for sale at the market, as this is good money that will help with the upkeep of the plantation business. She says she will continue to seek financial assistance from SPBD to help her with her plantation or in case she decides to expand the business into other areas in future.

loans.use: To buy tools for her plantation

loans.name: Onih

texts.en:
Onih is 52-year-old woman, married with three children. She has a small shop which sells snacks, food and drinks, and also household products. She can earn US$10 per day. Her husband, B., is managing duck livestock, and can earn US$45 per three months.

She requests a loan to add capital for both hers and her husband's businesses. Onih hopes that she can increase her income to provide her children's tuition. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Lami

texts.en: Lami, 27, sells rice at home to earn more income for the family. She earns $15 a day. Her husband, J., sells rice door-to-door in the nearby villages, and earns $20 a day. Lami is requesting a loan of $150 to expand her business. As a member of MBK she is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Loicith

texts.en:
Loicith V. R. runs an internet café and call center in the jungle city of Tarapoto, San Martin.  In her café she has 8 computers and 3 phone booths.   The majority of her clients are the neighborhood students doing research for their school projects, using instant messenger, or playing video games.  For this reason she also sells snack foods and sodas.   
Loicith is 31 years old, married, and has one small child.  She always dreamed of having her own business so she couldn’t be happier.  She is also proud that she will be able to give her son the opportunity to study whatever he wants and fulfill any dreams he may have.
A member of the community bank Nuestra Sra De La Paz, Loicith is requesting a loan of s/1000 to repay over six months.  With the loan she would like to buy cameras, and headphones for the computers and do some computer maintenance.

loans.use: With the loan she would like to buy cameras and headphones for the computers and do some computer maintenance

loans.name: Kun

texts.en:
Mrs. Kun A., 53, is a widow. She stays at home doing the house work while her two grown children go to work. Her son Mr. Kun Pong, 30, is a factory manager in Phnom Penh earning a salary $150 a month. Her daughter is a garment worker with a salary of $100 a month.

Mrs. Kun A. will use this loan to purchase a motorbike for her son. He currently has to commute to work on a motor-taxi, which costs him a lot. This motorbike will allow him save in the future.

(Mrs. Kun A. is pictured with her son.)

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
A. Veronica prepares food for sale. She is a single parent of 4 dependents. Business is good and her customer base is increasing.  She wants to increase production to meet the increasing demand.

She is asking for $525 as  additional capital to buy more food items for food production and sale.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more food items for food production and sale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace K. is married and has 2 children. She sells both alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages. Her husband also works selling shoes, but his income is not sufficient to meet the family’s financial needs. Business is doing very well but she wishes to increase sales to improve her income. She is running out of stock and is requesting a loan to increase her inventory of drinks.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory of beverages.

loans.name: Kieu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Khiếu Thị Chăm joins the TYM Fund in 2001. She has three grown up children. She used to invest the funds from her loans in raising livestock. This business did not bring good income so she switched to a cement mixing business. The new business utilizes labor of everyone in the family and collectively they increase the income substantially. Not only that, the concrete mixing business provides some work for people in her group too. The family’s average income is 3,000,000 VND. Currently the mixer needs maintenance. She is applying for a loan so she can fix the old mixer and also by an extra.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Khiếu Thị Chăm tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2001. Hiện nay gia đình chị có 3 con đã lớn. Trước đây chị vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi nhưng hiệu quả của công việc này mang lại lợi nhuận không cao vì thế gia đình chị đã mạnh dạn đầu tư vào việc mua máy trộn bê tông. Với việc đầu tư vào công việc mới này., thu nhập của anh chị đã tăng lên đáng kể.hàng ngày anh chị nhận trộn và đổ bê tông chi các công trình xây dựng trong vùng. Ngoài việc tạo công ăn việc làm cho các thành viên trong gia đìng, gia đình chị đã tạo thêm công ăn việc làm cho nhiều thành viên khác trong Cụm. Thu nhập bình quân mỗi tháng của gia đình đạt 3.000.000đ/ tháng. Hiện nay máy trộn bê tông của gia đình chị đã hư hỏng vì vậy chị muốn vay thêm vốn để đầu tư sửa chữa máy móc và mua thêm máy mới phục vụ cho công việc làm ăn của gia đình.

loans.use: Buy new concrete mixer

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Mrs. Phal Y. owns a small grocery store in Trapaing Taing Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is also a successful pig breeder who would like to expand her pig breeding business is doing well. Therefore she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding.

Mrs. Phal Y. is a 39-year-old widow with three children, all of whom are attending school. Previously, Mrs. Phal Y. obtained a loan from Acleda Bank to buy a cart whilch she has fully repaid.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy T., age 41, is married and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She works selling Khmer cakes and pumping air for motorbike tires. Her husband, Kim That, age 46, is a motor-taxi driver and is able to earn about $5 of profit a day. This couple together has six children, two of whom are married and no longer lives at home. One of their children is a construction worker who builds houses, and earns $2.50 per day.

Mrs. Thy T. would like to loan from Kiva via Credit, a local partner, to purchase a motorbike for her husband to earn extra profit. (Mrs. Thy and her husband are pictured together.)

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to earn extra profit.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice A. sells food items like gari, cassava, and plantains at Duakor, which is a small town near Elmina. Alice has received no formal education. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a teacher. Alice has been selling food items since 1999. She is responsible for helping in the payment of the children's school fees and other utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more food items for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to add to her capital to increase sales, which will as a result in her meeting the financial needs of the family.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more food items to sell

loans.name: Vann

texts.en:
Vann K., 48 years old, is married and lives with her husband and ten children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She is a farmer but her farming is just to support her family members. Previously, she said she could sell some rice but currently, she cannot because of inflation and bad weather conditions. She said the rice and fertilizers prices have doubled in the past year; this means that she needs to pay double the prices for fertilizers for her rice field but still gets the same amount as before. 

She grows rice two times a year. First, during the dry season, harvesting the rice takes about 3-4 months. During the rainy season, harvesting takes about 6-7 months. Rich people prefer rice that grows during the rainy season because it tastes more flavorful.

She still received support from three of her children, two of whom are garment workers and one is a sand pump worker. Her husband is a worker and makes around US$4 each day. Vann K. would like to take out a loan of US$300 to purchase good bean seeds to grow. This will help increase the family profit.

loans.use: To purchase seeds for rice harvesting business.

loans.name: Rahma

texts.en:
Jambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 26-year-old Rahma B. from Dar es Salaam. She is single with 1 dependent, Salma, who is 8 years old and was an orphan. Rahma has been running 2 businesses, a charcoal business and a cloth shop, since March 2008.

At her mkaa (charcoal) business, she sells charcoal, which are small, black pieces of dry earth that are used by many Tanzanians as a fuel to cook their daily meals. Women cook food in small coal pots, in which they arrange charcoal, and add either paper, dry grass, old plastic bags, or kerosene in order to light them. Because there is such a high demand for charcoal across the country, being a charcoal seller is quite lucrative!

In addition, she has established a shop that sells traditional clothing worn by Tanzanian women, called kanga and vitenge. The kanga is a piece of printed cotton fabric often with a border along all 4 sides. It is printed using the silkscreen method with its pattern in frames. Kitenge (the Swahili plural is vitenge) is a cotton fabric with wax print, printed by using rotary printing machines. Kitenge is a communicating textile--the various colors, patterns, writings, and symbols represent moods, feelings, cultures, and traditions of native African people.

She splits her time between both business working 1-4 hours a day, 7 days a week at each business. She is requesting a loan of $250 in order to purchase additional inventory in bulk. Rahma thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: To purchase inventory in bulk

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a successful businesswoman who believes that hard work is the key to success. She makes a living selling provisions in her shop located along Kasidi Road in Okoko, Lagos. Beatrice is 47 years old and has three children. She has borrowed from LAPO Microfinance for the past three years and has also led a loan group. She has always made her payments on time. Beatrice needs a loan to buy more provisions to sell. She is very grateful to LAPO Microfinance and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell to her customers

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
La señora Concepción es socia del Banco Comunal “Dante Nava” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 31 años de edad, es soltera y madre de 3 hijos. 
Con su primer préstamo de S/. 300 compró lana para confeccionar prendas de vestir. Tiene casi 4 años trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que con el negocio de los combustibles, al que ahora se dedica, ha aumentado su capital y sus ganancias. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará combustibles y artículos de ferretería para venderlos en su puesto. 
Agustina desea continuar trabajando para construir su casa propia y tener un local donde vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Concepcion is an associate of the Communal Bank "Dante Nava," of the district, province and state of Puno. She is 31 years old, single and a mother of three. With her first loan of 300 soles, she bought wool to make clothing. She has been working with the community bank for almost 4 years and tells us that with her current business of selling fuel, she has increased her earnings. With this loan of 1,000 soles, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy fuel and pieces of iron to sell at her shop. She would like to keep working to build her own home and to have a place to sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fuel and hardware

loans.name: Zafarali

texts.ru: Мирзоев Зафарали проживает в районе Рудаки. Работает строителем , а так же торговлей овощами и фруктами. Рано утром скупает товар у оптовых реализатором и там же продает розничным торговцам. Занимается этим бизнесом уже три года. Кредит хочет использовать для закупки саженцев для дальнейшей перепродажи. Зафар женат и имеет пятерых детей. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Zafarali M. resides in Rudaki district. He works in construction, and in addition sells fruit and vegetables. For the past three years he has purchased his wares from wholesalers early in the morning and resold them to retailers. He wants to use the loan to purchase seedlings for further resale. Zafarali is married and has five children. He will be able to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase turnover

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
La señora Rosalía es socia del Banco Comunal “Ciudad Blanca” centro poblado de Chijichaya, distrito de Ilave, Provincia Del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 29 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 01 hijos a su cargo y posee estudios de secundaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 03 meses, posee un negocio de compra y venta de productos de la región (papa, chuño, cebada, quinua, etc.); su primer préstamo fue de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir mas  mercadería  de la zona los que lo vende en las ferias de Puno y Arequipa. 
Con este préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 3 cuotas mensuales; podrá mantener su mercadería adquiriendo mas papas, chuño, cebada, maíz, habas, etc. Para poder venderlo en las ferias de Puno y Arequipa; uno de sus anhelos es convertirse en mayorista y llevar sus productos a los mercados mayoristas de Lima; asimismo ella desea comprarse una casa en Arequipa para su familia, por ello viene ahorrando con gran esmero.
texts.en:
Rosalía is a member of the community bank “Ciudad Blanca” located in the Collao province in Puno. She is 29 years old, married with one child, and has completed her secondary education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos (a Kiva partner) for 3 months. She buys and sells products local to the region (potatoes, barley, quinoa, etc.). Her first loan was for 500 Peruvian Soles, with which she bought more merchandise from the fairs in Puno and Arequipa. With this new loan of 500 Peruvian Soles, which she hopes to repay in 3 monthly installments, she will maintain her inventory, purchasing more potatoes, dried potatoes, barley, corn, beans, etc. and will sell them in the fairs at Puno and Arequipa.

One of her goals is to become a wholesaler and to bring to her products to the wholesale markets in Lima. She also would like to buy a home in Arequipa for her family, and for this goal she is carefully saving her money.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of additional inventory to sell in the fairs in Puno and Arequipa

loans.name: Amana

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 54-year-old Amana J. from Mwanza. She is married and has four children between the ages of 27 and 35. Amana has been running a pharmacy shop since 2005. Her business sells a variety of medicines like Panadol, amoxyline, Diclopar, diclofenac, tetracycline, and anti-malarial medications. She works at her business eight hours a day, six days per week, and is assisted by one employee. Amana currently earns about $300 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to buy more medicines. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Amana thanks you for your support!

About SELFINA

SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets: thus, they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thereby enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy medicines for a pharmacy business.

loans.name: Emelina Nancy,

texts.es:
Desde hace siete años que Nancy maneja una bodega de abarrotes. A sus treinta y nueve años la mayor parte de su vida se ha dedicado a su casa y la crianza de sus tres hijos, de diecisiete, catorce y nueve años.

No obstante, una vez que compró un terreno junto con su esposo empezó a construir su casa. Ya construida la casa se animó a abrir una tienda para poder ayudar en la economía de su casa, además fue lo primero que se le ocurrió ya que no había ninguna tienda cerca de su casa debido a que el lugar recién se estaba formando como urbanización 

Su esposo, así como ella se animó también a tener un negocio propio y ser independiente. El anteriormente se dedicaba a trabajar en un grifo. Hace tres años que entre los dos compraron un mototaxi que ahora él maneja y trabaja dentro una compañía de transporte público. 

En el futuro, Nancy solo ve progreso. Por ahora lo que más anhela es poder terminar de construir su casa material noble, lo que le permitirá ampliar su tienda para una mejor atención de sus clientes.
texts.en:
For the past seven years Nancy has worked in a grocery store. At 39, she has spent the majority of her life dedicated to her home and to caring for her three children, who are 16, 14 and 9 years old. However, once her and her husband bought a piece of land and built their home, she was inspired to open a store. The store would help with her family’s expenses and it was the first store to open near their home, since the area they live in was still being developed into an urban neighborhood. Her husband, who used to work in a gas station, also became inspired to own their own business and work independently. Three years ago they bought a mototaxi and now he works for a public transportation company as a driver. In the future, Nancy only sees progress. For now her biggest desire is to finish building their home with durable materials, which will allow her to expand her store and offer better customer service.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: stock for grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make and sell peanuts

loans.name: Gantumur

texts.en:
Gantumur J. has been selling meat for the last eight years, purchasing animals including sheep, cattle, and camels from local herders in the country and then slaughtering them in the city at the butcher shop. Gantumur rents a butcher stall at the local market where she sells well-cut meat in small pieces and hopes to one day own her own shop instead of paying high rent. She has also been working hard to buy her own plot of land to live on with her big family. Gantumur will use this loan to purchase more animals, specifically sheep and cattle.

Gantumur lives with her husband and four teenage children in rental housing in Ovorhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. All her children are high school students, while her husband Battogtoh works as a watchman for a private company.

loans.use: To purchase more animals, specifically sheep and cattle.

loans.name: Sandra Silvia

texts.es:
La señora Sandra M. S., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cruz de Motupe II”, vive en la esquina del Jr. Los Trigales y Jr. Acacia S/N en un mindepartamento alquilado. Es conviviente, tiene 31 años y es madre de 01 niño que depende todavía de ella; su pareja se dedica a la venta de productos de ferretería.
Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 compró cosméticos de Unique y Esita los que se encargó de ofrecerlos en venta a sus amistades.
Hoy se siente muy apoyada por el Movimiento Manuela Ramos y su Banco Comunal por haberle apoyado y confiando en ella a pesar de no ser del lugar, ya que manifiesta ser de Lima pero que tiene 07 años viviendo en Huaraz y esto porque ha identificado que tiene mejor mercado en esta ciudad y todo el Callejón de Huaylas. Con este préstamo de S/.  500.00 comprará cubrecamas ya que tiene pedidos de sus clientes y amistades. 
Hoy se siente comprometida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos y su Banco Comunal por haberle apoyado económicamente y darle la oportunidad de pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sandra M. S. is a member of the Cruz de Motupe II Village Bank. She lives in an unnumbered house on the corner of Los Trigales Street and Acacia Street in a small, rented apartment. She is 31 years old and lives with her partner and their son, who is still a dependent. Her partner sells hardware items. With her first loan of 300 soles, Sandra bought Unique and Esita brand cosmetics, which she sold to her friends. Today, she feels very much supported by the Manuela Ramos Movement for having placed its trust in her even though she isn't originally from the area (she is from Lima, but has been living in Huaraz for the past seven years since she decided that Huaraz and the Callejon de Huaylas Valley have a superior market). With this loan of 500 soles, Sandra will buy bedspreads to fill orders that have already been placed by her clients and friends. She is committed to the Manuela Ramos Movement and to her village bank because they have supported her financially and have given her the opportunity to belong to a group of women.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bedspreads

loans.name: Rafiqa

texts.en: Rafiqa M. is a married mother of three children. Her husband works as a farmer, and she has been helping him for the last 18 years. Rafiqa has a small piece of land upon which she cultivates wheat and corn. Her business has helped give her children an education, and she wishes to continue working so she can take care of them while they live with her. Rafiqa is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase seeds and fertilizer. Rafiqa and her family thank you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Huruma Group

texts.en:
Abeid Y., age 45, is married with three children ages 12, 3 and 6 years. He has had a tailoring business since 1990. He works daily from 7 am to 8 pm. He is able to earn a monthly profit of about $301.

This will be Abeid’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He wants a loan to buy more materials for his tailoring business.  

Abeid will share this loan with his group, Huruma, which totals 22 members. These members will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Abeid is second from left, front row.

loans.use: To buy more materials for making clothing.

loans.name: Trần Thị

texts.en:
Vỵ Trần Thị (1808081193) is a 37-year-old woman living in the town of Đô Lương. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Vỵ owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling river-caught fish in the local community. Vỵ has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, Vỵ joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vỵ has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Vỵ is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Vỵ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business

loans.use: invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mariam Carmita

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Campesinas de Ruizho esta ubicado en el sector de Ruizho, perteneciente a la comunidad de San Bartola  de Sigsig, se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Cuenca, su terreno es en su mayor parte accidentado.
Las principales producciones de la región son: maíz, fréjol, cebada, trigo, habas, arveja, patatas. En la parte baja se produce caña de azúcar y variedad de árboles frutales.
La parroquia se encuentra atravesada de norte a sur con yacimientos mineros de plata y hierro, existiendo también en la región sur criaderos de cal.
La principal industria es la agricultura, si bien muchos se dedican a la manufactura del tejido de sombreros de paja toquilla.
Este banco Comunal esta conformado por personas muy colaboradoras, organizadas y puntuales, el desarrollo de sus labores en el campo es la base fundamental para el compañerismo ya que cuando alguien necesita ayuda realizan mingas comunales, así también cuando hay festejos asisten todos.

Mariam tiene 24 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos de 7,5 y 3 años, los dos primeros estudian en la escuela de Ruizho, vive en la casa de los papas, es soltera, es socia del Banquito ya mucho tiempo, este es el cuarto crédito que realiza, se dedica desde muy pequeña a la crianza de pollos, este es un negocio familiar ya que toda su familia trabaja en ello, el crédito que hoy solicita es para invertir en pollos y alimentación, cuenta que esta por adquirir tres cajas de pollos, estos vienen 100 por cada caja, son de un día de nacidos y cuesta 84 dólares por caja, el tiempo de crianza y engorde es de 8 semanas, salen de 6 libras aproximadamente, tiene un puesto den las ferias del CREA y Paraíso, vende pollo enteros y por libras, vende a 1.25 dólares la libra y si se trata de otro tipo de pollo(cubano amarillo) cuesta 1.50 dólares la libra, la meta que tiene en su vida es poder hacerse su propia casa para independizarse y poder hacer su propio negocio, ya que en este que hoy tiene le toca aporta por igual a todos.
texts.en:
The cooperative bank “Campesinas de Ruizho” is located in the Ruizho sector, which belongs to the San Bartola of Sigsig community. This area is located an hour from the city of Cuenca, and the land is environmentally sensitive. The primary crops of the region are: corn, beans, barley, wheat, peas, and potatoes. In the lower sections, sugar cane and fruit trees are grown. The town is surrounded by silver and iron mines to the north and south, and in the south there are also lime pits. Agriculture is the primary industry, and many also dedicate themselves to producing hand-made straw hats. This cooperative bank is comprised of people that are very collaborative, organized, and punctual. Carrying out farming tasks is the fundamental base for their companionship, and when anyone needs assistance they all come together as a group to help. They also work together during festivals. Mariam is 24 years old, and has 3 children ages 7, 5 and 3. The two oldest study at the school in Ruizho. She lives in her parents’ home, is single, and has been a member of the bank for a long time. This is her fourth loan, and she has dedicated herself since a young girl to raising chickens. This is a familiar arena for her, given that her whole family is in the same business. The loan she is requesting today is to invest in chickens and feed. She tells us that she wants to acquire three boxes of chickens, which each have 100 chickens in them. They are one day old and cost $84 USD per box. The time to raise and fatten them is 8 weeks, until they reach about 6 pounds approximately. She has a stall at the markets of CREA and Paradise, where she sells her chickens whole and by the pound. She sells them for $1.25 USD per pound, and if it’s a different type of chicken (yellow Cuban) they cost $1.50 USD per pound. Her life’s goal is to have her own home and live independently, and to continue managing her own business given that, these days, everyone must contribute equally.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chickens and feed for them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more maize in bulk for reselling

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To invest in his business

loans.name: Kargbo United Group

texts.en:
Here are Memuna C., Emmanuel G. and Mariatu J.. They are members of the Kargbo United group. This will be the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. They have been in business for many years now but business has been developing at a very slow pace. They have thus come to SMT/Kiva to seek a loan of Le 500,000 for each to help them improve their businesses. 

Memuna C. (left) is the leader of this group. Memuna was born in Magburaka town, twenty-eight years ago. She is married with two children who are attending schools. Memuna has been a businesswoman for five years now. She sells ground-nut (peanuts) and palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil). She will invest this loan into her business, makes more profit and improves her standard of living.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthy Y., (age 46) and her husband, Mr. Sros Soeung, (age 48), live in a Phnom Penh suburb and have 4 children: 2 sons and 2 daughters. One of them was married and lives outside the family home, one is a garment factory worker and other two assist their parents in farming. 

Chanthy sells dessert at her house in the village. Besides of the business, she also helps her husband in watermelon farm. By the way, Chanthy doesn’t have her own transportation and she spends a lot of money for traveling costs very often which are expensive for the family. Therefore, she is requesting her second loan in the amount of US$ 400 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan T. is from the village of Iligan City. She is 41 years old. Susan is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Susan owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Susan has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Susan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susan is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Susan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Kouma

texts.fr:
Kouma N. est un homme marié et père de 4 enfants. Il habite à Lomé, la capitale du Togo, une ville située à 120  kilomètres de Kpalimé. C’est un mécanicien  auto et avec ce prêt de Kiva, il voudrait acheter des pièces de rechanges afin de pouvoir réparer les voitures qui sont tombés en panne. Et aussi il voudrait renouveler certains de ses outils de travail qui ne sont plus en bonne état. Avec  les bénéfices obtenus de son travail, il voudrait économiser de l’argent en vue de mieux s’occuper de sa famille. 

FECECAV est une union de caisse créée en 1995 et agréée en 1997. Elle couvre la région des plateaux et maritime. Sa mission est de satisfaire les besoins financiers des populations de la région exclues du système financier classique. Elle compte aujourd hui plus de 50000 membres et entend étendre ses activités dans les autres localités environnantes de la région. FECECAV est à but non lucratif.
texts.en:
Kouma N. is a married man and the father of four children.  He lives in Lomé (capital of Togo), a city located 120 km from Kpalimé.  He is an automobile mechanic.  With this Kiva loan, he would like to buy replacement parts in order to repair cars that have broken down.  And also, he would like to refurbish some of his work tools, which are no longer in good shape.  With the profits obtained from his work, he would like to save some money with the aim of taking better care of his family. FECECAV is a savings union created in 1995 and approved in 1997.  It covers the region of Plateaux and Maritime.  Its mission is to meet the financial needs of the people in the region who are excluded from the standard financial system.  Today, FECECAV has over 50,000 members and plans on extending its activities to surrounding towns in the region.  FECECAV is a not-for-profit organization.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tools for the mechanics trade

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda S. is from the village of Misom, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Luzminda is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Luzminda owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling farm-raised fish in the local community. Luzminda has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Luzminda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzminda is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional materials like nets and food for the raised fish. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Luzminda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for the business like nets and food for the raised fish.

loans.name: Semira

texts.en: Semira Y. is currently in the business of selling cooked food in a restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock soft drinks like sodas, water, packed juice, etc., to sell. Semira is 30 years old and is married to a peasant farmer. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a wholesale shop. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock soft drinks like sodas, water, packed juice, etc.

loans.name: Meziel

texts.en:
Meziel P. is from the village of Baliwagan, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 22 years old. Meziel is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Meziel owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Meziel has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Meziel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Meziel is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Meziel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 44 years old and the mother of five children. Three of her children are already in the university while the other two children are seeking admission into the higher institution. Her husband is a manager in a hotel in Benin City.

Josephine owns a restaurant where she sells mouth watering cooked foods and drinks. She hopes to expand her business and make more profits in order to support her husband in educating their children through university.

Josephine is requesting a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and  foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Virginie

texts.fr: Née en 1954 à Kandi au Nord du Bénin, S. Virginie est mariée à KIKI Henri un gendarme à la retraite. Le couple a trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Virginie vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari à Djèrègbé Gbokpa sur la route de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Virginie vient en aide à son mari en ce qui concerne les charges de la famille. Virginie a arrêté les classes au cours secondaire. Depuis près de 20 ans, Virginie mène comme activité, la vente de produits divers (savons, farine de manioc, piles, sucres, galettes d'arachide, bombons, etc.) à son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité, Virginie vend également de l'huile d'arachide, ce qui lui permet d'avoir une autre source de revenus. C'est la première fois que Virginie sollicite de crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit lui permettra d'agrandir son activité et d'augmenter sa clientèle et donc son chiffre d'affaire.
texts.en:
Born in 1954 in Kandi (North of Benin), Virginie S. is married to Henri KIKI, a retired policeman. The couple have three children, who are all in school. Virginie lives with her husband and children in Djèrègbé Gbokpa on the road to Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She assists her husband regarding household expenses, and interrupted her schooling at secondary level. For the past 20 years, Virginie has been selling a variety of products from her home (soap, cassava flour, batteries, sugar, peanut wafers, sweets, etc.). Additionally, she retails peanut oil, which gives her another source of income. This is the first time Virginie has requested a loan from ALIDé. It will allow her to expand her activities, increase her customer base, and consequently her turnover.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy peanut wafers, sugar, soap, cassava flour, and peanut oil

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is a 28-year-old engaged man who lives with his parents and 2 siblings. His father has owned a seafood restaurant since 1985. Since 2005, Anthony has been handling the restaurant operation to help his father. His restaurant specializes by offering only seafood. It's located in a beautiful area overlooking the sea. His restaurant is really known for its delicious food and the beautiful view. 

Today, Antony is requesting a loan of $800 to buy music equipment, because he's planning to add entertainment to his restaurant for a good atmosphere.

loans.use: To buy music equipment

loans.name: Eucalda

texts.es:
Eucalda, de 35 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Arturo (34), quien es agricultor, y de sus 3 hijos de 13, 11 y 7 años.

Desde que era muy pequeña aprendió, como jugando, todo lo que era necesario para la correcta producción agrícola. De esa manera, cuando se unió a su esposo no dudó en seguir trabajando la tierra junto a él y empezaron con la siembra de maíz. Tiempo después notaron que las ganancias por la venta de este producto les permitían sustentar muy bien a su familia, además de darles educación a sus hijas que era lo que más les interesaba. Ha pasado el tiempo y continúan  sembrando maíz y paralelamente se dedica a la crianza de ganado porcino para luego comercializarlos en las ferias de la zona donde vive. Esta actividad le da buenas ganancias, que junto a la agricultura le permite ofrecer una buena calidad de vida a su familia. Y como es una mujer muy emprendedora, para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar alverja, ya que sabe que el precio de este producto está muy alto en el mercado.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas las personas que hacen posible que pueda recibir el crédito que le permitirá seguir trabajando por su progreso. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de semilla de alverja y varios sacos de fertilizantes para sus asegurar sus campos de cultivo y tener una buena producción.
texts.en:
Eucalda is 35 years old and lives in her own home with her husband, Arturo (34) who is a farmer, and with their three children, ages 13, 11, and 7. When she was little she, as a game, she learned everything necessary for proper farming. When she married her husband, she had no doubt that she would continue working the land and they started planting corn together. They eventually saw the income from the sale of their product allowed them to support their family very well, including paying for an education for their daughters, which is what they were most interested in. As time passed, they continued to cultivate corn and also began raising hogs to sell in the fairs in the zone where they live. This also provides a good income and, along with the income from farming, they are able to provide a good life for their family. Because she is an enterprising woman, she plans to grow peas in the future, now that she knows that the price for this product in the marketplace is high. This will be her first loan through MFP and she is very grateful to all the people who make this loan possible, allowing her to continue to work and progress. She will use the money from this loan to buy pea seed and various sacs of fertilizer to help ensure that the land produces a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José Antonio tiene 18 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a tres de sus hermanos en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el sector La Zaranda, una zona rural del distrito de Pítipo, provincia de Ferreñafe, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace un año se dedica a la comercialización de ganado caprino, el cría cabras en la parte posterior de su domicilio y durante el día las suelta para que coman algarroba (fruta del arbol del algarrobo, común en la zona) en los bosques secos que rodean el lugar. El comercializa sus animales con los negociantes que suelen visitar el lugar y los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le sirven para solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar a los gastos de educación de sus hermanos.

José Antonio desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de animales para criarlos, alimentarlos y posteriormente venderlos a un buen precio, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro de su objetivo.

José Antonio es un joven bastante responsable y que trata de salir adelante, siempre velando por los suyos. Su mayor anhelo es llegar a ser un ganadero próspero y conocido en la zona donde vive.
texts.en:
José Antonio is 18 years old. He is single and lives with his three siblings in his parents' home. Their home is located in the La Zaranda neighborhood which is a rural zone in the Pitio district in the Ferreñafe province, located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For a year, José Antonio has dedicated himself to selling goats. He raises the small goats in the back of his home and during the day he lets them loose so that they can eat carob (carob trees are common in the area) in the dry forest that surround the area. He sells his animals to the merchants that visit the area. He uses his earnings from this business to pay for his personal expenses and to support his siblings' educational expenses. José Antonio wants to expand his business by buying more animals to raise, feed and subsequently sell at a good price this is why he is requesting for the first time a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 nuevos soles (PEN) which he will use to meet his goal. José Antonio is a very responsible young man that tries to get ahead and is always looking out for his own. His greatest hope is to become a prosperous and well known farmer in the area where he lives.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animals to raise and sell.

loans.name: Bertilda Isabel

texts.es:
Bertilda Isabel A. Gutiérrez tiene 46 años y vive en Barranquilla en El Pueblo, barrio popular, alegre y rumbero en el sur occidente de la ciudad y tristemente conocido por inundaciones en tiempos de lluvia. Está casada con tres hijos de los cuales los menores son un hijo de 17 años de edad y una hija de 8. Bertilda se dedica a la elaboración de pasabocas como deditos y empanaditas; los deditos más grandes los vende en tiendas y los más pequeños se los encarga a la gente para fiestas y otros eventos. Ahora solicita un crédito por valor de $ 1.800.000, para comprar materias primas e  insumos como harina de trigo, aceite, azucar y queso, con los que espera ampliar su negocio y buscar más tiendas y colegios para distribuir sus productos.
Bertilda inició el negocio hace 8 años cuando se mudó de la casa de su suegra en otro barrio y se instaló en El Pueblo. Aprendió de su mamá, “mujer que “sabe hacer todo” y se lo enseñó a sus hijos, y cuando tuvo que apoyar a su esposo, recurrió a la elaboración de pasabocas. Su esposo distribuye a domicilio y a veces la ayuda a llevar los productos donde los clientes de ella. Está vinculada a la Fundación  hace alrededor de 4 años y manifiesta que económicamente está mejor porque ha ido adecuando su casa: arregló la cocina poniendo baldosas en el piso y considera esto muy influyente en el negocio, pues es más higiénico y  atrae a más clientes. Dice que su mayor desafío es la falta de capital y se acuerda que en algún momento tuvo la oportunidad de vender sus productos a casinos, pero no tenía capital en ese entonces y no pudo. A pesar de las bajas ventas en esta temporada, sabe que todo se incrementa más a partir de los siguientes meses. Quiere conseguir más clientes para salir adelante y realizar el sueño  de ayudar a  sus hijos a que sean profesionales para que vivan mejor.
texts.en:
Bertilda Isabel A. Gutiérrez, 46, lives in Barranquilla’s El Pueblo neighborhood, a popular, cheerful, high-spirited neighborhood in the southwestern part of the city which, sadly, is infamous due to flooding during the rainy season. She is married and has three children, the youngest of whom are a 17-year-old son and an 8-year-old daughter. Bertilda makes snacks like deditos (little finger-shaped pastries) and turnovers. She sells the larger deditos in stores and the smaller ones are ordered by people for parties and other special events. She is asking for a $1.800.000 loan to buy ingredients like wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and cheese so that she can increase production and add more stores and schools to her distribution points list. Bertilda started her business 8 years ago when she moved from her mother-in-law’s house to a different neighborhood, El Pueblo. She learned from her mother, “a woman who knows how to do everything,” and passed it on to her children. When the need arose to help her husband with household expenses, she turned to the manufacture of snacks. Her husband delivers door-to-door and sometimes helps her take the product to her customers. She has been associated with the Fundación for about 4 years and she states that she is better off financially because she’s been able to improve her house: she tiled the kitchen floor and considers this to be very important to her business because it’s more hygienic and attracts more customers. She says that her greatest challenge is the lack of capital and remembers that there was a time when she had the opportunity to sell her products to casinos but lack of capital then kept her from doing so. Despite drop in sales during this season, she knows that everything will improve the next few months. She wants to attract more customers in order to progress and reach her goal of helping her children become professionals so that they can live better.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and cheese.

loans.name: Nohora Elizabeth

texts.es:
Nohora Bohórquez, su esposo y sus dos hijos de 5 y 7 años de edad viven en el barrio Perseverancia de Cundinamarca, donde montaron   una pizzería y ambos trabajan en ella, la iniciaron hace 5 años con los ahorros que habían reunido  y con enseres de la familia, como licuadora, nevera, mesa y el apoyo de algunos vecinos que le facilitaron un local al comienzo. Entre Nohora y su esposo lograron que su negocio se diera a conocer con los vecinos por la gran variedad y las formas diferentes de presentación de sus pizzas, y por la manera familiar y respetuosa con que siempre han tratado a sus clientes. Nohora dice que en su negocio “Pizzería Piazalla”, aunque ofrecen un producto conocido como comida rápida, ellos no lo consideran así, pues cada pizza es única y la preparan de acuerdo a lo solicitado por el cliente  y  siempre las venden muy frescas; Nohora  también considera que aunque su   pizzería está ubicada en un barrio pobre, ellos ofrecen calidad en sus productos como las grandes empresas y esto es precisamente parte del éxito que ella y su esposo han tenido.  
Este es su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y Nohora solicita    un monto por valor de $2.300.000, para comprar materia prima como harina de trigo, azúcar, refrescos  y también  invertirá en una gran promoción publicitaria para incrementar su mercado, ya que en la actualidad se mudaron de donde se inició su negocio y ahora adecuaron un local frente a la casa de sus suegros, en el que se demoraron casi 2 meses e invirtieron todos sus ahorros. Ahora necesitan iniciar nuevamente porque se desconectaron de sus clientes; este es su gran desafío pero llegaron con nuevos productos y extendiendo su horario de atención para lograr nuevamente su reconocimiento. Su sueño y el de su esposo es establecer una buena base financiera  para asegurar la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nohora, her husband, and her two children, ages five and seven live in the Perseverancia neighborhood of Cundinamarca, where they started a pizzeria. Both work there. They started it five years ago with their savings and with family assets, such as a blender, an ice machine, a table and the support of some of their neighbors who helped them get into a location. Nohora and her husband were able to make their business well known with their neighbors for the great variety and different methods of presentation for their pizzas and for the friendly way that they serve their customers. Nohora says that her business, “Pizzería Piazalla” may be thought of as a fast food restaurant, but they don’t consider it as such. Each pizza is unique and prepared to order, and always fresh. Nohora also realizes that her pizzeria is located in a poor neighborhood, so they offer quality, much like the larger establishments. This has been part of their success. This will be their first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y Nohora and they are requesting a loan for 2,300,000 COP ($1,200) in order to buy ingredients such as wheat, sugar, and soft drinks. They will also invest in an advertising campaign to increase their market share, now that they have moved from their original location and have acquired a location across from the home of their in-laws. They invested two months and all of their savings in preparing the location. Now they must begin again because they have gotten disconnected from their customers. This is a setback, but they have new products and have extended their business hours in order to become well know once more. Their dream is to establish a solid economic base so that they can secure a good education for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients and advertising

loans.name: Hani

texts.en:
Hani A. G. is a father of three beautiful sons and daughters, Suhaib, Malak, and Habiba, who are five, four, and three years old, respectively. Hani is an employee of the Palestinian National Authority and a taxi driver after work hours. Hani drives people inside the city of Deer Al-Balah and between the cities of the Gaza Strip.

Hani lives in the An-Nusairat Refugee Camp in Deer el Balah City. Hani took a $2000 loan from FATEN to repair his car, which is shown in the picture. He has been using the car for taxi duty for 1-1/2 years. It makes a very good second income source due to the low salaries of Palestinian National Authority employees.

loans.use: Car Repair

loans.name: Carmen Cecilia

texts.es:
Carmen tiene una venta de arroz, jugos, gaseosas, golosinos, etc.  Ella inicio en el negocio cuando el salario de su marido no le ajustaba parra los gastos de la casa.  Fue entonces que tuvo que poner el negocio.

Carmen ha recibido préstamos en el pasado.  Estos préstamos le han ayudado a mantener su negocio, sus clientes, y al fin, estabilidad económica.

Carmen tiene 45 años de edad y vive en Leon.  Ella tiene 2 hijos que están estudiando en la universidad.
texts.en:
Because her husband's salary was insufficient to cover household expenses, Carmen needed to set up a business of her own. She sells rice, juices, soft-drinks, sweets, etc. Carmen has gotten loans previously that have helped her keep her business afloat, retain her customers and maintain economic stability. Carmen is 45 years old and lives in Leon. She has two children who are university students.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft-drinks, juices, sweets, rice, cooking oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es: Maximiliana tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos en su haber. Juntos residen en la hermosa selva tropical peruana, ubicada en la comunidad de Sirenachayocc, donde tienen su techo propio a base de madera. Para su familia, su fuente principal era la actividad agrícola, pero debido a los cierres constantes de carreteras no pudieron vender ninguno de sus productos, de esa manera perdieron lo que habían invertido. En entonces Maximiliana tenía 9 años, pero ante los problemas y las crisis económicas que afrontó a lado de su familia, la forjo como una mujer de carácter. Ahora se dedica a producir y vender cacao en los centros de acopio de su comunidad, además la experiencia y conocimientos que tiene se lo transmite a sus hijos, sobre el manejo adecuado de sus productos agrícolas, con la seguridad de que mas delante ellos asuman de la mejor  manera el legado de sus padres. Sabe que su producto le esta brindando buenas ganancias económicas es por ello que en el futuro anhela ampliar sus plantaciones de cacao y construir su casa a base de material noble, con la finalidad de mejorar  la calidad de vida de su familia. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus respectivos pagos, además se siente bien en compañía de su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita lo invertirá en darle un mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de cacao, adquiriendo insumos y abono, con la finalidad de mejorar la calidad y cantidad de dicho producto.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is 38 years old, married with two children at home. They live together in the beautiful Peruvian tropical rainforest, located in the community of Sirenachayocc, where they have their own house, which is made of wood. Growing up, the main source of income for her family was farming, but due to constant road closures they could not sell any of their products. So, unfortunately, they lost what they had invested. Maximiliana was 9 years old then, but enduring the problems and economic crises that she faced alongside her family shaped her into a woman of character. Now she produces cocoa and sells it at the collection and distribution centers in her community. In addition, Maximiliana has a great deal of experience in the proper management of farm products. She is passing on her knowledge to her children with the assurance that they will later assume their parents’ legacy in the proper way. She knows that the sales of her product provide her with good income which is why she hopes to expand her cocoa plantations in the future, and build a more substantial house in order to improve the quality of life for her family. This is her second loan with MFP, which is why she is committed to continue meeting her respective payments. In addition, she feels good about being a member of her communal group. With the loan she is requesting, she will invest in proper maintenance of her cocoa plantations, and purchase supplies and fertilizer, in order to improve the quality and quantity of this product.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of supplies and fertilizer for her cocoa plantations.

loans.name: Mrs. Pha Ngan Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of nineteen people who live in Ta Ei village in Takeo province. All the members have been selected and Mrs. Pha N. is a village bank president.  The loan members will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes, to improve their businesses in the future.

Mrs. Pha N. is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Sor Miech, is a farmer who owns a 1.5 hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell and support his family.  He is a fisherman, too. Her problem is that her pigs are too small to sell. So to improve this condition, Mrs. Pha N. is applying for a loan to buy pig food.  WI. the rest of the loan, she will fix her husband’s fishing boat and buy a stream to finding fishes. She is the mother of two children.  One is a tailor, and the other is attending local public school.

All the members are shown in the photo but one of them is blocked.

loans.use: To buy pig food

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina B. is from the village of Lagag, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 43 years old, married and has one child who is in school. Divina owns and operates a general store.
