The main source of income for the business comes from selling food in the local community. Divina has been engaged in her business for five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2008, Divina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Divina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Divina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Divina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy products

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca tiene 54 años, vive con su esposo y el último D. sus hijos. DesD. hace 6 años decidió explotar al máximo los recursos que tiene en sus terrenos, que son hechos D. arcilla, esto le facilitó mucho para la producción D. ladrillos, desD. entonces produce en masa, además tuvo la necesidad D. contratar mano D. mano D. obra, en especial D. personas expertas para el proceso D. fabricación. En cuanto a la comercialización ella personalmente se encarga D. esa actividad, ofreciéndolo a varios puntos D. la ciudad. Al mes venD. un promedio D. 20 millares D. ladrillos que le sirve para solventar los gastos familiares. Afirma que su negocio es rentable porque los ladrillos tienen mucha demanda en el mercado, es por eso que se proyecta a futuro tener más extensiones D. tierra arcillosa para continuar fabricando mayor cantidad D. ladrillos. Es su décimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, le servirá para la compra D. materiales que necesita para la fabricación D. ladrillos.
texts.en:
Francisca is 54 years old. She lives with her husband and the youngest of their children. Six years ago, she decided to exploit as much as possible the resources she has in her land, which is rich in clay. This was very good for making bricks. Since then she has mass-produced them. She also needed to hire labor, especially people who are experts in brickmaking. As for marketing, she takes care of it herself, offering her bricks for sale at several places in the city. She sells on average 20,000 bricks per month, which helps her cover family expenses. She says her business is profitable because there is high demand for bricks; for this reason she plans to buy more clay-rich land in the future so she can continue making more bricks. This is Francisca's tenth loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support since she has always shown herself to be responsible about her payments. She is also grateful to be part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible people and are very supportive. She thanks the people who will be managing the loan she is requesting, and the loan will be very helpful to her in her business's progress. The loan she is requesting will help her buy materials she needs for brickmaking.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of brickmaking materials

loans.name: Albert Kyalo

texts.en:
Albert is a 34-year-old married man with two children. He owns a butchery as his primary business and also a retail shop. He has been selling meat for a period of about three years now. He has been getting a monthly profit of approximately $385 a month.

He was introduced to KADET by an existing client. He has applied for a loan which he wants to use to buy more stock of cereals like rice, and also beans and green grams (mung beans) for his retail shop. He hopes to improve his standard of living by buying a piece of land where he can build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans and green grams to sell in his retail shop

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina es casada y tiene 7 hijos, D. los cuales 1 vive con ella, Sabina compra cereales variados D. las ferias D. la región en donD. venD. frutas, luego los procesa, tiene un molino en su casa en donD. procesa los cereales, sus ventas los realiza en los mercados D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Sabina tiene el deseo D. comprar otro molino moderno para mejorar su negocio.
Sabina es socia del Banco Comunal Delfín y solicita un crédito D. 1000 soles para la compra D. cebada y trigo.
texts.en:
Sabina is married and has 7 children, one of whom lives with her. Sabina buys various types of cereals from the street markets of the region where she sells fruit. She has a mill in her house where she processes the cereals and then sells them in the markets of Ayacucho. She wants to buy a modern mill to improve her business. Sabina is a member of the communal bank Delfín and she's requesting a loan of 1,000 soles ($375) for the purchase of barley and wheat.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of barely and wheat

loans.name: Gulzoda's Group

texts.en:
Gulzoda K. is the leader of this group. She is 45 and married. She has three sons: the first son works in Russia, the second is a construction worker and the youngest son is at school. Gulzoda works as a teacher at a school and her husband is a butcher. They also breed cattle and sell it, after fattening, at a higher price. In this way they make 3000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, Gulzoda wants to purchase cattle for breeding. In the future, she wants to purchase a piece of land and start building a house for her son.

Muminahon T., 47, is married. She has two sons and a daughter. The son work in Russia and the daughter is at school. Her husband went to work in Russia too. Muminahon herself works as a teacher at school; she also breeds livestock. She applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase sheep in order to increase her number of livestock. In the future she plans to start repairing her house. 

Mohirahon M. is the treasurer of the group. She is 27 and divorced. She has a two year old daughter. In order to make money Mohirahon breeds livestock. She sells sheep each month, in this way she makes 2000 soms per month. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase sheep, in order to resell it at a higher price, after fattening. 

Ulduzhon A., 35, is married. She has a son and two daughters. The son and the first daughter are at school, and the second daughter is newborn.  Ulduzhon is a teacher at school and her husband works as a driver. They also breed livestock to make money. Selling some animals each month, they made 3000 soms. That profit made it possible for them to save money and to build a shed. With money received from the loan, Ulduzhon wants to purchase sheep for breeding. In the future she wants to provide her children with a good education, to purchase a piece of land and build a house for her son.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila S. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 45 years old. Teofila is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Teofila owns & operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling coconuts in the local community. Teofila has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Teofila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Teofila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional coconuts to sell. Teofila is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Teofila from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Davlatbek

texts.ru: Эгамбердиев Давлатбек проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 60 лет. Женат, имеет 11 детей. Дети занимаются растениеводством. Сам Давлатбек имеет высшее образование. Он закончил академию, то есть высшую школу Милиции. По профессии проработал более 20 лет. Сейчас клиент занимается животноводством. Он разводит скот у себя дома. В основном Давлатбек разводит скот в дальнейшем для перепродажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en: Davlatbek E. lives in the J. Rumy district.  He is 60 years old, married and has 11 children.  His children are involved in agriculture.  Davlatbek has a higher education.  He graduated from an academy, i.e. top police school.  He spent 20 years working in that field.  Now the client is involved in animal husbandry.  He breeds livestock at home.  Davlatbek primarily breeds livestock for future resale.  He has been in this business for 10 years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock, in order to increase its quantity.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita S. is optimistic that her sewing business will produce a steady income to improve her economic stability and her family’s quality of life.  Her long term dreams are to keep on supporting her children’s education and to have a successful tailoring shop someday. Nenita would like to receive a loan to purchase inventory to continue her sewing business including cotton fabrics and other materials needed in her business.  As a member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, Nenita is thankful for the access to loans to support her dreams and the encouragement. Her hard work and patience are her foundation in achieving a better life for her and her family.

loans.use: To purchase cotton fabrics and other materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “PACHA ILLAIRY ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Ocongate perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Juan;   él tiene  42 años de edad, es casado  y tiene 4 hijos,  El socio es natural de Ocongate,  Él socio trabajaba de forma independiente haciendo construcciones de casas, de muros para terrenos y de jaulas, también tiene como actividad la agricultura, el trabaja con una señora que es la dueña de unos terrenos en el pueblo y él se encarga de hacer el sembrado y la cosechas de papa, el socio también trabaja como obrero cuando se requiere de uno. El socio desea el préstamo para poder  invertir en la compra de semillas porque en esta ocasión trabajara al partir mitad a mitad con la dueña del terreno. El socio solicita el préstamo para compra semillas y sembrar este año para la cosecha del año entrante.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Juan belongs to the “PACHA ILLAIRY” community bank.  The bank is located in the district of Ocongate, in the province of Quispicanchis, in the department of Cusco.

Juan is 42 years old.  He is married and has 4 children.  He was born in Ocongate.  He works independently building houses, walls to go round plots of land and cages.  He also farms.  He works with a lady who is the owner of some plots of land in the village and he is in charge of sowing and harvesting potatoes.  He also works as a laborer when one is needed.  He would like this loan so that he can invest in the purchase of seeds because on this occasion he will work sharing half and half with the landowner.  He would like the loan to buy seeds to sow this year for harvest next year.

Juan is grateful for the loan and he appreciates it.  He pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy seeds to sow this year for harvest next year

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a 30-year-old man married to a farmer with four children living in his own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He owns a retail shop and has been in the business for one year. He is faced with the challenge of failing to meet the high demands of his customers due to limited capital. David needs the credit facility to purchase merchandise to sell.

loans.use: To purchase general merchadise

loans.name: Mentor

texts.es:
Mentor C. B. tiene 37 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUZ Y PROGRESO se encuentra ubicada 20 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y otras labores profesionales, en esta ventanilla son 17 socios.

Mentor se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Compra sus productos en Chillanes y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajando y dar el estudio a los hijos.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Mentor C. B. is 37 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and children in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.  He has three children.

The 'Luz y Progreso' (Light and Progress) solidarity group is located 20 minutes from the Chillanes office, in Chillanes canton.  This group is engaged in farming and other professional tasks.  The group has 17 members.

Mentor is a farmer and he grows corn, beans, peas and 'chocho' (a type of bean native to the region).  He buys his products in Chillanes and sells them in Chillanes market and district.

Mentor is requesting this loan to buy corn, bean, pea and 'chocho' seeds.  The support of this loan will help him financially to cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as insect infestations, diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to continue working and to provide his children with an education.

Mentor likes taking part in sports.

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Mario

texts.en: Mario is 29 years old and married.  He does welding to earn a living.  He says that he is dedicated to his work and hopes to succeed in his business.  Mario looks for customers from people who are undertaking construction work.  With the loan of 20,000 Kes, he will buy steel iron sheet for welding windows and doors.

loans.use: To buy steel iron sheet

loans.name: Nelida Margot

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “URPI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nelida Margot; ella tiene 35 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de golosinas en un Kiosco escolar y también se dedica al trabajo de fisioterapia en forma independiente, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de golosinas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar golosinas como caramelos, chupetes y galletas.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Urpi communal bank. The bank is located in the Cusco district, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

Nelida Margot is 35 years old, has a common-law marriage, and has three children. She alternates her daily activities with her work selling snacks at a school kiosk, and she also works independently in physical therapy. She wants to expand her snack business and is requesting the loan to purchase snacks such as candy, lollipops and cookies.

Nelida Margot is happy for the loan and she promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: To purchase snacks such as candy, lollipops and cookies.

loans.name: Las Trabajadoras 10 De Octubre Group

texts.es:
LAS TRABAJADORA 10 DE OCTUBRE

Silvia pertenece al grupo de Alcancía Comunal “LAS TRABAJADORAS 10 DE OCTUBRE” reciente mente lleva el cargo de presidenta del grupo el grupo esta conformado por 7 personas que decidieron ponerle ese nombre a su grupo por que las 7 personas son del la misma zona y tanbien son trabajadoras.
Silvia tiene 43 años de edad es madre soltera tiene 1 hijo que es mayor de edad (independientes) Silvia tiene ya 3 años trabajada repartiendo desayunos a los trabajadores de su zona y asta la fecha a logrado comprarse un terreno y comprado artículos para su vivienda y si tuviera un capital de trabajo lo invertiría en poner un restaurante y con la ayuda de Edaprospo-Prosperidad esperemos que lo logre.
texts.en:
Silvia belongs to the 'Las Trabajadoras 10 de Octubre' community bank.  She has recently taken on the role of group president.  This group has 7 members who gave the group its name because they all live in the same area and are workers (trabajadoras).

Silvia is 43 years old.  She is a single mother and has one grown-up child who lives independently.  Silvia has been working for 3 years delivering breakfasts to workers in her area and she has so far managed to buy a plot of land and items for her home.  If she had working capital, she would invest it in setting up a restaurant.  With the help of Edaprospo-Prosperidad we hope that she will achieve this.

loans.use: Her home

loans.name: Danny Lusby

texts.es:
Danny tiene 36 años, es conviviente y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, el cual se caracteriza por producir el limón con mejor calidad en el Perú.  Este distrito se ubica a 2 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la Región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta  aves domésticas en unos ambientes situados cerca a su domicilio, una vez que estos alcanzan un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta en el mercado de su localidad. El negocio le sirve para ayudar a su familia con el sostenimiento del hogar.

Danny desea ampliar su negocio comprando más animales y alimento balanceado de modo que sus animales se desarrollen de mejor modo y puedan ser vendidos a un mejor precio. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Danny is 26 years old, in a common law relationship, living with her family in Olmos district, which is known for producing Perú’s highest quality lemons.  This district is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital.

She raises domestic fowl in enclosures located near her house.  Once they reach a good level of development she sells them in the local market.  The business helps her support her family and household.

Danny wants to expand the business buying more animals and nutritionally balanced feed for them so that they will develop better and be sold for a better price.  To reach her objective, therefore, she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan.

loans.use: To buy more animals and nutritionally balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Bun M., 39, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. M. sells duck eggs, earning an income of approximately $5 per day. Her husband is a farmer and raises cows to sell, earning an income of about $4 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $52 on food and $25 on the other necessary expenses. 

M. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase more cows to raise and sell. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy more cows to raise for sale

loans.name: Carla

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Carla; La socia tiene 45 años de edad, la socia es casada, la socia trabaja  en el gobierno regional como personal administrativo y paralelamente a esto ella vende los productos de la empresa Omnilife, ella nos comenta que dicha empresa es de salud y y producen sustancias alimenticias, la socia nos comenta que los productos de esta empresa son muy cotizados por el público, la socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de productos de esta empresa y seguir vendiendo.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Carla belongs to the “Patron San Sebastian” Communal Bank, which is located in the district of Huanchac, in the province of Cusco, in the department of Cusco.
Carla is 45 years old, married and works for the regional government as an administrative assistant. She also sells products made by Omnilife, a health food company that makes nutritional supplements. Carla says that the company’s products are very popular. She wants the loan to buy Omnilife products for her to continue selling.
She is happy with the provided loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase of nutritional supplements

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua F. sells second hand clothes and provisions at Abura near Frami. Ekua has received a junior high education. She is married and has two children. Her business is quite young and she needs a loan to be able to stock her shop with provisions for resale. Her business objective is to build another shop in a different locality.

loans.use: to stock her shop with provisions to sell

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José Luis nació en la ciudad de Cusco donde se encuentra la ciudadela Inca de Machupicchu (Cusco, Perú), él tiene 48 años de edad,  tiene su pareja con quien cuatro hijos. Actualmente, Jose Luis vive en la ciudad del Cusco donde hay hermosos casas, calles históricas donde vivieron antes los Incas, él es una persona trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia, él brinda servicio de transporte urbano, él tiene su propio carro y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del carro.  

José Luis es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Puntualito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
José Luis was born in the city of Cusco where the Inca citadel, Machupicchu, is found (Cusco, Perú).  He’s 48 years old and he and his spouse have four children.  He currently lives in Cusco where there are beautiful houses and historic streets where the Inca used to live.  He is a hard working person who supports his family providing public transportation services.  He owns his car and on this occasion needs a loan to service his car.

José Luis is a responsible person who is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Puntualito” (Right on Time) communal bank in the city of Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to service his vehicle.

loans.name: Misaley

texts.en:
Ms. Misaley D. is from the village of Bañadero, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old. Misaley is single and has one school-age child. To make a living, Misaley owns and operates a hydraulic parts business. Misaley has been engaged in her business for more than seven years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In September 2010, Misaley joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Misaley has successfully repaid a loan of 15,000 PHP. Misaley is now requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional hydraulic parts. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially meeting their basic needs, savings for future use, loan repayment and education of her child.

About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional hydraulic parts

loans.name: Reiman

texts.es: Reiman A. C., tiene la edad de 26 años, está casado  y vive con su hijo y su esposa que son sus mayores prioridades. El lo que pretende es hacer la compra de los insumos y fertilizantes y así hacer una buena siembra del cultivo y en el momento más apto para sembrar. El  cuenta con el terreno apto y la experiencia para desarrollar un buen cultivo. El quiere generar los ingresos necesarios para una mejor calidad de vida en el futuro   y poderle dar el estudio al hijo en su momento. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Reiman A. C. is 26 years old, married, and lives with his wife and son who are his highest priorities. He plans to purchase supplies and fertilizers so that he can achieve a good crop and provide the most suitable conditions for planting. Reiman has adequate land and experience in producing a good crop. He wants to generate the necessary income to achieve a better quality of life and provide his son with an education.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. Reiman has not had any other previous loans with the state banks. FUDECOSUR is providing this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and supplies for planting beans.

loans.name: Aracely Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Aracely del Carmen de 27 años se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 3 años  en sus comienzos vendía solo ropa interior luego con los prestamos empezó a surtir su negocio.  Ella invertirá el crédito en mercadería en especial para el día de las madres.
Ella es madre soltera y tiene una niña de 6 años quien es su motivación.
texts.en:
Aracely del Carmen, 27, has been selling clothes for the last three years.  At the beginning, she only sold underwear but with the loans she began to stock her business.  She will use the loan to buy special merchandise for Mother’s Day.

She is a single mother of a 6-year-old daughter who is her motivation.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Mariuxi Yesenia

texts.es:
Mariuxi Yesenia tiene 30 años, vive en union libre con el compañero y un hijo de 8 años que se llama Dannia en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. EL RECREO se encuentra ubicada en el Cantón Ventanas, se encuentra ubicada en el sector del recinto San Vicente de las Lomas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol y soya.

Mariuxi se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz, arroz y soya en terrenos de los padres, las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos es la competencia y la variación del clima. Su sueño es que el negocio cresca para tener ingresos para no pasar necesidades.

Le gusta bailar y salir de paseo con la familia.
texts.en:
Mariuxi Yesenia, age 30, lives with her common-law partner and 8-year-old son named Dannia in the Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Rios.

The communal bank "EL RECREO" is located in Ventanas Canton in the San Vicente sector of Las Lomas.  This group is involved in farm activity, growing short-cycle crops such as corn, rice, beans and soy.

Mariuxi grows corn, rice and soy on her parents' land.  She makes her purchases in Ventanas and sells at the fairs every day, especially on Sunday.

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.  The loan will help her economically to cover her expenses.  Her greatest challenges are the competition and weather variation.  Her dream is to grow her business to increase income so she does not have to go without basic needs.

She likes to dance and go out for walks with her family.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosa Benilda

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Quiroga se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rosa. Tiene 47 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y a pesar de que lleva varios años comprometida no ha podido tener hijos, con ella vive un sobrino que lo crio desde pequeño y es como si fuera su hijo el ya es mayor de edad. Su marido es albañil.

Es una muy buena ama de casa que para ayudar a su marido con los gastos del hogar se dedica a dos actividades, una a la compra y venta de maní, ella compra el producto en grano a los comerciantes en Calceta el mismo que traslada a su casa donde lo cocina y muele para después entregarlo  a su hermana que lo lleva a Santo Domingo, su hermana entrega a clientes o tiendas del lugar, dice que allá su producto se vende a muy buen precio. Su otra actividad es la cría de animales de corral ya que esto también le deja algo de ganancia. Trabaja sola todos los días siete horas al día.

Este crédito es para comprar maní, pollos y comida para estos para que tengan un buen desarrollo. Este es su sexto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy cumplidas.
 
Sus sueños son tener un carro y gozar de buena salud ella y los suyos.
texts.en:
The communal bank Quiroga meets every two weeks in Quiroga parish in the city Calceta.  The people of this area, by and large, farm, raise animals, and sell their products.  This is where we met Sra. Rosa.  Rosa, 47, lives with her partner, but even after living together for years she has not been able to have children.  Her nephew, that she has raised since he was little, lives with her and is like a son.  He now an adult. Her husband works in construction.  

Sra. Rosa is good housewife who helps her husband with the household expenses by working two jobs.  She buys and sells peanuts.  She buys the product as a grain from merchants in Calceta, brings them home, cooks and grinds them and then gives them to her sister who takes them to Santo Domingo.  Her sister delivers them to customers or stores in the area.  It's said that she sells her product at a good price.  Her other job is raising animals in a pen.  This is another way she makes some money.  She works alone for 7 hours a day.  

This loan is to purchase peanuts, chickens, and feed that will help them grow.  This is her sixth period with the Communal Bank and she likes it because her companions do what they say they are going to do.  She dreams of having her own car and for her and her family to be in good health.

loans.use: Purchase peanuts, chickens, and animal feed.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 48 years old. She is single with 3 school-aged children.
 
Helen has a shop that sells coco wine, snacks, canned goods, noodles and more. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional stock to sell like coco wine, snack goods, juices, spices and more.

Helen has been a member of HSPFI for this year, 2011.  In the future, Helen hopes to improve her business to provide the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional coco wine and snack goods to sell

loans.name: Duo Jenesareth Group

texts.es:
DUO  GENEZARETH.
ESTA INTEGRADO POR LAS SIGUIENTES SOCIAS FLORIDALMA ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE TORTILLAS DESDE HACE TRES AÑOS, ELLA TIENE  A SUS HIJOS YA GRANDEA LOS QUE LA APOYAN EN SU NEGOCIO ELLA ES VIUDA Y NECESITA SU CREDITO PARA PODER COMPRAR MAIZ PARA LA ELAVORACION DE TORTILLAS Y  AMPLIAR SU NEGOCIO PORQUE  TIENE MAS CLIENTELA Y QUIERE PONER OTROS PRODUCTOS A LA VENTA. ROXANA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA  DE PRODUCTOS DE CONSUMO DIARIO ELLA QUIERE SURTIR MAS SU NEGOCIO PARA OBTENER MEJORES GANANCIAS Y PODER AYUDAR A SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Duo Genezareth is made up of the following members:
 Floridalma.  She has sold tortillas for the past three years.  Her children are already grown and they help her with her business.  She is a widow and needs the loan to buy corn to make tortillas and to grow her business.  She has many customers and she wants to also sell other products.

Roxana. sell food products every day. She wants to supply her business for more income so that she can help her family.

loans.use: To buy corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
Apolonia is married with five children. She is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines.
Apolonia is a farmer who grows crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan for 10,500 PHP to purchase fertilizers for raising her crops. Apolonia has been a member of Kiva partner, PMPC, for three years.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for raising crops.
